places.name: Fat Boy Kitchen
places.main_category: Hong Kong style fast food restaurant
categories: Hong Kong style fast food restaurant
places.address: Fat Boy Kitchen, 6943 Victoria Dr, Vancouver, BC V5P 3Y7

featured_reviews.review_id:
Food is decent, and common restaurant food you would normally find in Hong Kong. The staff is quite friendly even though the restaurant is packed, you almost always need to wait 10 to 30 minutes to get a table. So what makes this attractive to so many people?

The size is way more than generous, especially for today's economy in 2023. Be prepared to bring a takeaway box (unless you don't mind paying 50 cents for a paper box from the restaurant). One final note: the default tips amount is less than 15%, which is something you don't see anymore in today's Vancouver.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I will make this review straight to the point. As this restaurant already has a good track record via other reviews, I think this place is more mediocre compared to other HongKong style kitchens. Why, you may ask? Well, the main reason was because there was nothing special about it. The only thing that sparked my interest was the pork chop sandwich, which didn't get me wrong, tasted good, but everything else (excluding customer service) was lacking. From the food to the seating (which I mind you are half car seats half regular chairs) limited my comfort during my eating experience.

The meal I had was the problem chop sandwich, although good, lacked balance between freshness and saltiness. All you can realistically taste are the savory flavors of the marinated porkchop (and baking soda, which makes it tender) the mayo and a bit of the onions. On top of that, the sandwich came with a big bed of fries, which adds onto the savory oily pork chop. Also, the Hong Kong style milk tea tastes the same as any other H.K Cafe within Metro Vancouver.

My friends' satay noodles were plain and full of msg (like the majority), nothing really special at all. The breakfast meal is decent in terms of taste but is a bang for your buck. You get to try multiple items for a decent price. Comes with a drink also. Again, nothing surprising compared to any other H.K style Cafe.

To leave this mediocre review with a high note, the customer service was nice. The waitress noticed my fries were missing and quickly asked the chef to cook the fries fresh for me and apologized. In my opinion, it's not a big gripe, which is why I would give this place a solid 3 stars. I would recommend giving this place a try for most, but it can be a hit or miss (depending on what you order)

featured_reviews.review_id: Food and portions are really good! Prices are reasonable for what you get. I am a big guy and I had to pack some of the food home.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Very unassuming restaurant with clean interior.

BIG portion, and fairly priced it's the definite stand-out. We got the Laksa with grilled chicken and fish fillet with creamy sauce and spaghetti both are incredibly delicious and filling.

The cold drinks (milk tea and lemon tea) are typical run of the mill drinks, tasty and not too sweet.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Gold star to the chef at the grill. The meats here are always executed to technical perfection: juicy and tender with crispy but not greasy skin.

Given this is a small restaurant with only 9 tables, I'm impressed by the diversity and quality of the food. Furthermore impressed that most meals are at the $10 and $15 price points.

Beef and mushroom sandwich: Was eclipsed by the fries, which were prepared my favourite way, with batter and crispy. The sandwich was nice too, lots of beef, tender and cooked medium rare the way I like. Only complaint was that there was some cartilage in the meat, which I had to cut out.

Panko-fried pork chops: Again, lots of meat, two chops, which were tender, juicy, and just gently seasoned, the way I like.

Chicken rice noodle soup had a perfectly  grilled boneless chicken thigh with crispy skin.

Mixed grill: All meats grilled to textural perfection. Enough food for 2 people. Onion gravy good with fries.

Service excellent, attentive, friendly, with a personal touch.

featured_reviews.review_id: The portion is big and the crispy bun is a must-try item. Laksa is quite good and could be even better if the coconut flavor is stronger. The portion of pork chop with rice is HUGE and good for sharing. Service is excellent and the owner may walk around and check with each customer on seeking their feedback during the off-peak session. Definitely one of the best value for money restaurant in town.

places.name: East is East
places.address: East is East, 4433 Main St, Vancouver, BC V5V 0A2

featured_reviews.review_id:
An amazing combination of all sort of foods from silk road.
The atmosphere is great. We had a stupendous night.

Variety of Persian, Afghan, Indian and middle eastern dishes.

Idea of feast menu is very unique and attractive. You will get small tasting portion of every dish bottomless.
The only thing I did like much was that manager was keep reminding that it is not sharable. Although we had everyone ordered at least a main course.

Furniture is not super comfy but yet gives you a good feeling.

Good live music.

Free parking is available.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I have been here a few times and every time they am amazed by their service and food! 

First, you are greeted with their refreshing ginger lemon tea  The food taste, portion size and quality is just perfect! They have 5-6 dishes in both vegetarian and non-vegetarian recipes and you can get try pretty much all of them with different combinations which I think is the best way to explore their entire menu!!  The food is a fusion of Indian and Mediterranean cuisine and plated in a Nutritious way which is cherry on top! 

This place has a great ambiance and located is at a great location; convenient for people taking public transportation as well as driving. Street parking is available on Main Street and on side streets.

They have a very friendly and welcoming staff which I feel elevates the whole experience!!

Definitely, going back again!!

featured_reviews.review_id: Had a really nice experience here. Saw a lot of couples and can see why, it is a nice and interesting atmosphere for a date night. The night we came there happened to be live music which was really nice. Food was pretty good although a bit on the pricier end. Their portions are good so come with an appetite. Our server was attentive, my water never was low. I'd come here again for a nice evening out.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Edited review.  Came back for dinner on a busy Fri night with live music.  I didn't appreciate the artist looking at me each time I looked up and saw her looking at me.

The tables are sooooo cramped making it a really uncomfortable dining experience where the people next to you can hear everything you say. You might as well be having dinner with a bunch of strangers.  I might come back on a quieter day when it's not as busy.  There are definitely better restaurants in town.

We had a great dinner.  The space is unique, spacious and the service was good.  It was a little bit cold as we were seated close to the entrance and there was a huge draft.  The table seated next to us was a bit too close for comfort.

Overall, the food and service was good. Not perfect but I'll be coming back and recommending to friends.  The chai tea is really good!

featured_reviews.review_id:
My family dined here this evening. My channa masala roti wrap was great and flavourful. The $43 tasting menu has good items like the Afghan eggplant, alu gobi channa masala, and lamb curry, but we didn't like the mango butternut squash, chicken masala, and chicken kebab. The items we didn't like tasted sweet, not savoury.
The stuffed roti with yam was sweet, but okay.
The portion sizes were good for the cost.
I liked the vegan khir but it's cold and I would prefer it to be warm.
I love the cardamom cookie!
The masala soy chai was awesome.
They have items to accommodate all dietary restrictions so we would eat here again.
The servers were attentive and explained the menu well.
The place is pretty and spacious.
The bathroom was clean too.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Definitely 5/5.
This place is known for their Chai Feast Menu, a buffet, starting with a salad, soup, rice, boulani(aloo parhata) and 2 mains. The dishes come in small portions, you can keep ordering more of different dishes.
We tried most dishes on the menu, everything tasted quite authentic and great, nothing we hated. Honestly it was great.
Chai was fantastic too.
The price of the Chai Feast was 33 CAD.

featured_reviews.review_id: As visitors in Vancouver, we chose East is East Main location for my bday celebration. First impressions, the architecture and decor is superb and a delight for the visual senses. Despite being a busy Saturday evening, we were greeted promptly and courteously by the front desk. The hospitality was fantastic- we were offered a delicious tea and boulani while waiting for our table. We were seated close to the "stage". The table was quite small for our group of 4. And although the chairs were beautifully handcrafted, they were not comfortable. We each selected the feast. At $43 pp, it was a great way to taste the menu. I would suggest having a similar tasting option for children at a reduced rate. Our favourite items were the joojeh chicken kebab, lamb curry, Tibetan mantu, and the peas with cheese. Service was prompt for the most part although the chicken kebabs did take a while longer. The servers were friendly and courteous nonetheless. The violin music in the background was a nice touch. Overall highly recommend you visit this beautiful restaurant and delight your senses! Thanks for the bday gesture of song and gulab jamun :)

places.name: Chambar Restaurant
places.description: Chic exposed-brick space serving creative Belgian cuisine & sustainable seafood, plus beer & wine.
places.address: Chambar Restaurant, 568 Beatty St, Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3

featured_reviews.review_id: Brunch on the thanksgiving long weekend. Busy day. We were seated at the back of the main floor. The space between tables is quite narrow - less than an arm's length. We asked for low sodium on both dishes and the mussels are still on the salty side. Food is quite delicious. Decent portion. Nice decorations. Will visit again.

featured_reviews.review_id: Fantastic cocktails and well made food. Service was friendly and the restaurant is clean and tidy. What more can you ask for? Oh, the prices are reasonable too!
featured_reviews.review_text: Fantastic cocktails and well made food. Service was friendly and the restaurant is clean and tidy. What more can you ask for? Oh, the prices are reasonable too!

featured_reviews.review_id: Visited Chambar with our company and it was a great experience. Had a great table by the window and service was outstanding. Lots of attention to detail. All the appetizers were very tasty and well presented. Great chill atmosphere as well. Only negative really was the bay closing early on a Sunday. But we bounced next door to the pub to enjoy our last rounds. Great spot and the signature lamb dish was amazing. Enjoy!

featured_reviews.review_id: Had a great experience at Chambar! We were seated very quickly and our waitress Shayla was amazing. Food and drinks came out in a timely manner, food was great, atmosphere was great. Overall an amazing first impression. Will absolutely be coming back :)
featured_reviews.review_text: Had a great experience at Chambar! We were seated very quickly and our waitress Shayla was amazing. Food and drinks came out in a timely manner, food was great, atmosphere was great. Overall an amazing first impression. Will absolutely be coming back :)

featured_reviews.review_id: The food itself in terms of quality and taste were pretty fantastic, although I will admit that this is not my preferred cuisine, I did not mind trying it out. The sauce for the shrimp appitizer is absolutely divine, it was probably my favourite dish out of everything that we ordered. As well as the penne cotta dessert, we shared one, but I could have easily ate two to myself because it was honestly that great. Everything else was not bad, but nothing I would write home about. The ambience of the resturant is a dark and loud because of how packed it was. Overall, not bad, but I likely would not come back because it is not my preference.

featured_reviews.review_id: An unforgettable dining experience! Chambar Restaurant impressed me with its delectable cuisine and charming ambiance. The menu offers a delightful mix of traditional and innovative dishes, and their attention to using locally-sourced ingredients is commendable. The staff's passion for food and top-notch service made the evening even more enjoyable. If you're a food enthusiast looking for a standout gem, Chambar is the place to be!

The staff's passion for food and top-notch service made the evening even more enjoyable. If you're a food enthusiast looking for a standout gem, Chambar is the place to be!

featured_reviews.review_id:
One of my favorite places to dine in Vancouver, from start to finish this place cares a lot about their guest experience. Professional, polished service. Kitchen is always putting out impeccable food, menu composition is stellar, something for everyone. I've been for Brunch and Dinner many times and have always had the Best time here.

First time having their espresso martini and honestly one of the best I have ever had! Thank you for doing such an amazing job and taking such great care of your patrons!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Came to Chambar for a wedding, the entire basement was the private event, great for small events, can get stuffy.

Service was amazing, but most importantly the food was so good. I had the lamb shank, it was super tender, fall off the bone delicious. There was enough for 2 meals.

Definitely has the old town vibe, but yet not tacky. Every server was nice and the bartender was great all night. Will be back on my own to try their full menu.

featured_reviews.review_id:
A tiny place with a lot of potential! They won't take your credit card though, only cash or debit.

We ordered the Nasi Lemak and Laksa. The Laksa I ordered was a bit on the sweet side and it seemed to lack a bit of salt. But it was still pretty good. I know it need more salt cause the one I had tried in Singapore was a lot spicier and had the salty umami.

The Nasi Lemak did not taste like the rice had been in coconut milk. And my wife felt like the rice also seemed undercooked, or perhaps it had dried out because the rice was quite firm.

Overall, this place has a lot of potential, but I would hope that those 2 dishes become their best executions because that is what Singapore and Malaysia are known for.

I hope you come back and try some more!

I always love coming here; the food is delicious, prices are great and the serving sizes are huge. I ordered the laksa which was very filling and is probably about two meals worth of food.

The restaurant is small and is always busy so you might be hard pressed to find somewhere to sit.

featured_reviews.review_id:
love this place!! the staff are nice, I like how they don't provide table service cause I just wanna watch YouTube and eat in peace sometimes

I'd do the dry noodles over the laksa tbh, the fried kuey teow and mee goreng was sooooo good.

the fried fritters are good too but their portions are big so I'd eat those first then eat the mains cause they're easier to pack home, that being said, I did take one of the fritters home to bake cause it was lowkey kinda sogged up from the vinegar sauce (which is so delicious)

featured_reviews.review_id: I walked by this place and saw it advertised selling singapore food. Went in to try. The Fried Kueh Tiao is pretty good. The Mee Pok on the other hand is atrocious and certainly not authentic. No bathroom at this place. It accepts cash and local debit cards for payment, no credit cards. Service is minimal.  Considering the menu prices, i am better off eating at the nearby Shiok Singapore, which offers better services and more authentic dishes that are yummy.

featured_reviews.review_id: If you're looking to try Singaporean and Malaysian cuisine for the first time, this restaurant is a good place to start. The restaurant is small and the decor is a bit outdated, but the food is authentic and delicious. I ordered the Laksa, which was flavorful but a bit too spicy for my taste. While I was eating, I didn't realize that there was a small heater right next to me, which made me sweat through my meal. I also ordered some Hainan chicken to go and it was very tasty. The prices here are the cheapest you'll find in Vancouver and the portion sizes are fair. Overall, I would recommend this restaurant for takeout but not for dining in.

places.name: Fiorino, Italian Street Food Chinatown Vancouver

owner.name: Fiorino, Italian Street Food Chinatown Vancouver (Owner)

places.address: Fiorino, Italian Street Food Chinatown Vancouver, 212 E Georgia St, Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z7

featured_reviews.review_id:
I went here to grab a quick lunch with my friends. It's a nice spot in Chinatown area with clean but cozy aesthetics.

The waiter was friendly and very fast and the food was pretty great.

I got their Maialona sandwich which was fantastic. I wish they went heavier on the pesto but other than that, it was very tasty.

We also got Cotoletta sandwich and Pappardelle al Ragu di Cinghiale. I thought that the ragu could have had more meat and I've had better pappardelle noodles, but the sauce was good.

Overall, I enjoyed my experience here and would come back!

featured_reviews.review_id: I went here for my friend's birthday and we throughly enjoyed it. The ambiance was cozy and homey, it was perfect for the winter. I really enjoyed that the food here was made to be shared like a family style dinner making it really enjoyable and memorable. Food here was great and the house wine, it really can't get any better especially with the price. Starting off with the Panzanella and Carpaccio with red wine was delightful. For the main we got the half Rosticciana and the Gnocchetti and ended off with a birthday Tiramisu. It was perfect portion for the three of us to share!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Had an amazing dinner at this Michelin Bib Gourmand restaurant in Vancouver. We said we wanted to get their $55 tasting menu and they picked a delicious selection from their menu to try. Everything was seriously great. I will return very soon to try their lunch menu, which features sandwiches using the amazing Pane Casalingo bread!

1) Arancini - well balanced risotto balls with delicate flavours topped off with a nice pesto sauce
2) Pane Casalingo - this bread is seriously amazing and why I'm going to go back soon to try their lunch. They serve sandwiches with this bread at lunch!
3) Panzanella (missing from photos, too busy enjoying food) - nice fresh salad with a sweet sherry vinaigrette. I love the vanilla pickled strawberries they add in there.
4) Carpaccio - high quality beef with  "ubriacato di vino" buffalo cheese
5) Rosticciana - braised ribs where the meat just falls off the bone with a gentle nudge. The smoked cherry glaze was so amazing I had to stop myself from licking the plate.
6) Ravioli al Nero di Seppia - squid ink ravioli with sweetcorn that pairs so nice with the lobster and prawns
7) Coccoli e Proscuitto - this is a ** MUST TRY **. Deep fried dough is very unique and paired with whipped stracchino cheese and 18 month Prosciutto di Parma makes it an incredibly delicious must try.
8) Gnocchetti - excellent texture on this Gnocchetti, which is a smaller gnocchi. The flavours are wonderful. I loved that there was a bit of spicy kick to it.
9) Torta all'olio - I love the citrus from the orange balancing out the slight sweetness of the cake
10) Tiramisu - this Tiramisu is very nice. It has a darker espresso flavour, not acidic, which I really like and the cake overall is sweet, but definitely not overly sweet.

featured_reviews.review_id: Went for dinner when a restaurant we wanted to go to had a LONG wait. So glad we ended up here! My younger daughter can't have dairy and we were pleasantly surprised she had enough options, plus our server let us know we could get the gnocchi with red sauce to avoid dairy. Whole family left happy and full! My husband wishes he could get the recipe for the cherry sauce they have for the ribs and my older daughter wishes we could get more of the ravioli!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Service was awesome, food was outstanding.

We stopped in for something quick before a reservation somewhere else and we were happy we did!

The staff were super accommodating, recommending what we could get in our half hour time frame. We had two cocktails and the carpaccio, it was the best I've had in my life. The timing was great, the bartender serving us was super attentive, so at no point did we feel rushed.

We love it so much we returned the next morning to try their sandwich menu. Fresh ingredients, chill vibe, and the verde nigroni was delicious.

Thanks to the team for a lovely meal!

featured_reviews.review_id: Arancini with hazelnut pesto... that might've been the best pesto I've ever had. Beef tenderloin carpaccio with buffalo cheese and red wine mayonnaise was the top 2 carpaccios I've had. Honestly I'm not a huge fan of Italian relative to other cuisines; I was very very impressed by this experience. FYI octopus was good and not over cooked at all, but wasn't much different from any other restaurant that does octopus well.

places.name: Hungry Guys Kitchen & Bar
places.description: Snug counter-serve with health-conscious burritos & bowls, with organic tofu & brown rice options.
places.address: Hungry Guys Kitchen & Bar, 988 Granville St, Vancouver, BC V6Z 1L2

featured_reviews.review_id:
Review for Hungry Guys in Vancouver

Had the pleasure of stumbling upon this cozy Mexican-themed bar & restaurant while shopping around Vancouver on vacation. I was initially drawn in by their enticing drink specials -- $3.49 shots including choices like Jose Cuervo tequila, Malibu coconut rum, Fireball cinnamon whiskey, and both red and blue kamikazes. They didn't just win me over with their drink menu; their food options seemed diverse and delectable. I had just finished eating, but I had watched several other patrons, absolutely devour their tacos and burgers, and they look really good!!!

The ambiance is warm and welcoming, with rustic countertops, soft seating, and high ceilings that give a spacious feel to the intimate setting. One of the standout features was the partially open kitchen; it's always reassuring to see a clean and well-maintained culinary space. I saw staff constantly making aa cleanliness effort.

Tayanne was my server for most of the evening, and her friendly demeanour made me feel as if I was catching up with an old friend. Later, Vesa took over, ensuring the service quality remained impeccable. The presence of an attentive manager overseeing operations added an extra layer of professionalism.

For solo travellers like myself or anyone for that matter, this spot guarantees comfort and a fantastic dining experience. If you're out shopping at Marshalls, Sephora, or any nearby "luxe" stores and fancy a reasonably priced meal/snack or quick drink, I highly recommend this gem. It's a wonderful place to unwind, whether you choose the bar or a comfy table. Cheers to a memorable experience!

featured_reviews.review_id: Long standing Thai restaurant in the community. Their curry is creamy and flavourful and their Tom Yum soup is a must order, it's hard to find Tom yum that is so bold with flavour and acidity. Pad see ew has been good too but might be on the slight saltier side. Service always has been great. Their hours is tough though as they only open for 4 hours daily now.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Pros: Highly recommend Thai Restaurant in Vancouver. The food is excellent! We tried Pad Thai, Pad Thai woon sen, Thai (Chicken) Satay and Thai Tea. Reserving a table is necessary because they are always fully booked. The staff are great in customer service.

Cons: The venue is an open area (without walls separating the tables) so it may be irritating if other customers talk very loudly without considering other customers.

places.name: Vegan Fried Chick' UN
places.address: Vegan Fried Chick' UN, 5932 Fraser St, Vancouver, BC V5W 2Z7

featured_reviews.review_id:
I really wanted to love this place, but it fell a bit short. I came here to use my Plant Curious coupons, so ordered 2 vegan crepes (mango cream cheese and blueberry cream cheese), a gluten free classic pulled chick'un burger, and 3 chick'un tenders. There was only 1 lady working; she took the orders up front and prepared the food in the open kitchen space right behind the counter. We waited around 15 minutes for our order. When we went to pick up our food, one thing we did notice was that the staff member wasn't wearing gloves when handling the food, so we only trust that they were properly sanitizing in-between working up front and in the kitchen. She was friendly.

The chick'un tenders were the best part of the order. They had a crispy exterior and retained a meaty texture despite being vegan. The spices in the batter gave them a small kick of flavour. The crepes were disappointing, but because we got them at 2-for-1, it was fair for that price. We weren't sure if there was supposed to be more filling ("cream cheese") in-between the crepe folds, but it was primarily the fruit sauce on top that gave it flavour. The blueberry may have had a small amount of blueberry sauce inside, but there was no "cream cheese" to be found that we could see/taste. We were left wondering if it was mixed into the sauce. At a regular $10 each, we'd pass on this as it was otherwise a plain crepe with some sauce on top. The burger was decent and the vegan mayo and cheese options were appreciated. I only got the classic, so it was quite plain, but the chick'un had a soy-forward flavour that was passable as a meat substitute. The gluten free bun was one of the better buns I've had (fluffy and not flat).

The shop also sells different desserts (I'd assume made in house based on the packaging), and treats from other vendors and plant-based brands. Not everything is vegan, so I'd advise you to check the labels/menu and ask staff if you're unsure. If I was in the area, I'd recommend stopping by for the chick'un tenders or a treat as they're open late, but not for the crepes.

featured_reviews.review_id:
3.5 stars
Legit the chicken burger was really good!  I tried the butter chicken poutine and it was way way way way too salty. I'm not sure if it was the sauce or if the fries already had salt as well, but it was just too salty to taste good.  The chicken tenders were really crispy. I liked how they put some Rice Krispies to make it even crispier.  One star is removed because there is no washroom here. How are people going to wash their hands? And since it has a place to sit down, people might need to use the washroom, especially if they need to drink stuff. I would definitely try here though if you are vegan, vegetarian or if you just want to try some vegan chicken. The chickun burger was really my favorite.

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Hi Selena 
Thank you for your honest feedback, we are so glad that you liked our chickun burger and deeply apologize for the poutine being extra salty and will make sure you get 10% off next time when you dine in as it must been have been a mistake from our side otherwise people are usually crazy for our poutine. However, we cannot resolve the washroom issue at this moment but can definitely help you wash hands here. 
Thank you, hope to see you soon.

featured_reviews.review_id:
The name of this establishment starts with "Vegan" but 80% of their offerings are not vegan. From reading older reviews this was an omnivore restaurant, changed core offering to vegan fried chick'un and then pivoted to offer non-vegan (keto and such) items? I don't know, but I was sad about it. Tons of desserts (not labeled) on display and a formidable menu of items, including crepes and waffles, yet only a handful were vegan and less were actually available.

We ordered a vegan waffle, milkshake, and slice of cake. The waffle was good. The odd thing is we watched a full round waffle (4 sections) being made but were only served half (2 sections) of it. What do they do with the other half?? Lol The menu should say "1/2 waffle" if this is the standard serving size!

Vegan milkshake was very watery and not thick at all. Seemed like they don't use ice cream in it? Oatmilk, banana, and syrup? That's not a milkshake....

Vegan presliced cake was okay.

We felt bad for the workers. This establishment does not have AC but did have fans blowing the hot air around. It was ridiculously cooler outside than inside the store. One of the display fridges is open without glass or a plastic shield and was blowing hot air from the lower portion where it is missing a cover plate. This is a viscous cycle... it blows out hot air because it is trying hard to cool the food, but the food area has nothing to contain the cool air, so the motor runs harder, and the hot air gets hotter. These types of food service fridges do not belong in buildings without central air conditioning running.

featured_reviews.review_id: Great vegan spot! Tried the sweet chilli wrap which was great, but had too much sauce in it. I would recommend it but ask for less sauce than usual. They have 3 tables inside for seating.
featured_reviews.review_text: Great vegan spot! Tried the sweet chilli wrap which was great, but had too much sauce in it. I would recommend it but ask for less sauce than usual. They have 3 tables inside for seating.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I love this place! Being vegetarian, it's hard to find a good burger place that serves a good chick'un burger. I've ordered their Buffalo Chick'un Burger multiple times and it's always so satisfying! Their choice of the hot sauce, jalapenos and cheese are a phenomenal combination! Just thinking about it makes me drool  When you take the first bite, you'd be surprised it's not real chicken. It's juicy and chewy and not dry at all! The times I've ordered here, it's always by phone. The staff are super friendly and know my name and order. They also have a huge selection of cakes all from the Cheesecake Factory so you can't go wrong! I've purchased their cakes before and if you're  into creamier, richer cakes, their selection will not disappoint.

A must try for anyone vegetarian/vegan looking for a good chick'un burger and dessert.

Only down side is their pricing :( For just a burger alone, it's $14 +tax. I mean, the size of burger is actually quite big, but still a bit pricy for just a burger  Nonetheless, it is a place I frequent. So give it a try! :)

featured_reviews.review_id: We saw Nightingales rave reviews and decided to give it a try after hearing recommendations on the fried chicken and pizza. While the  atmosphere and service was spectacular, the food was only just okay. Pizza flavours were lacking a bit as was the fried chicken. The family style dishes were great for sharing, but the portions may be smaller for larger sized groups. One recommendation however was the beet salad. The small cubes of perfectly cooked beets paired perfectly with the whipped goat cheese and crunchy toppings

featured_reviews.review_id:
Vij's had some of the best Indian food I've ever tried and I highly recommend it.

+ Food. We ordered a number of vegetarian dishes that were innovative and delicious. The gravy with jackfruit was splendid. The thali was great.

+ Service. Wonderful. We had multiple folks checking in on us and truly made us feel welcome.

+ Location and ambiance. Accessible location and the restaurant was warm, welcoming, and relaxing.

We were visiting Vancouver and would definitely visit Vij's again on another trip.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Last time I've visited Vijs was at their old location long a** time ago. At that time there were line ups people waiting hours and food was amazing.  We finally had a chance to visit again today. We had a reservation for 5 for dinner. There is inside dining area and covered roof top patio. Where we were sat was a very small table for 4 but we were 5 people then they ended up switching us to bigger table afterwards. Inside is extreme dark, and patio was brighter and more airy. You can choose which atmosphere you like to be in.

We ordered salmon appy, beef&lamb kebabs, lingcod/lamb/goat/chicken/beef/veg curry with many drinks.

All the food was Luke warm. Nothing was hot. Maybe we misheard but they said it comes with rice and nann with 5 curry dishes we ordered and we got 4 pieces of nann and one bowl of rice.  I think we ordered 5 extra after.

We got the Indian donut they called it, that was warm and present. Not too sweet and one bite size. Mango kulfi was mangoy and creamy. Coconut rice pudding was a good portion and delicious.

Overall service was good but the food came out really late and Luke warm to cold which wasn't nice.

Not sure if I would be back but we still had a good time.

featured_reviews.review_id: This was overall fine, but more disappointing than expected. The service was shockingly slow and busy, and a lot of customers were visibly angry, but I'll give an extra two stars for Mr. Vij (the owner and celebrity chef, who works there)'s energetic personality and his love for food. The atmosphere is fantastic and I personally loved the presentation. As for the food, we took lamb chops and Bengali chicken curry. I personally loved the lamb chops(their speciality), which were really flavorful and smoky. As for the Bengali curry, it was overall bland for me, but children may like it more, as Mr. Vij says. Overall the food just needs a bit more for five stars, but this restaurant is a great experience.

places.name: #e food
places.description: Modern, low-key shop supplying sandwiches, pizza, take-home meals & deli/grocery items.
places.address: #e food, 1308 Burrard St, Vancouver, BC V6Z 2B7

featured_reviews.review_id:
We stopped by #e food the other day and had a delicious lunch, trying their classic breakfast sandwich and the spicy lemon rosemary chicken sandwich. Their buns are always fresh, made in-house (I think).
The breakfast sandwich was tasty, although the egg was a bit runny for my partner's liking.
I also liked my Spicy Chicken sandwich, but I didn't find it spicy.
We really enjoyed the Sticky Bread Pudding as dessert. Excited to try more of their sweets.
featured_reviews.review_text:

featured_reviews.review_id: Came when it was empty, glad because I get to sit and just enjoy the atmosphere. Staff is absolutely lovely & friendly, my sandwich (lemon rosemary chicken) was delicious and made super quickly. You can tell they love what they make and passionate about clean, healthy food. Their bread is also made in-house!!
featured_reviews.review_text: Came when it was empty, glad because I get to sit and just enjoy the atmosphere. Staff is absolutely lovely & friendly, my sandwich (lemon rosemary chicken) was delicious and made super quickly. You can tell they love what they make and passionate about clean, healthy food. Their bread is also made in-house!!

featured_reviews.review_id: BREAD PERFECTION !! I'm not normally a sandwich person but I have to say this was by far the best sandwich I've ever had in my life.  I had the crispy chicken special (recipe changes weekly) and this time it had truffle in it.  All the components that were in the sandwich from the house made bread to the sauce to the breaded chicken to the fresh greens inside were super fresh, and super tasty and flavourful. So many times a breaded chicken can easily be too dry or too salty but this was pure perfection. I also had a cruffin that had a delightfully light and fresh filling and an oat milk latte and both were also items I would come back for individually as well.  To absolutely nail it on all 3 items is a major feat, and truly a testament to this hole in the wall. Chef's kiss! Will absolutely be back.

featured_reviews.review_id: Really enjoyed the vegetarian sandwich I got the other day and my buddies raved about the Beef Dips that are on special on Fridays. It's a small place so we had to sit outside do I suggest getting your meal to go. The bread they make on site is nothing shortnof amazing. We need more places like this in Vancouver because of the unique meals they offer. This place also does pizza which I have yet to try. It looks delicious though. I will def eat here again.

featured_reviews.review_id: This is one of the best places for a sandwich in Vancouver. They make their own bread, loaded with the best quality. Never disappoint.
featured_reviews.review_text: This is one of the best places for a sandwich in Vancouver. They make their own bread, loaded with the best quality. Never disappoint.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Had a fantastic artisan breakfast at '#e food' this morning.  I had the Breakfast sandwich served on a delicious fresh bun, perfect egg, flavourful tomato and avocado.  Also had the potatoes and a pastry.  I think next time I'll ask for a little creme fraiche or sour cream for the potatoes but even without they were great.

Clearly the staff cares deeply about the quality of their food and even seemed to enjoy being at work.

I got spicy lemon rosemary chicken sandwich , everything was super fresh and tasty, especially vegetables. For sure gonna be back here. Friendly staff and nice sitting area inside and outside of the store .

featured_reviews.review_id: This has been my favourite sandwich shop in downtown for years! I am warmly greeted by Glenn, Rob, and Rodrigo, who make the food with passion and care. They carry the most tasty and fresh gluten free bread that I have ever had. I highly recommend #e for their delicious, fresh and carefully curated menu!

places.name: The Mackenzie Room
places.description: Locally sourced New American eats, plus craft cocktails & beers, served in a rustic-chic locale.
places.address: The Mackenzie Room, 415 Powell St, Vancouver, BC V6A 1G7

featured_reviews.review_id: Excellent food- lots of different flavours. A great example of a tasting menu done very well. Wine pairings also good and varied (all Canadian wines). Servers were excellent but we did feel a bit rushed which took the edge off an otherwise excellent meal.
featured_reviews.review_text: Excellent food- lots of different flavours. A great example of a tasting menu done very well. Wine pairings also good and varied (all Canadian wines). Servers were excellent but we did feel a bit rushed which took the edge off an otherwise excellent meal.

featured_reviews.review_id: Had a wonderful 1st time at the Mackenzie Room on my birthday. As expected, each dish was phenomenal and high quality, all well developed with great flavors.  The staff were incredibly kind and lovely, and I really appreciated how much of an effort they put in to create a cozy dining experience. I sat at the bar and was well attended to, bartender & server all very warm and friendly. They consider the little things in both the service and food. Highly recommended and added to my favorite food list for a revisit.

featured_reviews.review_id:
First off, Patrick was an amazing bartender and host for us sitting at the bar. As it was my birthday the staff gave me a signed card and went out of the way to make the dinning experience world class.

From unique shared menu for two that I highly recommended to cocktails that will knock your socks off.

The McKenzie should be high on your list of restaurants to try in Vancouver and is 100% worthy of their first star.

-Max

featured_reviews.review_id: The Mackenzie Room has been on my list for a very long time. I'm so glad to have finally been able to check it out. The food was absolutely delicious and the service was unreal. We sat at the bar where Lewis was extremely friendly and helpful. We will be back soon!
featured_reviews.review_text: The Mackenzie Room has been on my list for a very long time. I'm so glad to have finally been able to check it out. The food was absolutely delicious and the service was unreal. We sat at the bar where Lewis was extremely friendly and helpful. We will be back soon!

featured_reviews.review_id:
We went in for the tasting menu. I can say honestly everything was well cooked and tasted nice but I always felt something was missing. When I go in for a fine dining experience I was expecting that the flavours on the dishes would be unique, but mainly I got unique ingredients but the flavours came off as ordinary.

My partner specifically did not enjoy either dessert presented. The flavour combinations and sweetness were just not to her taste. I found them alright.

To their benefit my partner also did not enjoy her cocktail and they replaced it with a specialty drink to her tastes, and at no charge.

This may be a small detail but I found the combination of tables to water cups to be a poor match. The cups because of their girth were hard to grasp with smaller hands and since it didn't have a clear grip on it made the cup feel unsteady in the hands. This in combination with the cup would somewhat sticking to the tables after sitting for a couple minutes made that part of the experience uncomfortable.

It is worth a visit but I would recommend going to other fine dining occassions as well as The Mackenzie Room.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Dined solo to kick off my last week in Vancouver on this trip.

Focusing on locally sourced ingredients, the solo menu is comprised 5 courses. At only $74, it's an incredible value.

The menu has pun names which I absolutely adored; Sashimi Not, Zucc I am Your Father, Trout Krout Sprout, of Bison Men, and Le Big Mack.

My favourite bites were the zucchini two ways, the trout (minus the brussels) and the King Salmon sashimi. The bison was very well cooked and the spinach was delicious but the potato was lacklustre.

Along with the meal, the bar manager made me a beverage pairing which had cocktails and glasses of wine based on my preference. The final digestif had pickled spruce tips stuffed in an olive.

There were a number of other dishes on the menu which caught my eye. I definitely will have to come back the next time I am in town.

featured_reviews.review_id:
WOW. Location is a bit sketchy to say the least.....notwithstanding, the minute you enter you're welcomed by passionate and knowledgeable staff. If you are a foodie this is a MUST TRY location. Best option is the, "I WANT IT ALL" option ($85/person). It's a 12 course tapas share option, of delicious pallet popping delights, where you get to try the entire Chef's Creations. Only catch is you need a minimum of 4 people to try this. So get your double date on and try this place. You'll thank me later.  CHEERS!!!

PS- There is also a very creative signature cocktails menu if you so desire.

featured_reviews.review_id:
The food was superb. We came away reminiscing about several of the dishes and wishing we had more.

The service was very friendly and prompt. Everything we could ask for in service.

The only gripe I had, and it is indeed a small one is that the restaurant was way too dark. Walking out to the street after dinner we were dazzled by the brightness of the Vancouver lampposts.

places.name: Published on Main
places.description: Upscale restaurant presenting innovative, carefully sourced cuisine amid retro-chic surroundings.
places.address: Published on Main, 3593 Main St, Vancouver, BC V5V 3N4

featured_reviews.review_id:
It is great value for tasting menu since it has 10 courses. Atmosphere is very nice and all staffs are super friendly and professional. However most savoury dishes we had was overly salty and I can't seem to find a dish I really like throughout the 10 courses. This is my second time here trying the tasting menu, it changed a little bit but the second time is definitely more salty..
I have some photos attached. The fish with rice , ravioli and the duck sauce and mushrooms were all too salty where I can't really enjoy the taste of the food itself too much.

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi C H, thank you for your feedback! We apologize for the issue with saltiness in our dishes. Your comments are important, and we'll share them with our culinary team. We look forward to the opportunity to provide you with a better experience in the future. - Team Published

featured_reviews.review_id: We had a lovely dining experience at Published. The staff and atmosphere was perfect. Felt high caliber but still had some of that Vancouver/West Coast casualness to it. The food was really delicious, we especially loved the lamb and the chicken style mushrooms. Really recommend trying a bit of everything, we had about 7 dishes for 3 people and then 2 desserts. That was the perfect amount of food.

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Dragana, we're delighted you had a lovely dining experience! Thank you for your kind words and for recommending our dishes. We can't wait to serve you again soon! - Team Published

featured_reviews.review_id:
ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. This restaurant really deserves more than one Michelin star! My family went there for dinner and the service, ambience, and food was perfect.

Our waiter Lucas was so friendly and very attentive, and he made sure we were content at all times. I really loved the ambience and the environment.

My family ordered ALL of the dishes (including all the starters, mains, and dessert, except for the specials) and everything was literally flawless. The dishes came out super fast, and the texture, flavourless, and display of the dishes was perfection. I could not pick out a single imperfection in any dish! I recommend everything, but especially the Chicken Fried Mitake, Summer's Bounty, Summer Bean Salad, BBQ Pork Collar, and Summer Strawberry dessert.

The cost is also way more affordable than other Michelins, and the portions are larger than other restaurants. If I could give more than 5 stars, I would. We will definitely be coming here again!!!

featured_reviews.review_id: The food was amazing ,nice presentation, but cocktail tasted weird. The overall experience was so-so, not so good service, poor atmosphere.   Didn't expect all tables were so close and that noisy environment, gosh.   I felt the servers were working like robots, and mocking the same food explanation without emotion.   This is a bit overrated as a Michelin restaurant. We would expect better service and nice environment with this high price .

featured_reviews.review_id: We had the tasting menu, and really enjoyed the canopees! We also added the Japanese milk pollen buns which were great. For the price and also compared to other tasting menus we've had, some of the dishes felt a bit weak. The beef shank soup resembled a soup that my dad makes at home, and the main with potato rosti with beef brisket was extremely salty. Overall an okay experience.

Your feedback is truly valuable, and we'll be sure to incorporate your comments as we continually work to enhance the overall dining experience. We can't wait to have you back soon! - Team Published

featured_reviews.review_id:
We tried the 10-course testing menu. Some items were spectacular, others were just good. The highlight was definitely the first course, consisting of a selection of seven canapes, which were all fantastic. The weakest point was the last course, a somewhat insipid little cake bite ("Douglas Fir malt crumb"). All 10 of them really good quality dishes. We also tried the white wine they made in collaboration with Ursa Major winery. It was light, well rounded and very pleasant.

A word on the pricing: the tasting menu is advertised as $165 per person, but when booking, in the very last step, right before paying, you'll notice there's a 20% service charge, which I found to be very misleading. With that plus tax, dinner for two came out to $412.50 (plus the wine, which I think came to about $20 per glass).

The service is very friendly. They explain all the dishes in great detail and are delighted to provide more insight. The one aspect that wasn't as enchanting is that as soon as we sat down, they tried to sell us additional options, like pre-selected wine paring, pre-selected wine and cocktail pairing, or just additional caviar or foie gras for our tasting menu, when we didn't even know what the menu was like, and without telling us the price for these add-ons upfront.

Overall, great tasting experience, but for a hefty price.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Amazing experience. The food was very flavourful and the service was exceptional. I would recommend the Fried Buttermilk Mushroom. Looks like chicken and taste great! We had two plates of them.

The duck with foie gras was amazing and well seasoned.

The hay dessert was a big surprise with the complexity of flavours from the first bite. It was delicious. But, I think it could benefit being a smaller serving as by the end of the entire desert portion my palate felt fatigued and it had a bit of a diminishing return on the experience. Still great though!

I would come back again!

featured_reviews.review_id:
We had an extraordinary experience dining at Published on Main. Everything from the food, to the service, and the atmosphere made it obvious why this restaurant earned a Michelin Star.

The standout dish to me was the octopus. This dish had a nice tang to it, and the octopus was tender and bursting with flavour. The ingredients for all dishes were nice and fresh. Particularly, the tomatoes used in the ravioli tasted homegrown - a taste unique to only the highest quality tomato. Overall, I would describe the flavour notes of our dishes to be zesty citrus.

One minor thing that stuck out to me was the plating of the pork collar dish. I found it a little awkward that the pork was only on one-third of such a large plate. It looked like most of the dish was missing.

Other than that, our experience at Published on Main was fantastic!

places.name: Miku Vancouver
places.description: Sushi & sustainable seafood are served in a sophisticated setting with a patio & water views.
places.address: Miku Vancouver, 200 Granville St #70, Vancouver, BC V6C 1S4

featured_reviews.review_id:
Amazing view of the waterfront and mountains.

We made reservations for 1:30pm on a weekday and it was PACKED. But they seated us at our exact reservation time and was very prompt with their services.

We got a complimentary scallop for celebrating a special occasion. The food was delightful -- but I think it might be out of season for oysters, or maybe I'm not used to eating it during fall/winter.

Our server was amazing! So attentive!

featured_reviews.review_id: Very mediocre food with the fancy pretense of being a great restaurant. It seemed more like a factory! I ordered the 6 course menu which was so blah and mediocre. It's too expensive for what it is. I tried many Michelin starred restaurants in Japan, France and the US so I know what I'm talking about. If they offer a tasting menu -- they should do something creative!  There was nothing creative about their tasting menu: especially the ridiculous third course of sashimi(who includes just simple cut fish in a tasting menu!!!!) I couldn't say wow about even one dish. So the take away: if you are traveling to Vancouver like I am, don't come here! It'll be a waste of your time!

featured_reviews.review_id:
This is definitely one of the best fine dinning options when it comes to sushi in Vancouver, or so we were told. This restaurant is on a prime spot, overlooking Canada Place and waterfront. Since the moment I called to make a reservation I was treated kindly and this level of service was kept throughout our meal as well. Having said that, I didn't find the food to be anything extraordinary... considering the price tag I was a bit disappointed to find that the food did not meet my high expectations. Everything tasted fresh and the plate presentations were beautiful, but I did not walk out amazed at the flavours or super satisfied either.
It was a nice place with a fantastic service and a fabulous view, but in terms of food I'm afraid there are other great sushi places in Vancouver that rank higher for me and have a lower price tag.

This is definitely one of the best fine dinning options when it comes to sushi in Vancouver, or so we were told. This restaurant is on a prime spot, overlooking Canada Place and waterfront. Since the moment I called to make a reservation I was treated kindly and this level of service was kept throughout our meal as well. Having said that, I didn't find the food to be anything extraordinary... considering the price tag I was a bit disappointed to find that the food did not meet my high expectations. Everything tasted fresh and the plate presentations were beautiful, but I did not walk out amazed at the flavours or super satisfied either.
It was a nice place with a fantastic service and a fabulous view, but in terms of food I'm afraid there are other great sushi places in Vancouver that rank higher for me and have a lower price tag.

featured_reviews.review_id:
The first thing you notice walking in is the atmosphere. Perfectly curated to provide an authentic experience. I was staying at the Pan Pacific for a work event, and felt like getting some sushi at 9pm. If you're also having a craving, definitely check out Miku!

I'm a vegetarian, my server Miles made some great suggestions that perfectly suited my tastes. He even made some great adjustments to what I was thinking of getting. Finally, the tea was a delicious matcha that was exactly the right temperature. (I'm a tea enthusiast!)

I would rate the whole experience a 10/10

featured_reviews.review_id: First time here, and everyone that told me to come was 1000% correct. We started with the Hokkaido Scallops, which were delicate, flavorful, and beautifully presented. I got the Miku Signature Selection and Surf & Turf Roll for dinner. I cannot recommend the Miku Signature Selection enough. It was an incredible selection of the menu, essentially a chance to try everything except the Surf & Turf roll. Everything in the Selection was delicious and novel. The Surf & Turf roll really blew me away with the addition of truffle flavor. My mouth is watering just writing this review.

featured_reviews.review_id:
By far one of the freshest fish I've ever tasted, akin to Japan. I got different types of nigiri and it simply melted in my mouth. I didn't order a lot as I had a heavy lunch, but enough to try a variety of their fish. Green tea opera cake was also delicious - layers were the perfect consistency, level of crunch and flavours.

Good atmosphere - it's light and airy inside, it has a stunning view of the mountains and ocean, and the place is buzzing.

Service was professional, attentive and he gave his recommendation when I couldn't decide on two desserts. The staff at the front were polite when I arrived and left.

Washrooms are pretty nice, there's dim lighting and it's relatively modern.

I prefer this Miku to the one in Toronto. This one has a better location and view - it was nice to walk around Canada Place afterwards too.

Overall, I'd highly recommend this place!

places.name: Salmon n' Bannock
places.description: Intimate eatery featuring Native Canadian fare such as wild fish, game meat & bannock.
places.address: Salmon n' Bannock, 1128 W Broadway #7, Vancouver, BC V6H 1G5

featured_reviews.review_id: This is an indigenous owned restaurant with traditional indigenous inspired food. It is Michelin listed. The service is wonderful they accommodated us just at closing time and they're really friendly and share books about the tragic history of Canadian First Nations. It's poignant reading about the owner's personal experience while reading through the menu. We ordered the upgrade to turn a main course into a 3 course meal. The first thing that hits you, literally in the gut, is how heavy the bannock is. It's so heavy and filling it could be a meal on its own. About the size of a large dinner roll with the weight of 7 of them. But it was surprisingly soft, natural tasting and great with butter. There was a beef and celery soup with so much shredded meat and celery it could have been a stew. Dipping bannock in it was great. We also had mushrooms and gravy on another large bannock. This was so good. The highlight was rubbed grilled salmon on wild rice. This was exceptional and we didn't finish it so we could share it with our daughter. Ice cream with berries was an excellent close. Let me not forget to mention 2 indigenous beers a vanilla porter that reminds you of a dark English beer and a Saskatoon berry that reminds you of a sour lager.

featured_reviews.review_id:
We were curious to experience this west coast restaurant and it turned out to be a feast for the senses from the warm welcome, the smells of cedar, the sound of indigenous music, the decorative touches, to the flavours of the food and drink. The menu was proudly described to us which helped us make our selections and this enhanced our dining experience. We were invited to take our leftover bannock home. Extra points for reducing food waste. The service was wonderful. Reservations recommended as the restaurant has limited seating. Several groups of walk-ins were turned away while we were there.
There's paid parking at the back but it's difficult to access the restaurant from the upper lot if you have mobility issues as the elevator is not in service. If you drive around to the lower lot there are stairs.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I had high expectations on the food because of the good reviews. However, among all the food we ordered ( for 6 persons), I only liked the game sausage and plain bannock with butter. Others especially the main courses are just so so and tastes not very distinctive. All the side dishes are the same - not much a variety to share. Drinks (Berries gone wild, Elderflower refresher) are not that impressive too.
I suggest not to order bannocks as starter as all main courses include a bannock with butter.  We ordered two toasted bannocks with sage-blueberries as starter and ended up eating a lot of bannocks!!
It's kind of disappointing for what we paid ($70+ per person). However, service and atmosphere is good.

featured_reviews.review_id:
The service we experienced was genuinely warm and hospitable, creating a positive atmosphere throughout our dining experience. The waitress who attended to us went above and beyond by offering comprehensive explanations of the menu items, which added a layer of understanding and appreciation to our choices.

Among the various dishes we sampled, the preparation of both the salmon and the meat options showcased a commendable level of skill and attention to detail. The salmon was expertly cooked to retain its moisture and flavor, while the meat dishes displayed a balance of tenderness and succulence, indicating a dedication to culinary craftsmanship.

A noteworthy mention goes to the cedar jelly, an item that piqued our curiosity. Upon tasting it, we were pleasantly surprised by its distinctive and unparalleled flavor profile. The novelty of the cedar jelly adds a sense of adventure to the dining experience, making it a must-try for those open to exploring unique tastes.

In summary, the warm and informative service, coupled with the skillful preparation of dishes like salmon and meat, provided a satisfying dining experience. For those seeking an intriguing and distinctive flavor encounter, the cedar jelly stands as a testament to the innovative offerings of the establishment.

featured_reviews.review_id: If you Google 'Salmon Restaurant Vancouver' you will surely be recommended to come here. I love the storytelling about the indigenous background, as well as the dining experience. Small Restaurant, so booking online is a must. The waitress recommended the Salmon Sampler and we also ordered the Fish & Rice Wild Sockeye and also the Mushroom Risotto. The kids really loved the Game Sausage Dinner - Elk. The flavours are so unique, it was amazing.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I'm not the first to say this, but I definitely recommend making a reservation because the place is so small. A friend and I wanted to try but weren't sure on the timing of when we'd be ready and so didn't make a reservation for Sunday, and we got really lucky - we called ahead and first they said they had room on the patio only, but then shortly after we arrived they'd had a cancellation so we did get a table inside. During the few minutes we were on the patio, though, they wanted to make sure we were comfortable and brought me a blanket since I was cold. But it was nice to sit inside to see all the art they have up.
To warm up, I got a wild rice tea (which is a caffeine-free infusion, not technically a tea), which was surprisingly rich-tasting. If you like genmaicha, this was a similar idea without the tea. For my meal, I had their vegetarian risotto, which rotates and was butternut squash on that day. My meal included a piece of bannock which they brought out first, which was like a cross between a dinner roll and rich biscuit and very good. Sometimes I find risotto boring, but this one was fantastic, with the rich earthy flavours of the risotto complimented by the seasoned roasted vegetables it was topped with. My friend was a fan of her salmon burger too, and said the bannock as a bun made it interesting and different. I tried one of her sweet potato fries and really liked it - more interesting than regular fries for sure. To finish, we ordered a blueberry bread pudding. I really like bread pudding but my friend had never tried it, but we both enjoyed it! The texture of the bannock in bread pudding was a little different but worked well!
My meal came to $57 after tip and tax, but it was well worth it for the nice experience I had (and I left full), and I would definitely recommend this restaurant to both foodies and people looking to get a taste of Indigenous culture.

places.name: Phnom Penh Restaurant
places.description: Vietnamese-Cambodian institution draws fans with specialties including chicken wings & butter beef.
places.address: Phnom Penh Restaurant, 244 E Georgia St, Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z7

featured_reviews.review_id: This place served authentic Cambodian and Vietnamese food. In my opinion, the food was decent. The way they marinated was too sweet, everything was too sweet. The price is reasonable with the amount of food you get. We had shaken beef, tamarind soup and fried chicken. They were all perfectly cooked, just a bit too sweet for my taste. The restaurant was super crowded when we came for dinner. Service was a bit slow, probably due to crowd, but the staffs were really nice. The restaurant has authentic Asian vibe with round family tables.

featured_reviews.review_id: Wow, what a unique experience! Butter beef was a pleasant surprise and the rest of the food tasted so fresh and perfectly seasoned. No wonder why there's always a huge line up at this place. I don't blame them, it's simply amazing.

featured_reviews.review_id: This spot offers Vietnamese and Cambodian cuisine that's both authentic and wallet-friendly. We ordered fried chicken and Chicken Rice in Hot Pot. The flavors were a bit subtle, leaning towards mild. The wait times here are pretty hectic, and you can only make a reservation if your party has six or more people. Be prepared to wait for at least 45 minutes before you can get a table. Despite the wait, it's definitely worth giving it a shot!

featured_reviews.review_id: Returning here after 10 years is definitely a surprise. The food is great but the lineup is even better, 1hr45min! Had to piece out after the first attempt and came back during a weekday after lunch time. I guess that's expected when you turn Michelin. Ordered the classic egg noodles and chicken wings, good as ever! Looks like the restaurant has been passed down the family generation but the taste is still classic. Highly recommended if you're in Vancouver and don't mind a wait or eating off hours. Worth it.

featured_reviews.review_id:
A friend visiting from San Francisco really wanted to go to Phnom Penh during her stay.  She came to the restaurant on her last visit and she said she needed to come to the restaurant again every time she visits Vancouver so we took her there for an early lunch this week.

I remember coming here years ago and did not have a good impression of what I had but I'm quite glad we took my friend there this time.  We loved our dishes so much that they were probably the best foods we had during her visit.

We had deep fried chicken wings, tong choy (water spinach), rare beef filet with anchovies and deep fried crab meat rolls.  I could eat the chicken wings and crab meat rolls all day long.  Al;though deep fried, the wings and rolls were light in texture but also full of flavours at the same time. The slightly sweet undertone in the coating of the chicken wing batter was addictive.

We came here on a Monday morning shortly after 1100 when they open and we walked right in.  By 1130, there were already people waiting for tables at the door.

places.name: Black Frog Eatery
places.description: Tucked-away spot with a patio & sports on TV, plus a large selection of local beers & comfort food.
places.address: Black Frog Eatery, 108 Cambie St, Vancouver, BC V6B 2M8

featured_reviews.review_id: As a tourist, I wanted to get a quick bite somewhere with Poutine and a nice view. I got this and more! The bartender was so sweet. She was so patient with me and gave me awesome drink recommendations.  I ended up with a cider and did try the IPA's. The soup and salad were fresh and delicious.  I believe it was a chicken curry soup. I then ordered the Poutine with bacon and mushrooms. Very tasty! I loved how the place was right across the Gastown steam clock. So I was able to hear the steam go off while enjoying my meal and the view. If I ever come back to Vancouver, I will go out of my way to eat here again!

featured_reviews.review_id:
While visiting Vancouver in 2018, we stopped at the corner of Water Street & Cambie and the Gastown Steam Clock. After taking some of the usual tourist photos & waiting for the steam to blow the whistle, we found our way to the Black Frog Eatery. Settling in at 1 pm we were warmly welcomed and quickly seated. From our table we had an excellent view of the Steam Clock. I watched tourists posing with the clock as we awaited our order.

We weren't very hungry and decided to share a club sandwich.  I'm happy to say that it was made with real meat--none of that sliced processed poultry!  The fries were good too, and I washed it all down with a local award-winning Kokanee lager.

The ambiance of the Black Frog is definitely that of a pub-style eatery and the decor accentuates that feel.  That's a good thing, and to me, very comforting. Lot's of wood, brick, and pub-style elements all around. This is absolutely the type of place I'd have lunch at if I'd worked in the area.  Their menu has a good selection to satisfy everyone's tastes. Prices are on par with other restaurants offering similar fare.  The type of place that I call "no nonsense and basic good eating". Service was prompt, efficient, and the staff knew their menu well. When we find our way back to Vancouver, I will certainly plan on coming back.

I cannot recommend enough!

The staff was incredibly helpful in picking the best drink on the menu (for me), and we had the "yorkies" which were miniature Yorkshire pies. They were INCREDIBLE!!! Such a lovely unassuming spot. I cannot recommend enough!

featured_reviews.review_id: Amazing spot! Great owner, great people. The food is wonderful and beers are flowin' just right. Make sure to stop in and get the poutine and "Creepy Uncle Dunkle". I love this place. Right by the steam clock too!
featured_reviews.review_text: Amazing spot! Great owner, great people. The food is wonderful and beers are flowin' just right. Make sure to stop in and get the poutine and "Creepy Uncle Dunkle". I love this place. Right by the steam clock too!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Delicious food with reasonable price and excellent customer service! I would recommend trying their buffalo cauliflower. I don't drink so didn't check out their beverage menu.
You can have steam clock view from patio.
featured_reviews.review_text:
Delicious food with reasonable price and excellent customer service! I would recommend trying their buffalo cauliflower. I don't drink so didn't check out their beverage menu.
You can have steam clock view from patio.

featured_reviews.review_id:
We were at the end of a Ghost tour & passed the Black Frog & liked how it looked like an English pub. We went in after & a server with long blond hair asked us what we wanted to drink, we gave her our order. This place was rather small, so it shouldn't have taken 10 minutes to get our drinks. I noticed after 7 to 10 minutes, she came out of an alcove & went to her station, she forgot, it wasn't even busy! We got tired of waiting & decided to walk out. We went to the Blarney Stone pub, where a server got us drinks in under 5 minutes, much better service.
My suggestion, hire competent staff who are friendly & professional & know how to do their jobs!

The Yorkies chicken wings and Halibut were soo good. Don't miss the brownies for desert soo good and enough to share.
We tried some great beer and made some great memories thank you xxx

places.name: Maenam
places.description: Chic eatery serving traditional Thai dishes with contemporary twists plus a sleek bar for cocktails.
places.address: Maenam, 1938 W 4th Ave, Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5

featured_reviews.review_id: Beautiful plating and great service. Don't like the snack portions fool you, the mains are a LOT of food! Everything we had was delicious (pictures are portions for 3 people, so we got an extra curry as part of the meal)
featured_reviews.review_text: Beautiful plating and great service. Don't like the snack portions fool you, the mains are a LOT of food! Everything we had was delicious (pictures are portions for 3 people, so we got an extra curry as part of the meal)

featured_reviews.review_id:
Went to Vancouver for a business trip.  Met up with some friends who lives in Vancouver and recommend trying Maenam.

Cute small Thai restaurant with a very cool modern vibe. Service was excellent with the server being super attentive.

We decided to go for their 13 course tasting menu. I wasn't able to post all the pics as it only allows me to add 10 pics to this post.

The food was so amazing, small amounts so you can taste the flavours and also so you won't get too full.
The tasting menu was interesting there was food that I otherwise would not have ordered at a standard thai restaurant.  The server explained each dish that came to the table.

All in all a very unique experience, the desserts were so good!
In love tasting menus. This one is a must try!!

featured_reviews.review_id: It was a pleasantly surprise Thai experience! The lunch set menu came with the main dish and sides (soup, salad and rice), the Stir-fried beef tenderloin was tasty, I loved the salad which had the right amount of citric and a very power soup. Also, the dessert was delicious, we had to ask twice because we really enjoyed it. A nice gem in Kitsilano area.

featured_reviews.review_id: Wow !! What can I say? Food was absolutely phenomenal, the snacks at the beginning were small but we're packed with punches of flavour!! We had a reservation and did the tasting menu about $80 a person and we definitely left with full bellies! My aunt was visiting from out of town and she was absolutely blown away! Street parking on 4th was expensive so try and find parking in the residential areas!

featured_reviews.review_id:
An excellent spot for enjoying Thai cuisine, offering a delightful and reasonably priced dining experience. The quality of the food is exceptional, particularly the dumplings, vegetarian green curry, and coconut soup, which we found to be incredibly delicious. Similar to many establishments in Vancouver, this place caters to a diverse range of dietary preferences, ensuring that even vegans have at least one suitable choice. Additionally, their happy hour drinks are highly enjoyable.

One aspect that stood out to us was the variety of options available on the menu. Whether you were a meat lover, a vegetarian, or a vegan, there were numerous choices to suit every palate. It was refreshing to see a restaurant that prioritized inclusivity and catered to different dietary needs without compromising on taste or quality.

During our visit, we decided to explore the happy hour offerings, and we were not disappointed. The selection of drinks was impressive, with a range of creative and well-crafted cocktails, along with other beverage options. It was a fantastic opportunity to try something new and indulge in refreshing concoctions that complemented the flavors of the food perfectly.

featured_reviews.review_id: I've lived in Vancouver 13 years and Meanam is my absolute FAVORITE restaurant in all the city.  It is a culinary adventure you will not forget.  I go here for all of my most special occasions.  Yes it's a bit on the pricier side, but for the top quality you get, more than worth it.

featured_reviews.review_id: Just go. Try the chefs tasting menu. It won't disappoint. Also, pick up a cookbook on your way out so you can try to relive the wondrous experience from the comfort of your own home.

places.name: Osteria Savio Volpe
places.description: Housemade charcuterie & wood-fired Italian fare served in an industrial-chic restaurant/bar.
places.address: Osteria Savio Volpe, 615 Kingsway, Vancouver, BC V5T 3K5

featured_reviews.review_id:
Exceeding expectations - simply put, this restaurant is a bar raiser. Absolutely incredible food, service and atmosphere and should be the example for what all restaurants in this price range (or higher) should aim for.

The tasting menu is a steal at $85 pp. We left satisfied and full to the brim!
featured_reviews.review_text:
Exceeding expectations - simply put, this restaurant is a bar raiser. Absolutely incredible food, service and atmosphere and should be the example for what all restaurants in this price range (or higher) should aim for.

The tasting menu is a steal at $85 pp. We left satisfied and full to the brim!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Come with good company for the best evening possible!   Down to earth but superb  table service.

The food is amazing here.  The wine was great. The service lovely.  Come by with friends where the food will definitely be as good if not better than the company and conversation.

I loved the vibe is family style and inviting, doesn't pretend to be super fancy where you can be comfortable to be you and still enjoy the flavours as it was meant.

Thank you for a memorable meal..I will definitely be back soon.

featured_reviews.review_id: Walk in without reservation. The place was not too busy at the beginning I guess because was a raining night . We chose sitting at the bar. The restaurant later got very busy .Atmosphere was cozy and with good vibe. Our server Blanka was friendly and attentive . We ordered the testing menu and it blew our mind .  The testing menu is speically made for each table. Service asked a few questions and selected a special menu by the chef. Food was delicious and we enjoyed it so much . The price was reasonable. We definitely will come back again and high recommended.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Went for the tasting menu after much rave review from friends.
Would describe how we feel as full, but not satiated. The meal left much to be desired.

At $85/person now, there are many other restaurants one would try before coming back. Everything was good enough, but nothing stood out. It was safe but really really boring. A bit disappointing for a family menu where you leave the chef to cook (and most of the time impress you) with their skills.

Dessert was the best part.. but.. we didn't come for dessert...

The service was excellent, the atmosphere was lovely and fun, and the food was great - as always! We opted to go for the family-style meal where our server/the kitchen chose our dishes. I recommend it for people who are easily overwhelmed or don't know what they want but are open to trying anything. (Just note that it tends to be more expensive overall.)

If at all possible, I would love to see more non-alcoholic options on the menu.

The atmosphere here is unrivaled with the decor and beautifully plated dishes constantly moving across from the kitchen to tables. I love how everything here is designed to be shared - such a wonderful dining experience.

featured_reviews.review_id: The food was incredible! It was our first time and we got the tasting menu and WOW! It was delicious! We didn't expect to get fried fish at all and I'm so happy we did. It made the experience so unique and the fish was fried perfectly and tasted so delightful. At first I thought the pasta was pretty plain but it had great flavour! Definitely recommend the fish though I was glad we got that over a steak since steaks are so common at many tasting menus. Thank you for a great first time experience! Sorry my photos are terrible and I didn't get a photo of the appy and dessert.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I reserved a single seat at the bar reservation for 5:00 p.m.  I was quite fortunate to be given a seat on the patio because the restaurant wasn't that busy; it was a serene and beautiful setting!  Along with passing out the standard menus, the waitress read out the day's specials.

I selected the lemony tortellini from the normal menu, along with the featured arugula salad.  I also had a glass of water for starters.  Together, the food was delicious, and the serving sizes were perfect.  Additionally, the waitress was cordial, attentive, and made sure my service experience was excellent.

I had a wonderful, exceptional eating experience, which much improved my evening after a difficult birthday night the day before.  I'd love to revisit Savio Volpe to try their Alla Famiglia and/or their green spaghetti sometime.
