places.name: Kishimoto Japanese Restaurant
places.description: Lively spot best known for sushi, also offering Japanese appetizers, udon & cooked fish dishes.
places.address: Kishimoto Japanese Restaurant, 2054 Commercial Dr, Vancouver, BC V5N 4A9

featured_reviews.review_id:
Without a doubt, the best Japanese restaurant I have ever tried in Vancouver.
For its great quality of product, flavor, very fresh fish, spectacular dishes prepared by amazing chefs, variety of good drinks, good atmosphere where to enjoy good food and magnificent friendly staff!
I really enjoyed dinner there with my friend!
A very special place!
We will be back, thank you guys!!
featured_reviews.review_text:
Without a doubt, the best Japanese restaurant I have ever tried in Vancouver.
For its great quality of product, flavor, very fresh fish, spectacular dishes prepared by amazing chefs, variety of good drinks, good atmosphere where to enjoy good food and magnificent friendly staff!
I really enjoyed dinner there with my friend!
A very special place!
We will be back, thank you guys!!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Love dinning here with my friends!
The food is always delicious and artistic! Love how they support local farmers and have unique high quality ingredients.

When I was poor college student, I usually got the okonomiyaki or one of the stone bowls, one caterpillar roll, and 1 dessert and that was enough to satisfy me and my friend. I usually got something that was high in carbs that way it fills me up. That way it doesn't go over my budget.

Now, I get anything from their special menu, it's always different depending on the seasons. I am never disappointed what I am about to taste.

The service is good and friendly!

The atmosphere there is calming, chill, classy. The music in that restaurant is very relaxing in my opinion.

Also, the tables are always clean and same with the dishes and cutlery.

Tip: This place is quite popular so the wait time to get a table might take long (1hr +). So I suggest you make a reservation, come at 5pm, or eat a small snack before you go but that depends on your eating schedule.

featured_reviews.review_id: Amazing,  tight and focused menu.  Every dish was a work of art and tasted spectacular.  Has to be the best sushi I've had. Will have to come back again

featured_reviews.review_id: My favourite place at all time! I've always visited Kishimioto for their famous grilled Gindara! It's one of the best I've ever tried so far! This time I've booked their Kaiseki course (7-8 courses), I got to say the presentation was on point  and the whole course was phenomenal!!! They have their very unique in house made sauces and the flavour is so strong it melts in your mouth. I enjoyed the whole course and the theme syncing with the season.

featured_reviews.review_id:
So, the real question is not whether the food is awesome, it is! It is not whether the service is amazing, it is!

The real question is whether a 45min-1 hr wait is worth it ?!

So if you are planning to come in a large group, you should call ahead, or indeed be the first to come in, otherwise the wait times, make it only accessible to die hards or those that know, that it's worth the wait. If you can find a place nearby to grab a drink with friends after you have put your name down, then time flies.

So for me, I can say, that the 45 minute wait time, even though seemed long, flew quickly and the food was worth the wait. We didn't order any alcohol, just green tea, and our bill was OK.

I had the spicy salmon roll and it was delicious. My friend had the sashimi salad and it was delicious as well. Coming from a former cook & server used to the service industry, kishimoto does everything right, even down to the plating of the food.

10/10 would come again

featured_reviews.review_id:
This place only opens in the evening. We came around 5:40pm and was told the waiting time would be around 1hr. The wait was worth it tho.

We ordered 2 kinds of oshi which were incredibly delicious but a bit smaller than I expected. Nonetheless, the flavour in each bite were amazing.

The veggie okonomiyaki was surprisingly good even if it's filled with just onions, cabbages and mushrooms. Looks can be deceiving so don't judge this okonomiyaki till you try it.

The service is top notch, and the food is out of this world!! Tried the roast lamb..some of the best I've ever had!! The prices are really reasonable, too. Even the ambience is great. Can't wait to try the Sunday roast (on Sunday, obviously). This was my first time, sure won't be the last!!! (Also, drink specials are pretty amazing too!)

I recommend the Greek burger if you are looking for something a little different, but still really good. They have a pretty large tap list as well. Will have to come back and try a few more of their pizzas.

featured_reviews.review_id: the food here is terrible. I was starving and i couldn't even eat it. The calamari wasn't cooked properly, my pita was burnt and my chicken was dry. It's a great atmosphere and has potential but the food needs serious improving.
featured_reviews.review_text: the food here is terrible. I was starving and i couldn't even eat it. The calamari wasn't cooked properly, my pita was burnt and my chicken was dry. It's a great atmosphere and has potential but the food needs serious improving.

featured_reviews.review_id: Went to try their breakfast menu yesterday. An absolute healthy treat to your tastebuds and mind.
featured_reviews.review_text: Went to try their breakfast menu yesterday. An absolute healthy treat to your tastebuds and mind.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Probably not somewhere I'd check out again, to be honest. Probably the worst part of the whole experience was the server (Mikaela). We were seated, and one of the other servers dropped menus at our table and left without saying a word. When our server approached, she simply asked if we were ready to order, so we ordered our food. We realized afterward that she didn't even ask if we wanted drinks. I had asked for no onions in my wrap (she wasn't writing down our order, just to be clear), and when my food arrived, surprise - there were onions. Told our server who took it away and brought it back a minute later. Obviously, they just hand-picked the onions out and yet still managed to leave some behind so I had to go digging around pulling out the bits that were left. At no point did she ask how our food was, at no point did she ask if we wanted anything else, or even ask about dessert after we finished eating. The tzatziki in my wrap was delicious, the fries were good, but the lamb was in big chunks and chewy/fatty. We were brought a glass Ketchup bottle with no lid (not sure why it had no lid), meaning we couldn't shake the bottle before pouring some out, so we got the unpleasant watery Ketchup all over one of our plates. Prices were decent however.
The icing on the cake - when she brought us our bill, she must've cut herself because there was blood on it.

I had asked for no onions in my wrap (she wasn't writing down our order, just to be clear), and when my food arrived, surprise - there were onions. Told our server who took it away and brought it back a minute later. Obviously, they just hand-picked the onions out and yet still managed to leave some behind so I had to go digging around pulling out the bits that were left. At no point did she ask how our food was, at no point did she ask if we wanted anything else, or even ask about dessert after we finished eating. The tzatziki in my wrap was delicious, the fries were good, but the lamb was in big chunks and chewy/fatty. We were brought a glass Ketchup bottle with no lid (not sure why it had no lid), meaning we couldn't shake the bottle before pouring some out, so we got the unpleasant watery Ketchup all over one of our plates. Prices were decent however.
The icing on the cake - when she brought us our bill, she must've cut herself because there was blood on it.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Carina,
Just got your review and I have to first say I am terribly sorry.  I totally value your opinion.  The issues you experienced are not acceptable in any way.  Be assured that I am dealing with this personally.  This is not our normal method of operation.  I would ask that you kindly reach out to me via email at info@themainonmain.com so that I can do what it takes to make things right with you.  We understand that even the little things matter and our customers deserve the greatest respect possible.  Sincerely, Sasha.

featured_reviews.review_id: Great location. We loved the pizza and truffle fries. My honest opinion calamari felt gooey and oil tasted a little old... I loved the tzatziki though.  Hamburger was delicious. One other downside is the prices of the food. We'll be back here during happy hour.

featured_reviews.review_id:
A fun place to sit and hang out with friends while watching traffic on Main Street.

Finding free parking as well as paid parking is difficult on Main Street with the patio dining and residential restrictions. However Summertime is here! Just walk a bit to burn off what you eat, or make way for a spot for dessert at Breka or Innocence.

I love their fries! Crispy! Dippable with the ketchup on the side. I kind of wished that i ordered the first burger, but I was going to order the Greek. Instead the word "bacon" got to me, so as long as it had bacon, that was going to be my order.

One should sit and enjoy the Main Street atmosphere using the summer. It's a different experience.

places.name: Bob Likes Thai Food.
places.address: Bob Likes Thai Food., 3755 Main St, Vancouver, BC V5V 3N8

featured_reviews.review_id:
I've always thought this restaurant seemed fun and got to give it a try today. The wooden interior is cozy and I feel like the decor is evoking a little bit genuine nostalgic feel and also a little humour. Our waiter was super nice and the other staff was also friendly. Walking to the washroom takes you right past the kitchen, which is interesting to take a look at but also may give some peace of mind that you can easily see exactly what's going on in there.
Their menu is mostly the basic Thai dishes that you see at casual Thai restaurants in Canada, but I was really curious about their take on fish & chips and poutine, which sounded very unique compared to both other Thai food and the Canadian versions of these dishes. So this time I tried Bob's Fish & Chips: fried battered cod pieces topped with sliced mango, onion, basil, and chilies with two crispy curry rice cakes, in a tangy sauce. It's not a dish you'd recognize as fish & chips without the context, but I can see where the inspiration was drawn from. I thought it was really tasty! The vinegar sauce was zippy and refreshing and I really liked the flavour and crunchy "crust" of the rice balls. When I first got a look at it I was skeptical that it was really enough food to be worth $22, but the way they stacked the fish pieces was deceiving because there was actually a lot of fish, and I was fully satiated after finishing. I also tried their house tamarind ginger soda which was very good too! I was expecting it to be spicy like ginger beer and it was really mostly sweet because the tamarind is more pronounced than the ginger, but still a tasty and refreshing drink.
My friend got the Chicken Cashew Nut for her meal and enjoyed it as well. There was enough that she ate only half and saved the rest (although she's not a big eater - I think with my appetite I could've finished it or nearly finished it but been very full).
I'd say it's a safe bet for standard downhome Thai food, and if you want to get a little experimental, the Fish & Chips is definitely worth trying. The positive atmosphere ties it all together.

featured_reviews.review_id:
We got the yellow curry prawns  (and added chicken) and the red chicken curry.

The spices were done well - it tastes deeper than some other Thai places we have visited before. The lychee in the red curry went really well together but I think too much of the fruit juices from the lychee and pineapple made the red curry a little too sweet for our liking.

Still a solid meal with good flavour and I'd come back again if I was in the area.

Sadly we didn't get to try their lime soda or young coconut as both were sold out.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Awesome spot on Main Street for Thai food! Ordered the Pad Thai, Drunken Noodles with Prawns, and Tom Yum Soup. Both noodles were very flavourful and the soup was the perfect balance of sour and spicy. All dishes had a good serving of prawn which were well sized. Also had a Thai iced tea which was refreshing and was the perfect level of sweetness.

Service was also amazing - they were attentive, responsive, and quick to do the small things like remove chopstick/straw wrap from the table and bring take out containers.

I definitely recommend Bob Likes Thai Food, and will go again!

However, the food can be better, it was nicely presented but I didn't enjoy the medium rare steak. The coffee smelled good but they can do better, it was 'watery' for me.

featured_reviews.review_id: Service here was super welcoming. Shocking for such a high end area. Especially for how they treat people of color. Impressive. featured_reviews.review_id:
Celebrated a birthday lunch here - cocktails are amazing, food is beautiful. "Garden area" wasn't open but it's stunning. They have a couple private rooms avail to book. The Botanist bar has its own menu but is only open for dinner service. Service was kind but not exceptional, didn't recognize or acknowledge this special day for us. The fresh bread was forgotten, we had to ask but then promptly delivered.
Burrata salad and tartare was underwhelming. Hanger steak was delicious.

featured_reviews.review_id:
This is a pretty nice restaurant that is enjoyable.   Location and decor is great, food is prepared with quality ingredients and presented very well.  Portions are a little small for the price so you end up ordering more of a variety of appetizers which has its own benefits.    The Hamburger is the main dish we tried and while a good burger (BTW it's served medium well so it's very pink inside) it was over powered by the strong and sharp cheese flavours.    I would consider asking them for some kind of modifications to make it a little more impressive in some way.     The chairs have some weird construction with the metal braces that hold the legs together that protrude and could damage leggings and general is a annoying

Overall enjoyable, fancy and very pleasant.

featured_reviews.review_id: We had an amazing time at the restaurant. We enjoyed the chef's tasting menu, one of our guests had some dietary requirements and the kitchen expertly pivoted and created a tantalizing spread of food. The efficiency and care of service was very apparent our service was above average and our server went to great lengths to go above and beyond to ensure every guest was satisfied with the tasting menu and their experience with the restaurant. It truly is a magical experience dining somewhere where you are taking such great care of and the use of unique and beautiful ingredients are so present.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Can't say enough good things about our time at Botanist! We came for our wedding anniversary and had a beautiful card and champagne waiting for us at the table. The hostesses were very courteous and our server, Chris, was amazing. He thoroughly explained different menu options to make sure the experience was catered to our tastes and checked on us often from the appetizers through the main course to dessert.

The atmosphere was wonderful. We sat in the semi-outdoor seating area near the bar with beautiful foliage and piano playing in the background.

One thing to note: be wary of the bread--delicious and so tempting to keep eating it but save your appetite for the main course and you won't be sorry. Tagliatelle, poached halibut, and king salmon were perfect along with the raspberry pavlova. Also enjoyed our drinks: "What the Flower" and "Needed Escape".

Would definitely recommend!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Out of all the amazing restaurants in Vancouver, my wife and I decided to celebrate our anniversary here and it turned out to be a very wise choice!

Kudos to the mastermind, Sarkis, who orchestrated a table miracle on our special night, spreading the word to the entire staff as our fantastic night capped off with two glasses of complimentary champagne to toast with right away before getting to the menu.

My wife's favourite was the butter poached lobster! The plating was beautifully presented and the sauce was tastefully done, not overpowering the natural sweetness of the fresh lobster!

My favourite was the oven roasted cauliflower. The cauliflower is like a white canvas that provides the texture and everything else on the plate just meshed so well and tasted so heavenly together. This is a definitely a MUST TRY!

Ambiance was delightful, complemented by the remarkable skills of a pianist who effortlessly transitioned from contemporary jazz to Spirited Away soundtracks! Adding to the experience, our waiter was also super friendly and made sure we had everything that we needed. All and all it was a great night and we would definitely go back to celebrate another important day!"

featured_reviews.review_id:
I came here for cocktails. I'm sure the food is great, and ideally, I would have enjoyed the chance to taste it, but I only had an hour and I'd heard amazing things about their cocktail program so that was my only intention.

And it was worth it.

There are a lot of bars on the "official" Best Bars of 202_ and of the ones I've tried, often they're pretty underwhelming. I don't know who chooses them or how much money a bar has to pay to be on them, but most of the time, it doesn't seem to match with my experiences.

Botanist, however, does belong on that list. Is it the best cocktail bar ever? No. But it is an exceptionally good hotel bar? Yes.

Arguably, hotel bars have a much more difficult task than a regular cocktail bar because they have to appeal to a much wider range of tastes, people, and experiences. Generally, they're fairly generic, and play it safe with flavours, never straying too far from trends or accessibility of the most inexperienced tourist.

That's why Botanist is special. Sure, sitting at the bar, I saw people be boring and order Aperol Spritzes and wines and espresso martinis.  But the cocktail menu is so much more. It's big, for one thing. Has a great deal of diversity. You can find any sort of drink from a fizzy, sweet concoction to a serious spirit-forward sipper.

What I enjoyed most was the marriage of very BC/Canadian ingredients with spirits, some of which are fairly rare to find on a hotel bar cocktail list. Both that I tried were delicious, and mostly important for me, you can actually taste and feel the booze. Sure, one of them (Council of Trees -- amazing name!) seemed pretty juicy and easy, but you could *feel* it by the last sip. What a sneaky drink. I loved it. That's what I'm looking for: cool flavours, mixed and balanced so well that I barely can tell it's a cocktail but hits hard enough that I don't say, "Well, I could have just ordered a lemonade." Don't get me wrong, you can taste the interesting scotch, but it wasn't too much or too little. I'm going to be honest: I saw the Council of Trees on their menu online weeks ahead of time when planning my trip and knew I had to try it. I adored the botanical ingredients, and even its little cryptic blurb on the menu. If nothing else, I was going to try it. And it did not disappoint.

The second cocktail (Stone Fox) was a lot heavier, and very spirit-forward, which I appreciate on a cocktail menu. Especially hotels. As a cognac lover, I had to try it. It was a little heavy on the sweet apricot for me personally, but a lot of people would like it this way.

Shout out to the great bar snacks, too. They do not skimp. It was almost like a tapa, that's how much you get and it's good quality too.

Bartenders were sociable but not overbearing and seemed to nail the choices for other patrons. The bar area itself is small, and not exactly the coziest as it's right in the corridor leading from the entrance to the restaurant, but if you're only having a drink or two, it's totally fine. Hostess was super-nice and accommodating.

Would definitely come back.

places.name: Torafuku
places.description: Lively restaurant serving inventive Asian fusion dishes in a sleek, modern space.
places.address: Torafuku, 958 Main St, Vancouver, BC V6A 2W1

featured_reviews.review_id: One of the best restaurant in Metro Vancouver! I highly recommend the 7 course menu and their cocktails. DJ was really attentive and really nice to us throughout our dinner. Nice meeting you DJ! Hope to see you again soon. Thank you for your lovely service. We'll definitely come back
featured_reviews.review_text: One of the best restaurant in Metro Vancouver! I highly recommend the 7 course menu and their cocktails. DJ was really attentive and really nice to us throughout our dinner. Nice meeting you DJ! Hope to see you again soon. Thank you for your lovely service. We'll definitely come back
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for the kind feedback, we look forward to having you back soon

featured_reviews.review_id:
Torafuku in Vancouver offers an inviting culinary journey that seamlessly combines Asian influences with a modern flair. Celebrating its 8th anniversary with a reinvigorated spirit after a restoration, the restaurant presents an enticing fall menu ranging from light salads to robust main courses like the black cod bouillabaisse. The standout Beef Noodle Soup, noted for its melt-in-your-mouth quality, exemplifies their commitment to flavor. The Chicken & Crack Rice is another testament to the kitchen's prowess, offering comfort with a touch of sophistication.

Despite its popularity, the restaurant maintains an efficient service, with quick seating and fast, friendly staff, even on a Sunday - which seems like the ideal time to go if you don't want to wait. The dining experience is enhanced by the ambience, characterized by an understated room with an open kitchen and industrial touches, complemented by a communal table for those who enjoy a convivial atmosphere.

The versatility of the menu caters to different palates, with lunchtime focusing on quick, rice bowl options and dinner revealing more adventurous dishes with European influences. With thoughtful services like air conditioning and card payment options, the restaurant ensures a comfortable visit for its guests.

Operating hours accommodate a range of dining preferences, making it an ideal spot for both early and late meals. Torafuku stands out as a must-visit for its quality dishes, recognized by culinary experts and patrons alike, providing a rich dining experience in the heart of Vancouver.

Operating hours accommodate a range of dining preferences, making it an ideal spot for both early and late meals. Torafuku stands out as a must-visit for its quality dishes, recognized by culinary experts and patrons alike, providing a rich dining experience in the heart of Vancouver.

featured_reviews.review_id:
We came here on a recommendation from a friend and was amazed at how fantastic every single dish was.  Wish we could have tried more but we were so full.  We went with ala carte because there were assume options that were not available thru the tasting menu and it didn't disappoint. Definitely order their signature dish Kanpachi Crudo if you want one of the most unbelievable dishes to that we've ever had.  We also ordered the burrata, chicken wings, bison tartare, beef ribs and duck breast followed by cheese cake for dessert. Everything was amazing and we'll definitely be back.

Staff were also knowledgeable, fantastic, friendly and extremely efficient.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Lunch menu is 5/5, love the fried chicken rice bowl and crack salad!
Dinner is 4/5 only because we found a number of the dishes were quite salty. Wished there was some bread served with the mussels as our plates became quite saucy and needed something to soak it up with.
Service is always amazing though, and would definitely come back to try new dishes.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Torafuku
$$$
4/10

* service as abysmal.
* we arrived for our reservation at 8, ordered by 8:15, didn't get our food till 9pm and the restaurant wasn't even full! Just imagine they have a full house for service
* of course we were polite but to a certain point don't have an open service if you're going to have a slow service
* another thing is, once our orders were taken, the menus weren't even removed from our table and the water ran empty for a while before they were replaced with new bottles
* other than the food arriving late, the dishes were good but slightly cold
* it's kind of jarring that they kind of force their tasting menu that isn't very interesting in the first place and their lack of options for a la carte just doesn't satisfy most people for the price
* I don't recommend coming here

featured_reviews.review_id:
One of my favourite asian fusion restaurants in Vancouver! You'll find Taiwanese, Japanese and korean flavours. The food was flavourful and beautifully presented. Service was friendly and the decor was elevated and modern.

Chef Steve Kuan is super talented, very deserving of his michelin recommended status 2 years in a row!

Some highlights were the short rib, halibut, tartare, crudo and cheesecake! If you're around for lunch, his Taiwanese beef noodle soup is super authentic and the best i've found in Vancouver.

I will definitely be back soon!

places.name: Calabash Bistro
places.description: Laid-back spot for Caribbean dishes & rum drinks, plus late-night music in the basement.
places.address: Calabash Bistro, 428 Carrall St, Vancouver, BC V6B 2J7

featured_reviews.review_id: My friends and I had such a great time at Calabash! The food was delicious - we shared the veggie curry (which comes with fragrant rice, a beautiful salad and plantains), a side of roti and the coconut dumplings with mango butter (to die for!). The spicy plantain margaritas were amazing - our server added a special touch for us, so that made us feel pretty special. The staff were all so kind. After we left, we went back for dancing later. They played great music and it was a wholesome, fun vibe. The place is highly secure. We felt very safe inside despite it being in the DTES area.

featured_reviews.review_id: The area feels unsafe. The atmosphere in the place was great. The service was ok. The style of food served here is not to my taste so I can't say about it. I ordered fries and it was a bit spicy for me. They charged 20% tip on the bill. After we finished our food we wanted to go down to the basement floor to dance. They told us that because we shared dishes and didn't ordered in enough money they want us to pay each one of us 5$ to go dancing. We didn't like it and decided to quit.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Went there on Saturday for dinner. Had a reservation through open table app for 7:45.
First impression: The place was mostly empty, after a brief miscommunication with the hostess (she couldn't read our name on the reservation so she brought the tablet to us to identify ourselves lol), we got taken down the steps and seated at our table. Cosy atmosphere, chill-vibes, we were really hungry so got to ordering right away. I asked for the iconic red stripe (Jamaican beer), was told that they didn't have any in stock. I opted for the rum punch. And boy was it punching! I couldn't finish mine, I found it too strong. Not a downfall on the barman, I'm just not really a rum person. We ordered spicy beef patties and jerk pork belly for starters, and curry goat meal and oxtail dinner for mains.
First impressions experience: 8/10

Patties: you get two with a choice of dip. The pastry was crisp and flaky, very light and enjoyable, the filling was plenty full, but not spicy at all. In fact I think it could've done with more seasoning. Overall - 8/10.

Jerk pork belly: oh lord! Sooooo goood! Good size portion for a starter (2 pieces), drenched in tropical salsa type sauce and served with 4 fried dumplings. I thought the dumplings were a little hard (the outer layer was too fried and hard), but overall good. The pork belly was well seasoned and definitely a highlight of the starters.
Overall 9/10.

Curry goat: comes in an old school lunchbox style containers, accompanied by rice and peas (peas were white though), and a green leaf salad mix. The goat was well cooked, falling off the bone, juicy, tender, but also, a little mild on the seasoning. Not much curry flavour coming through.
Overall 7/10.

Oxtail: generally my absolute favorite Jamaican dish, unfortunately just like the curry goat, under seasoned. Very well cooked, comes off the bone completely as it should, no issues there, but lacks the authentic flavour that would be enhanced had the seasoning been portioned into the stew properly.
Overall 6/10.

Service: attentive, friendly, smiling staff, no complaints at all.
Overall 10/10

featured_reviews.review_id: NOT impressed with the pricing on the drinks menu.  Every drink was UP-CHARGED by $1. The excuse was that the menu wasn't updated.  Electronic and/or hardcopy.  Both way easy to update.  The waitress knew of this and DIDN'T tell anyone at the table. There was 12 of us, all ordering multiple drinks. Only the ones who brought it to her attention were given any consideration of a refund.  If the drinks were priced right,  NO ISSUE,  but because they were underhanded in this I won't ever go back.

featured_reviews.review_id: Carribean-influenced cuisine in an unfortunate area. This neighbourhood has significantly declined and there is barely any lighting - you have to know about this place to find it. The Dark and Stormy ($15) has ginger beer which I love, perfectly sweetened. My jerk chicken was moist but the flavour fell flat. There was almost enough sauce to mix with the rice (it'd be bland without sauce, which I think is normal for many cuisines!). Those were nothing to write home about, it was the fried plantain that was REALLY tasty; wish I had more than 2 slices. Overall, thought this was pricey for the quality and flavours. The server was sweet but couldn't remember if she took my order, and walked away before I could get my receipt. Notes: auto 20% gratuity for big groups. The basement turns into a dance floor at 10:30pm, so book in advance for resos close to that time. My friend recommended the coconut dumplings, which sound odd but I might try them next time I want to walk through DTES in the dark!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Sports bar. They advertise as a great sports bar.

Having games on screen with sound off while boots and cats club music plays the entire time. Easily worst "sports bar" I've been to.

Pizza we got was doughy from being undercooked. The food overall very disappointing

The beers were good. That and the convenient location are the only reason it's not 1 star.

Will never go back.

featured_reviews.review_id:
There was a concert next door, so the restaurant was very busy, and seemed understaffed to handle the amount of patrons in for dinner or drinks.

We placed our appetizer order, followed by the entree order a few minutes afterwards.  We then didn't see our server until after we were more than halfway done our entrees.  While the food was brought out quickly by the runners, no refills on drinks were offered at our table, while all other tables around us where receiving water refills constantly.

We went because of the prime rib special being offered for Labour Day weekend, and although I ordered it medium rare, it came out medium well.  Also, minor complaint...on the menu it says the prime rib comes with au jus, but it seems like it was a red wine au jus, and tasted rather sweet.  With no salt/pepper set on the table, and no check-up from our server, I ended up eating the now sweet tasting over-cooked prime rib.

We had great experiences at the restaurant previously, but this was enough to turn us away.  I don't think we will be returning.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Worst dining experience I've had. There was no napkins or cutleries on our table. I had to asked for them after the foods came. The waitress brought 2 sets of fork and knife and 3 napkins while we were a table of FIVE. It was so hard to get their attention to bring extra cutleries so I didn't bother and just ate my calamari by hands. Others in my table had to wait for awhile to get more forks since they ordered prime rib. We also used our own napkins, luckily we carried some with us.

The waitress also didn't want to hournor their prime rib special deal until we showed her deal on the Parq website. She walked away for a bit, came back with another person to confirm that the prime rib special doesn't come with a drink, then walked away again, came back and said she will make it works for us then brought a glass of wine to the person who showed her the website earlier. The other two in my table had to ask for their beers. Prime rib special isn't something new at BC kitchen and we had it many times before. The staff should know better.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I was attending a concert and thought I would try BC Kitchen. Big disappointment. I had the Prime Rib (house smoked Prime Rib served with crispy potatoe, mixed vegetables, au jus & yorkshire pudding) and a happy hour glass of wine.  The best part of the whole meal was the wine and au jus. The prime rib was adequate, the crispy potato was not crispy, the mixed vegetables consisted of 3 pieces of extremely hard broccoli and the Yorkshire pudding was disgusting. I ordered a second glass of wine so that I could swallow the food which took 15 minutes to arrive. By that time I had finished my disgusting dinner. Needless to say, I will not be returning anytime soon. Save your money and eat at McDonald's.
After posting my review, the manager Albert) stopped by and we discussed my concerns with my meal and in the end made it right. He is going to talk to the kitchen and gave me a nice glass of wine. Thank you Albert for taking the time to address my concerns.

Service was slow with only 4 tables occupied. The food quality is not what I remember it to be from previous visits. The fries are crispy but hollow and oily. The batter on the fish was crispy outside and oily on the inside. The fish was bland and even oilier. Even the tartar sauce was bland.
My drink - a 7up was watered down most likely from the bar well.
Overall not what I was expecting.

places.address: Kissa Tanto, 263 E Pender St, Vancouver, BC V6A 1T8

featured_reviews.review_id: Hit it! Wow! Maybe the best meal I've had in Vancouver. So many incredibly delicious things with great service. We had early reservations which you'll need to make at least a month in advance. We sat at the bar which had great ambiance. The staff did an amazing job of the small details and with the dishes. The charcoal udon was just so incredible. Out of the 6 dishes we got, the only one I did not enjoy as much was the salmon. It wasn't bad but I just found it not at the same level as the other dishes. Still for me five !

It's expensive for sure, but like some other Michelin star restaurants you don't leave wondering if the food and experience were worth it. If you want to spoil yourself have the $90 Japanese truffle omelette... Wow!

My husband and I ordered their $155 omakase and it was a pleasant experience.

Pro: I really liked that the servers check in after you're done eating to prevent the awkward experience of giving feedback with a mouth full of food.

Slight Con: My husband does not eat seafood while I enjoy seafood, so the servers said they were able to create a couple individual dishes that will have seafood for me and meat for him. Unfortunately, it was just one small dish that had this variation and the rest came out on one plate and they were all meat focused. I had expected two dishes to be individualized; therefore, just having one personalized dish made the meal fall slightly flat.

Other than that, Kissa Tanto provided impeccable service, tasty food and we definitely will come back for a special occasion.

featured_reviews.review_id: Absolutely a wonderful tasting experience. The combinations of flavours were exactly right. The fish tasted very fresh and the sauce on top puts the whole dish together. The highlight is definitely the truffle omelette-- the most perfect omelette I've ever had in my life. The truffle was aromatic, paired with creamy eggs. I just felt that my table was a bit squishy and the table felt very full.

featured_reviews.review_id:
We were lucky enough to be one of the first seated and got one of the bigger tables. Thankful for this, as the standard tables for two looked really cramped. Service was top notch, and our server took the time to explain menu items and answer our questions.

Lots of interesting flavours and textures in their dishes, though the octopus was chewier than I expected, and the amount of cheese on the carne cruda over-dominated the beef. On the plus side, the charcoal pasta had a wonderful bounce to it, the duck breast was the tenderest I've ever had (much better than French style), and the tiramisu was seriously good. I would've got a second order if we weren't so stuffed. Cocktails and the citrus-infused sake were superb. Great place to try at least once.

Tip for photographers: if you are taking daytime photos, ask for the corner table by the window when you book. It's one of the best spots for bright natural light.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Good food with amazing service. Everything was done perfectly and there was nothing that we didn't like. Went with the omikaze and the recommended sweet spot for pricing of approximately $170 - $200pp. We weren't too hungry so the waiter went more for higher quality food rather than quantity. The waitress asked a series of questions in order to tailor the menu to us a little which was nice.

You'll want to make a reservation if you want a better chance at getting a seat. Walk-ins are possible but fill up quick. Paid street parking is available and relatively cheap (couple of dollars for the 2-3h duration we were there).

Definitely a nice experience and worth trying at least once if you get the chance, but it is quite pricey. For the total price you could eat at a few nice restaurants instead, but life's short and you can't take your money with you so as long as the wife is happy, you'll be happy.

Service here is great and the owner is super nice and friendly.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Honestly pretty disappointed.  I had very high expectations for this place as lot of people have recommended it.  3 restaurants in one, yet not one done well...... Simply Delicious is lower then average Japanese food..... East Van Banh mi over priced vietnamese subs that are at best sub par for double the price.  And Saigon Secrets come on....

Atmosphere not the greatest.   Service was somewhat good, I mean the servers hounding you every 3 minutes to see if you want to order  more.   Food quality not good.  Expect better then this in Vancouver.  Can get 100 times better Banh mi for 1/3 the price all across Vancouver.  Sushi meh.....  Pho, price vs quality... I dont know was pretty disappointed.  Honestly first time i think a restaurant has over charged me on my bill

Stopped by for a quick good lunch this afternoon after running around Stanley Park. November 18, 2023. I was hungry and could eat whatever!

Bunch of choice of cheap chain restaurants to choose from in this underground food court. But the young man working here at WE GRILL saw me looking at their menu and totally sold me what I wanted. Good job guys! It was a good lunch! Thanks.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I recently had the pleasure of dining at We Grill, located in the Waterfront Center Food Court near the Pinnacle Harbourfront Vancouver. We Grill specializes in freshly made veggie samosas, and they are absolutely delicious.

The person working at the We Grill stall was friendly and welcoming, which made for a pleasant dining experience. I had the opportunity to try their veggie samosas, which were crispy on the outside and filled with a flavorful mixture of potatoes and spices on the inside. They were simply amazing and left me wanting more.

I also had the chance to taste their fries, which were equally as delicious as the samosas. They were crispy and perfectly seasoned, making for a great side dish to the samosas.

Overall, I would highly recommend We Grill to anyone looking for tasty and authentic Indian cuisine in Vancouver. The freshly made veggie samosas and fries are a must-try, and the friendly staff make for a welcoming and enjoyable dining experience. Thank you to the staff at We Grill for a great meal.

The man who works at this restaurant in the morning is absolutely that. Every day I went by he had a smile on his face, made an excellent breakfast, and was kind to my kids. When he learned we were going to the local suspension bridge, he dug around in his register and gave us two free tickets. And watching him with other customers--he was as kind to all. 6 stars

Locally owned hidden gem!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Another beach day at Jericho  and a search for tacos after. This time my girlfriend and I went to MI Casa on West 4th.

The location is at the corner of burrard and west 4th. Park on 4th where there is lots of meter parking. The entrance is on the burrard side. You climb a set of stairs to get to the second floor venue. Watch out on the way in or you will end up in the tattoo shop underneath.

We shared a tequila lime Margherita which was excellent.

For dinner we had tried a quesadea platter of 3, a taco Platter of 3, and an enchiladas dish.

The quesadea we had chicken, beef, and pulled pork. This was excellent and our favorite dish.

The soft tacos were tasty and good size  we had a beef taco, and 2 different types of pork. They were good but not as good as the quesedia.

Finally we shared the enchiladas. Which came with 3 as well as rice and beans. These were chicken and were a touch dry. The green sauce was ok but this dish was on the bland side.

The service was ok and the venue was large and clean. We went on a Sunday around 7pm. The place was half full. The food came out quick and the staff gave us everything we needed.

The place had a fairly large menu and it looks like they do large families or parties well.

$$

places.address: Axum Restaurant, 1279 E Hastings St, Vancouver, BC V6A 1S4

featured_reviews.review_id:
Axum Ethiopian Restaurant offered an experience that fell short of expectations. While dining with friends, we tried the Injera with vegetable sides. Sadly, the food lacked flavor, leaning towards being bland.

On the brighter side, the restaurant's African-themed ambiance was a highlight, adding a pleasant touch to the atmosphere.

However, hygiene became a concern when the chef sneezed into her hands and continued cooking, creating an unhygienic situation that affected our perception of the place.

Overall, our visit to Axum Ethiopian Restaurant left us disappointed. Despite the inviting ambiance, the lack of flavor in the food and the concerning hygiene practices made it clear that this wouldn't be a place we'd choose to revisit.

featured_reviews.review_id:
While I was pleased with the overall flavour and number of vegetarian options, I was a bit disappointed by the prices/serving sizes.

For example, the esquite was delicious but not worth the $16 for a small bowl. Likewise, I expected the machete to be more filled with toppings. A VERY thin layer of refried beans and some avocado didn't seem to be worth the $24.

Still, I would go back to try their other dishes.

featured_reviews.review_id: Small family run operation with great food. Prices are reasonable and the meals are very filling. I enjoyed my Huaracha Pastor, however my partners Beef Machete was spicy and tasty. Definitely recommend the Machete. We heard the table next to ask about the Flan but they were sold out by 7pm, must have been good! It's a small operation so you have to wait a little for your food but it's worth it and freshly cooked. The couple running it are so kind and lovely.

featured_reviews.review_id: I love this place, i can't recommend enough, it's a small place only a few tables inside, but the flavour is huge! The hot chocolate is amazing, and all the food on the menu is delicious and well portioned, I always leave feeling perfectly full, and the price is reasonable. The tres salsas  is probably my favourite but all the food I tried so far has been full of great flavours. Best authentic Mexican food in Vancouver.
featured_reviews.review_text: I love this place, i can't recommend enough, it's a small place only a few tables inside, but the flavour is huge! featured_reviews.review_id:
Really unique place in Vancouver focusing on pre-Hispanic Mexican food. Most of the menu items feature their homemade blue corn tortillas and there's a great selection of traditional cacao drinks (hot and iced) - stuff that I don't think you can find anywhere else in the city. So I was very curious to try, and decided to take my parents here while they were visiting because my dad requested "Mexican food". Because this is not your typical Mexican food I wasn't sure if it would be what they had in mind, but it was a hit with all of us and my dad even said it might be the best Mexican food he's ever had.
I got the chihatl to drink and the itacates de flor de calabaza for my meal. My first time trying chihatl, first time trying itacates, and first time trying pumpkin blossom in any form, and everything was amazing. Even though the chihatl was served icy it was still a "warming" drink with the cinnamon spice. The frothed texture was really cool. Very unique taste. The itacates are probably best described as Mexican samosas, but the tortillas are not deep-fried which keeps them soft. The tortilla and bean filling had an earthy flavour which paired perfectly with the flor de calabaza (I had no expectation to what pumpkin blossom would taste like but it surprisingly was very similar to pumpkin flesh). The waiter brought 3 sauces to the table for us: pico de gallo, a dark and sweet salsa roja, and a spicy salsa verde. The sauces were all delicious (I could've eaten the roja with a spoon) but almost unnecessary as the food was so tasty even without that it felt a shame to do anything to cover it up.
My parents had the Huarache Nopal and Machete Pollito and were, needless to say, very happy with those, but I didn't try them. I did try my dad's hot chocolate, which is great if you're not so adventurous since it basically just tasted like a really high quality but "mainstream" hot choc. Also note the drinks are served in bowls made from large dried gourd husks(?) which provides a unique drinking experience.
The prices are really fair for what you're getting. The total for our party (3 entrees and 2 drinks) came to about $75 before tip.
The place is small and really cozy, and while the staff wasn't the most outgoing, they were polite and seemed to really care to make sure we were enjoying everything. I would really recommend this place for a truly different Mexican dining experience.

What a Nice spot !
After checking the review, we went there with my partner.
The place is small but we find place after just 5min.
The staff is really gentle, always happy to answer your questions.
We order the Yuca fries, the elotes and the chorizo machete.
Everything was amazing !
I definitely recommend the Yuca fries !
The machete is the perfect food for Sharing.
We also took the mango juice, was also really good, perfect drink for calm the spice of the jalapeno 

Guy's, if you are looking for quiet spot, with good staff and really tasty mexican food, that's all what you Will have here. Price is clearly fair for the quality of the Product ! (47$ for all this)

featured_reviews.review_id: The salads and antipasto were all fantastic and savory. The scallop dish was especially noteworthy. The 43 ozs steak was cooked to perfection. The grilled carrots were sweet as were the potatoes. The only disappointment was the shrimp with linguine dish, the shrimp was half cooked with all three orders. However, the linguine with sufretto sauce was very tasty. The grilled sea bass was great, and I don't eat fish. Food rated at 4.3, service at 4.6. Sorry no pics of main dishes, too busy eating.

featured_reviews.review_id: We opted for this Italian restaurant due to its intriguing menu, which goes beyond just pizza and pasta. However, making a reservation through Google Maps was not possible, as the dates and times were never available. We eventually booked directly from the restaurant's homepage, where we had to pay a $25 deposit per person. Surprisingly, the restaurant wasn't as busy as we initially anticipated, and it seemed like walking in without a deposit would have been fine. As for the food, it was generally good. We ordered a variety of dishes, including cured meat, cheese, pasta, and beef skewers, which were served in sampler-sized plates. The pasta had a chewy texture, while the salad served alongside the beef skewers lacked thoughtful presentation. The dessert doughnuts could use some improvement in terms of presentation, but they were deliciously chewy. The service was polite, although it felt a bit awkward. Overall, the experience was okay.

featured_reviews.review_id: I had a fantastic dining experience at Bacaro! This modern Italian restaurant captures the essence of Venetian bacaros beautifully by letting simple ingredients shine in the most delicious ways. The dishes I tried, like the charred octopus and the lightly spiced duck ragu, and the linguine ai gamberi were all exceptional, but what truly stood out was Chef Charlie's talent and care. His culinary skills shone through in every bite, making this meal unforgettable. Highly recommended!

Found this gem of a tapas/Mediterranean resto while browsing Michelin's recommended list for Vancouver. Then later stumbled by it late at 9pm and stopped in and glad we did.

It's attached to a hotel sort of but under completely different ownership. Service was even better than the solid food. The one cocktail we ordered was good but they make it in house ahead of time and bottle it, so not my ideal drink but still was very good.

Have a small patio that is awesome and inside decor is nice too. Very fair prices so a good value for a nice do inexperience. Hopefully we will be visiting Vancouver again soon.

You have to try La Casita!

featured_reviews.review_id:
We tried this spot tonight for the first time. It was Taco Tuesday so the tacos were on for $4 each. We tried a selection of them and they were delicious. Very fresh!

We also tried the nachos and jalapeno poppers. The nachos had toppings on every bite (nacho fans will know how important this is haha) and the poppers were perfect.

The service was wonderful. Friendly and charismatic staff!

We also had some margaritas (mango and strawberry.)

10/10 would recommend this spot.
Date spot or a night out with friends, the atmosphere suits any occasion.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I had an absolutely fantastic dining experience at Johnny's  on Oak today. I made a unique order of 2 chicken breasts with spanakopita, salad, and extra tzatziki sauce. Despite this not being a standard menu item, Connie, who provided impeccable service, went above and beyond to convey my requests to Johnny. Without hesitation, they not only fulfilled but also surpassed all my culinary expectations.

Having worked in the restaurant industry during my young adulthood and even having had an 8-year connection to a Greek family, my standards are exceptionally high. The chicken was impeccably moist and flavorful, while the spanakopita boasted a perfectly flaky exterior with a delectably moist and delicious filling. I requested a little extra tzatziki, and Connie promptly delivered it with a welcoming smile.

In summary, my dining experience at Johnny's on Oak was nothing short of delectable, and I left thoroughly satisfied. The combination of superb food, exceptional service, and the willingness to accommodate unique requests truly made this visit unforgettable.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I have been coming to this restaurant since the Entertainment Coupon days, when it was originally Best Neighbours.

The food is high quality, the staff are consistently nice, and I am grateful they don't mind me just hanging out at a table and  playing on my tablet, long after I have finished my meal. I have also never felt rushed to leave.

The renovations done after the pandemic improved the already great ambience, and really modernized the place.

I hope Connie and family, and the other staff are around for a very long time.

featured_reviews.review_id:
We love Johnnys aka best neighbours :)
We tried the fried chicken with truffle honey for the first time and it was awesome. Got a spanakopita and a ham and pineapple pizza and it's like I had a slice of a memory. My family has been eating here since I think 1990 maybe before that and Alex and Kathy were the owners, now it's their son Johnny and his wife Connie and they too are such lovely people. I have also worked here when I was 18/19 years old and it was a pretty fun job.  I have had my fair share of pizza here, but I think it's to be noted that it still tastes just as good as it did 35 years ago.
See you guys soon :)

places.name: Unchai Restaurant
places.description: Traditional Thai noodle soups, curries & stir-fries plated in a down-to-earth environment.
places.address: Unchai Restaurant, 2351 Burrard St, Vancouver, BC V6J 3J2

featured_reviews.review_id:
One of the most authentic Thai restaurants in town offering a wide selection of original recipes/ dishes.
The restaurant is small and the servers, albeit being friendly, were not the most accommodating. We asked for crushed peanuts for our papaya salad and they gave us a mere half a teaspoon.
The other times we ate here before, they have served peanuts with the papaya salad, which is how we prefer it. We would be ok if get charged extra for this too.
Our friend also ordered Thai coffee which came with ice and we asked if we could get another one but with no ice, and they said no  For this reason, I'm rating their service a 3/5 despite their politeness.
But I'd go back for the food in a heartbeat!

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Hi Natasha,

Thank you for giving us five stars. Even if you are not satisfied with our service. We would like to explain what happened.

The first is peanuts. You all ordered papaya salad. And your boyfriend has asked for peanuts for it but in the recipe we don't have it on the menu. which we have given You go for a small cup of peanuts. and you have asked for more which we have refused Because it is something that is not in the recipe. 2. For iced coffee The shop is sure that we can make iced coffee without ice. But that day you asked us to make hot coffee for you. It wasn't on the menu so we declined. However, I think there has been a misunderstanding in this communication. and the shop would like to inform you that In fact, the shop has announced that they will do take out only from September 5th. Thank you very much.

featured_reviews.review_id:
A hidden gem just off of Broadway & Burrard. After driven by so many times and noticing the constant busyness, I decided to try.

To start, the roti with curry was a nice snack to begin with. Crispy and soft, and the curry was nice too.

After, I had their pork pad see ew and it was one of the best stir fry noodles I've ever had. It was flavourful and mixed well with the veggies and pork.

Lastly, the chicken wings were decent, the crust/skin was fried nicely but the meat was quite dry. Sauce and flavour were on point, though.

Would highly recommend their pad see ew.

featured_reviews.review_id: Probably the best pad see yew I've had in central Vancouver yet. The rice noodles were delightfully flavorful with much dimension. The pork was crispy and well cooked. featured_reviews.review_id:
Food: 7/10
Value: 6/10
Service: 10/10
Location: Paid street parking only

I really wanted to like this place based on reviews. I love Thai food and wanted another place to frequent. But it was just ok. Some of the stuff lacked flavour. The best thing we ordered was the pad thai. The soup noodles were good too.  Ordered a little of everything because I wanted to try it all. They had a very small menu.

Value wise - portion sizes were quite small for the price.

Service is awesome. It's an open kitchen and they warn you about it right as you step in. They worry the smell may get on your clothes. Very friendly service!

Overall I don't think I would drive out of my way to visit this place again.

featured_reviews.review_id:
One of the best Thai restaurants I've been to so far. We ordered the Pad Si Ew Moo Grob (rice sheet noodles with crispy pork) and Chuchi Pla Tod (creamy coconut curry with crispy basa fillets). Both were so much more flavourful than I expected, and I was pleasantly surprised with the quality and presentation. The basa fillets and pork were perfectly crispy. I'd definitely recommend both dishes, though if I had to pick a must-try item, it'd be the Chuchi Pla Tod for sure.

The place is small with little seating and an open kitchen. I came in the summer and there wasn't much foot traffic, so sitting outside was actually enjoyable. The waitress came out to check in on us quite often (most of their customers seem to sit outside) and refilled our water frequently.

It's about $25-$35 per person, which is on the higher end of price, but was so worth it for the food, quantity was decent too. I would definitely recommend and will be back myself to show this place to other friends.

featured_reviews.review_id: I was interested to see and eat at the Michelin guide, Cafe Medina. I came here around 8:45am. The table seats were already full. So I was solo and of course I was seated in the bar counter area. I could see the Michelin guide sign in front of me. The clerk was very busy moving around. You can see how popular this place is. I had a warm latte with lavender added. Next I chose two famous Liege style waffles topped with milk chocolate lavender and mixed berries compote. I guess I expected too much. The clerk was busy and didn't give much service. The expected waffles were not very warm and small size. The topping sauce was smooth and flavorful. I look forward to the next time and want to visit again.

places.name: The Greek Gastown
places.address: The Greek Gastown, 221 Carrall St, Vancouver, BC V6B 2J2

featured_reviews.review_id:
So nearly 5 stars! My friend recommended The Greek for excellent Greek food and it did not disappoint. Flavours were impeccable, everything was done really nicely. We had the souvlaki platter, dip taster and moussaka.

I took half a star away for the music being slightly too loud for good conversation (especially beneath the speakers), and another half star for our server (tall, brunette lady with tattoos) not being the best. Don't get me wrong, she did not do anything wrong per se but also did not make us feel particularly welcomed or treated warmly. Not sure if it was because we weren't drinking. She was... just doing her job and it was clear from the way she came across.

I would come again for the food!

I would come again for the food!

featured_reviews.review_id: The Greek gas town was amazing!! We had excellent service by Adam. The happy hour is from 2pm - 5pm everyday with lots of drinks and food options. We ordered a Greek feta salad, pork souvlaki, lamb souvlaki skewers and the platter for 2 in which we got chicken skewers, pork skewers and tiger shrimp. I highly recommend checking this place out as it has many options and it's located in a great area. Will surely be back to try the other options.

- The Greek Gastown Team

featured_reviews.review_id: The food was delicious, the server was attentive and did make some nice suggestions but didn't check on us again after dropping off our food until we were ready for the bill. It was overall a very nice experience with very good food.
featured_reviews.review_text: The food was delicious, the server was attentive and did make some nice suggestions but didn't check on us again after dropping off our food until we were ready for the bill. It was overall a very nice experience with very good food.

featured_reviews.review_id:
There were a couple of seats available on Saturday early evening and we were seated quickly. It took a long time for the server to come get our orders. Though the service was a bit slow, everyone was very friendly and welcoming.

I loved that you can mix and max different souvlaki. I've never seen this option before. Though I was a bit disappointed with the salmon (a bit bland tasting) and wished I went with my original choice of two prawns. Those were very flavourful and cooked perfectly! The rice was a bit watery. I loved the veggies on the side. The souvlaki meal didn't come with pita, which was a first at a Greek place!

The ambiance was good. Decor was nice. The music was a bit too loud. Good experience overall, but not quite 5 stars.

featured_reviews.review_id: My experience at the Greek restaurant was a mix of hits and misses. The watermelon mint mojito was a refreshing and unique twist, a definite highlight. The lemon potato was flavorful and satisfying. However, the beef skewer and rice left much to be desired, lacking in taste. The service, although friendly, was disappointingly slow. While I appreciate the staff's warmth, the overall experience fell short. I'm uncertain if I'll return to this restaurant in the future.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I was in two minds about coming here for dinner and I decided to give it a try despite my better judgement. I'm not sure what vibe this restaurant is going for but it's not fine dining. The music is loud and so you can't hear yourself think. It's a cross between a bar and a club only there's no dance floor and they serve food.

The food itself is disappointing, either charge less or increase your portions. I ordered the spanakopita and my boyfriend ordered the moussaka. These would pass for an appetiser at best.

I don't recommend this place and won't be coming back.

featured_reviews.review_id: Isn't amazing meal for $10 in Vancouver today? That's the best restaurant I will say. Great value and super friendly service. That's a real Chinese food culture heritage and support the people in community ! You shouldn't miss it!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Tatos Kitchen is worth it for the amount of food you get! It's classic Chinese takeout food that just hits the spot, with lots of variety. Amazing deal and convenient~

Also, the handwritten menu and drawings are very nicely drawn and cute, definitely a nice change from printed/text menus :)

featured_reviews.review_id: I'm very glad to see that there is a replacement for the previous business in this location, Kent's Kitchen. They are a reasonable facsimile for the former business and carrying on the tradition of good food in good quantity for reasonable pricing. The choices are still plentiful enough but not quite the depth of choice as what was offered by Kent's Kitchen....

featured_reviews.review_id: This location used to be Kent's Kitchen in Vancouver Chinatown.  The new owner wanted to serve the community with quality Chinese food at reasonable prices.  I believe they achieved it.  Today is my first time here and bought some Chinese dishes for tonight's dinner.  I was surprised to see how much they served for my order.  Unlike some other places that  provide mediocre quantity or just fill it to the container.  Tantos Kitchen staff filled my order above the container.  I like it .   Service was excellent as well.  Food quality is excellent too!  Tantos Kitchen also serve ice cream.  All foods are take out only so bring your own bag.

featured_reviews.review_id:
The taste is different from when it was Kent's Kitchen. They use way too much MSG in their food.

I'm a fan of MSG but not to a point where I get this tingling feeling inside my lips.

Still the best deal around. Under $10 for 2 items on steam rice. Enough food for 2 people.

featured_reviews.review_id:
They have great portions. 2 items and noodles or fries rice for $11-12. Also now they have 25 cent arcade game and $1 claw  machine game that is normally $2-5 everywhere else.. saw a lady spend $25 and she got a pile of toys..she was a pro..or the machines really easy.. my new place to pick up some quick cheap food and play some games for half an hour. They have tablets, cell phones, wallets, shoes, and some interesting collector items...funko pops and canucks figures, boxes of pokemon packs and toys
Better than any other claw machine I played and this one is easier. The good can't beat for around $12... would be $18 to $22 anywhere else..and better than the food court at the malls

featured_reviews.review_id: We enjoyed our food, and like the space. They can improve their service but overall I recommend trying this restaurant. Their eggplant dip and lamb dishes were the best ones! Also their bread tasted very good! The portions are pretty good and the price is reasonable.

featured_reviews.review_id:
This was our first time at the Afghan Horsemen Restaurant.
We had been in the seperate room to the left which was booked for a bday party which was perfect.
We had a belly dancer come in which was great.
If you are hungry and like to share order the Horsemen special platter. We really enjoyed it.
They don't have a lot of beer not wine selection, but we enjoyed what they had.
Cosy atmosphere, great and friendly service.
We will definitely come back!

places.name: White Spot Dunsmuir
places.address: White Spot Dunsmuir, 405 Dunsmuir St, Vancouver, BC V6B 1X4

featured_reviews.review_id:
We arrived a popular breakfast place nearby at 10 am and the line looked like it would take at least an hour. After 10 minutes, the line did not move much so we decided to come here instead.

Great atmosphere. Big, clean, large booths.

Food was alright. Not bad and not particular either. A safe bet overall for everyone in a group. We were a group of four and one of us had a more strict diet restriction. I ordered the Classic Benedict, which would be better if it came with more sauce.

They had Mighty Leaf for tea, which was one of the best tea bag brand you could find at grocery store. It was a pleasant surprise.

Our server seemed to have a bad day and struggled a bit. I encouraged them that it was okay as we all had days like this.

I have been here a couple of times and probably will come back again.

featured_reviews.review_id: Was recommended to dine at a White Spot by a local and this one was central and near our hotel. We ordered one of the burgers which the waiter suggested and it didn't disappoint. The chicken salad was also tasty. The kids had their Kid's meals, which were great value with a drink and ice cream. Our waiter Joe was awesome and gave excellent service. Gave lots of recommendations on what to do in Vancouver too

featured_reviews.review_id: It has been more than a decade since my last visit and I'm delightful surprise that the quality of food is better than I anticipated. I asked for easy dressing for the farro salad with grilled chicken and they delivered that. The grilled chicken breast was cold and over cooked and they offered to redo the grilled chicken, which's much better. The Turkey dinner was quite good - Turkey breast is soft and tender. Wish the gravy to serve by the side as it's on the salty side. Service was good. We wanted to make a reservation and they did not accept reservation for party of two. It's a busy night. Overall a pleasant dinner experience.

featured_reviews.review_id: On a clear Saturday two hours before puck drop at a Canucks game a few blocks away... and we walked in - sans reservation - and got a table right away. Better yet , happy hour was still underway! I had the Avocado Beyond burger with mushrooms and fries, and my companion had the legendary White Spot burger and fries. My burger was great - substantial and very tasty. My companion's was underwhelming, underdressed and with a squished, soggy bun. Our awesome server had it remade in mere minutes and version 2 was much more palatable. All in all, a very good experience!

places.name: Maxine's Cafe & Bar
places.description: Retro-style establishment featuring brunch, dinner & cocktails, plus happy hours.
places.address: Maxine's Cafe & Bar, 1325 Burrard St, Vancouver, BC V6Z 1Z7

featured_reviews.review_id:
Light and airy, buzzing atmosphere. The doors on all sides were open so sitting inside gave an indoor-outdoor feel. There's a nice looking bar in the centre and there was a good vibe in the restaurant.

Food was average - I ordered the fried chicken and the batter was far too salty, hard and thick. I'm not one to not finish my meal, but I had to pick out the chicken inside it and leave the batter.

Service was friendly and attentive.

Overall, I'd recommend this place for a casual meal/drink.

featured_reviews.review_id: My friend and I came on a Sat at 11am and got in right away. When we left around noon, there was a bit of a line outside--something to keep in mind. Highly recommend the brioche French toast. It's crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The French omelette was perfectly cooked but there was a bit too much dill inside for my taste. It comes with fries but I enjoyed it with sourdough instead and made little egg sandwiches :)

We got off the cruise ship with luggage in tow and were warmly received, and bags were stored while we had a delightful brunch.  Quite the experience. Thanks everyone!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Solid place for brunch! Good menu with plenty of variety and beautiful atmosphere! We were seated immediately.

We ordered the eggs cocotte and French omelette. I really enjoyed the eggs cocotte which was flavourful (and came with toast. Love a good breakfast with carbs). Omelette was decent but nothing spectacular. Took a star off for service as our server never came back after serving the food.
featured_reviews.review_text:

We ordered the eggs cocotte and French omelette. I really enjoyed the eggs cocotte which was flavourful (and came with toast. Love a good breakfast with carbs). Omelette was decent but nothing spectacular. Took a star off for service as our server never came back after serving the food.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I came specifically to try their fried chicken and it did not disappoint. It was crunchy and juicy. I recommend Maxines shaft slushy. Its a tad small, but very refreshing. Service was very nice and attentive.

I hear great stuff about their brunch, but only made it for their dinner and happy hour menu. I found that the portions were very small for the price. The mac and cheese wasn't creamy enough and the brisket it came with were small- did not justify the $30 price tag. The "shareable" lobster dish was delicious, but not at all shareable. I don't recommend the foie gras parfait, that was not pleasant.

featured_reviews.review_id:
My favourite place for brunch in Metro Vancouver! The food was amazing and the menu isn't your average brunch menu. Staff were attentive and hospitable.

The Egg Cocotte had perfectly poached eggs and the tomatoes, olive, red pepper sauce underneath was a burst of flavour. The French Omelette, again, was perfectly cooked and the herb and cheese inside paired well and was not too heavy.

I don't really like fries but I kept eating their fries. Every piece was crispy and even after it cooled, they didn't become soggy. The Maxine's Bacon were thick cut bacon with a slightly sweet taste. They also have regular bacon as an add on if you prefer savoury bacon.

They don't take reservations for brunch and their peak hours are around 11am to 1:30pm. If you're a party of 2, you'll be seated relatively quickly. Larger groups will be a longer wait as most of their tables seat 2-4 people. They also don't have an indoor waiting area so I wouldn't recommend coming on a rainy day if you don't want to wait in the rain.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I think this restaurant , given the atmosphere, price tag, quality of menu, food is worthy of more than 4 stars BUT the Maxine's Burger is only 4 stars.

I had the Maxine's burger add Bacon and add Black Truffle shavings on the fries.

Burger tasted like a fancier Big Mac, all the way to the lettuce and Mac sauce. Patty was good but wasn't as crispy as I'd like to see from a smash patty - Monzo does this better.

Fries were the highlight. Fresh cut shoe string fries cooked to the right crisp level.

I would go back in order to try other menu items. Restaurant has a French bistro vibe and the prices are very reasonable.

We've tried 3 dishes here. All of it are really good.  Personally, spicy chicken udon is the best. I love the spicy noodles and chicken karaage!
Staff are friendly and ready to serve you!

featured_reviews.review_id: The street board advertisement got me with the tako bombs which we discovered has octopus in a fried batter. After eating so much along the walk through Robson, it was nice to see a venue offer quick bites to have a taste of their menu!! Pay and order first and then pick up, enjoy at a table for 2 since it's a small restaurant and then clean up your table after and place trays in designated area. Simple and easy. The tako bombs were pretty good but it definitely needed some hot sauce so we bought some for about $0.30Cad not bad but usually it's a free condiment for us. It definitely brought out the flavors! The karage chicken was also a good find! If I had room in my tummy I would have grabbed some spam musubi!! Looked good!!

featured_reviews.review_id: Haven't been here for a while but it did not disappoint. The prices have gone up and the portions gone down but it was still as yummy as ever. Would recommend coming for a quick and delicious bite!! The spring rolls are AMAZING. Weirdly enough, we both felt kind of high after eating here, maybe cus of the neon lights?

featured_reviews.review_id:
I was deciding between the Beef Stew or the Beef Curry.

I decided on the Curry because I was craving that thick, rich, creamy aromatic texture that is known with Curry. On the contrary a stew is known to be more watery, right? Well....the Curry was exactly what I would expect a Stew to be. Watery with potatoes....hmmmm? (see pic.) Also, a great deal of the beef cubes had massive amounts of fat....maybe trim those? I doubt many people enjoy chunks of cow fat in their mouths.

The spices were nice and steamed rice tasted....well like rice that's been steamed. The Prawn Skewer was a bit disappointing. It wasn't grilled it was pan fried....big difference, and for the price the prawns were tiny and what it seemed was they tried to make up for it with veggies (see pic.)

Yeah...not really feeling any particular way about this experience, which I guess kinda says it all.

Good, reasonably priced place for your soup fill

The portions are very nice for the price and definitely filling. The staff is nice, the service is quick.

Their veggie soup & veggie salad roll are my choices

The deep fried wontons have a delicious crispy but not oily wrapper and bite sized filling. Very nice option as well

Their rice dishes with spring rolls and meat are the ones very generously portioned

places.name: Slim's BBQ
places.address: Slim's BBQ, 2301 Main St, Vancouver, BC V5T 1M6

featured_reviews.review_id:
This small little gem was the perfect spot for a Vegan/ Carnivore duo to dine together.  I had the cornbread with pulled pork and it was so delicious.  The bread was just the right amount of crisp and crunch around the edges, moist and full of flavor.  The presentation of the food was too pretty to not capture the memory and everything else about the meal and drinks was above average.  Even their grapefruit juice was better than I've had and noteworthy!

Having our server interact with us throughout the entire meal added to the fun.  He even sat with us for a few minutes for conversation as he cheered us on to try our first ever pickle back.

Great experience and a shout out to our camera shy server that we would ask for by name if only I could remember it!

It was a very hot day and we chose to sit inside because their outdoor area is in the back and smelled very strongly of garbage. The inside doesn't have AC so it was prettttyyyyy slick inside too. They have some cool rolling windows which they opened and that helped a bit. The food and service way outweighed the issues with the location. Highly reccomend!

featured_reviews.review_id: Came here on a Friday, the servers and bartenders were very welcoming. We ordered the nachos with chicken as an appy, pork butt with chili, And beef barbacoa with mac and cheese. We also ordered two drinks, the Long Island Iced Tea. And the beer with a shot of jameson. We ended up mixing the Jameson and the beer and it actually wasn't too bad. When our food came out, the sides were switched, but that was no problem cause we were gonna share anyway. Ambience was very authentic.

We had the banana pudding for dessert, prefect thing to share after dinner. The coleslaw was not my favourite. Would definitely recommend this place!

featured_reviews.review_id:
I had high hopes for this place but unfortunately, that's all it was.  The service was excellent, the beer on happy hour extremely well priced.  But the platter was an absolute joke!  44 bucks for what I would not pay 12 bucks for.

The server felt bad and gave us some mac and cheese which didn't make up for the slim portions.

If you're looking for good BBQ in Vancouver, this ain't it.  Slim seems to refer to their chincy portions.  Also they don't smoke their own meat so what kind of BBQ joint is this??

For great BBQ, go to Smoke and Bones in North Van...

This place is a gem and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking to have an amazing experience and even better food!

featured_reviews.review_id: Food was delicious. Wonderful atmosphere with a lovely patio and view of the marina. We ate the Fattouch salad too fast to take a photo. Would highly recommend you try it. It was so fresh. Everything else was also lovely, after sharing the Fatteh hummus with pita and lamb sausages we were happily stuffed. A glass of mint lemonade to wash everything down was the cherry on top of the meal.

featured_reviews.review_id: We had a wonderful dining experience last night. We met both the owner and chef who greeted us at our table and explained every dish we were treated to. We had the tasting menu and each course was flavourful, fresh and authentic Lebanese and Syrian food. The restaurant is in a perfect location and the staff were friendly, attentive and happy. We loved this experience and cannot wait to return. What a treat!
