featured_reviews.review_id: Yasma is a lovely little gem in coal harbour, slightly tucked away, just off of West Georgia right by the marina. The decor is modern, and the view is spectacular, especially because we went right as the sun set. Each dish is comfortably shared amongst 3 people, unless stated differently. The flavors are so fresh and bold. Make sure to order as much bread as you need to complete the dips and sauces. I went with a group of 10 people and spent roughly $60 per person, with 2 bottles of wine and there were left overs that we split amongst ourselves. Large groups are too big for the venue but they were so lovely by accommodating us.  The service really helped make this place stand out. This place is a great date or venue to bring your best friends, best suited for groups of 4 to 6. So don't dress too casual here, it's definitely a place to look a bit more polished when you arrive.

We had a great time there.

featured_reviews.review_id: Quality, unique ingredients, feels like a world of its own with prime location and authentic chic decor inside. All around great service with everything tasting made-from-scratch and home-cooked. Loved it!
featured_reviews.review_text: Quality, unique ingredients, feels like a world of its own with prime location and authentic chic decor inside. All around great service with everything tasting made-from-scratch and home-cooked. Loved it!

featured_reviews.review_id: Amazing Mediterranean gem in the bay front area with fantastic atmosphere and great food and service! Very authentic and delicious food all the way from Syria and Lebanon, freshly made and tasting like nothing you ever tried before. Nice choice of salads, small mezze plates to share and something for everyone's taste. Several nice vegetarian and vegan options as well. Strongly recommend Fattoush Salad, which is just delicious, hummus is next level, fresh and yummy, and don't get me started on freshly baked pita bread. Place gets very busy on weekends, so make sure to make a booking, although if you are alone or couple, if you are lucky - you may get seated at the bar to admire amazing skills of bartender Anka, who is just doing magic there and  is very helpful and offers great advice. If you love Mediterranean food you'll be in heaven.
featured_reviews.review_text: Amazing Mediterranean gem in the bay front area with fantastic atmosphere and great food and service! Very authentic and delicious food all the way from Syria and Lebanon, freshly made and tasting like nothing you ever tried before. Nice choice of salads, small mezze plates to share and something for everyone's taste. Several nice vegetarian and vegan options as well. Strongly recommend Fattoush Salad, which is just delicious, hummus is next level, fresh and yummy, and don't get me started on freshly baked pita bread. Place gets very busy on weekends, so make sure to make a booking, although if you are alone or couple, if you are lucky - you may get seated at the bar to admire amazing skills of bartender Anka, who is just doing magic there and  is very helpful and offers great advice. If you love Mediterranean food you'll be in heaven.

places.name: AnnaLena
places.description: Contemporary Canadian fare & creative cocktails are provided in a stylish, modern setting.
places.address: AnnaLena, 1809 W 1st Ave, Vancouver, BC V6J 5B8

featured_reviews.review_id: Excellent experience overall. Small and interesting wine list and amazing cocktails. Sat at the bar and the bar team was very engaging and make the experience great.  The food was excellent, excellent technique, presentation and flavours all around. Excited to come back soon!
featured_reviews.review_text: Excellent experience overall. Small and interesting wine list and amazing cocktails. Sat at the bar and the bar team was very engaging and make the experience great.  The food was excellent, excellent technique, presentation and flavours all around. Excited to come back soon!

featured_reviews.review_id: A gastronomic delight! We celebrated my mother's birthday at AnnaLena on 23/08/2023 and they exceeded our expectations on all fronts. The tasting menu was phenomenal with each course so meticulously thought out and carefully executed. The service was brilliantly orchestrated like clockwork. We commend our server, Arianna, who took the time to take photos for us to celebrate a milestone birthday. Overall, outstanding! Michelin star deserved!

featured_reviews.review_id: 120% worth it. There is a reason why it's so hard to land a booking here and it shows. From the Michelin worthy service and decor so the presentation of the food. This place was hitting bangers from start to finish. Totally worth coming here for their ever changing menu. Nothing on the menu disappointed. From the tartare to the oysters to the bread and the salmon and the hen.

featured_reviews.review_id: Perhaps the best dining experience I've ever had. I tried another Michelin star restaurant in the area and it wasn't at the same level as AnnaLena. Everything was amazing and they accommodated my preference to avoid shellfish.
featured_reviews.review_text: Perhaps the best dining experience I've ever had. I tried another Michelin star restaurant in the area and it wasn't at the same level as AnnaLena. Everything was amazing and they accommodated my preference to avoid shellfish.

featured_reviews.review_id: One of the top restaurants in Vancouver. Great food, service and atmosphere. The reservation is hard to get and it's a bit pricey but you get what you paid for. We did wine pairing on our visit and discovered a few great wines. The only downside the wine portions were quite small for the price and also additional caviar was not worth the price. Overall highly recommended to get there at least once.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Great food and impeccable service. The wow factor was the oyster's and the mussels soup was amazing. The only dish that felt underwhelming was the salmon dish (We thought the sauce didn't showcase how good the salmon was).
I would definitely recommend the place.

featured_reviews.review_id: Definitely did not disappoint. Service was top notch and food was great. I enjoyed their al a cart better when they offered it before they got the Michelin star, but still awesome. Hopefully they bring back the al a cart menu sometime :)

featured_reviews.review_id:
Excellent service, incredible food, and well informed staff, all while seeming proper yet not snobby, AnnaLena had it all.

The tasting menu was phenomenal, and I was sad the torn bread wasn't on the menu. But the Brick Bread felt eerily similar and by far the best dish. Everything was incredible, and the mini surprise bites in between were all delicious.

The service... was outstanding. An incredibly well informed sommelier and servers that were kind and genuine, everyone was on their A game.

Probably my favorite restaurant in the city

places.name: per se Social Corner
places.description: Innovative Italian cuisine & Spanish tapas, plus gelato & craft cocktails in a contemporary setting.
places.address: per se Social Corner, 891 Homer St, Vancouver, BC V6B 2W2

featured_reviews.review_id: Really loved the aesthetic inside. Our server was very kind and came every now and then to ask if we have everything we need and came to fill our waters. The food was alright. The chicken paella was okay - the chicken was dry and the bottom of the paella wasn't crunchy. I really enjoyed the beef carpaccio though & the steak. Those were perfect!
featured_reviews.review_text: Really loved the aesthetic inside. Our server was very kind and came every now and then to ask if we have everything we need and came to fill our waters. The food was alright. The chicken paella was okay - the chicken was dry and the bottom of the paella wasn't crunchy. I really enjoyed the beef carpaccio though & the steak. Those were perfect!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Nice atmosphere, I like the high ceilings and it's a buzzing place.

Food was decent. I got the eggs benedict with smoked salmon and we didn't have to wait too long.

Our waitress was friendly enough, but a little too fake and seemed stressed running around trying to get to every table.

Washrooms are ok - equally as dark as the main room and not that tidy/modern.

They had some nice outdoor seating but it was raining so we sat inside.

Overall, I'd recommend going there for a casual brunch.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Recently, I had the opportunity to dine at a popular Italian restaurant. To my surprise, the menu featured pizza topped with pineapple, a choice that some might consider a departure from traditional Italian fare.

I ordered a Capricciosa pizza, which came topped with a flavorful cheese. While the meal was satisfactory, it didn't quite live up to the high expectations set by the restaurant's fancy ambiance and price point.

A word of advice for potential visitors: reservations are a must due to the restaurant's bustling crowd, and be prepared to vacate your table promptly after dining as lingering is discouraged.

featured_reviews.review_id:
The food was nice. The ambiance is fancy.
The service was pleasant and professional; and they communicated well with each other. The restaurant has good training and floor team is a well oiled machine. Just that the space is big, our server just passed by from time to time, it prevented us from asking about the menu and ordering more. We had to ask a busser and another server to help us after not successfully getting attention from our server. We were impressed that our server got the message perfectly and followed through with it, we didn't have to repeat ourselves or things got messed up.

We were disappointed on the drinks though. Our beer and cocktail were close to room temperature when brought to us, and they got "warm" very soon after that. Seemed like glasses were not chilled in advance,  and/or our drinks had been waiting on the bar for a while.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Cozy, classic ambiance with high ceilings and with little dark lights. We ordered truffle pizza(?), seafood paella, one appet that thinly-sliced meet comes with arugula.

All were flavoured and delicious but one downside was the bottom part of Paella was totally blacken. Thought the chefs would be pretty skilled but turned out not really.

featured_reviews.review_id: Excellent food all around. The waiter had incredible recommendations. Some special drinks were their rum with sweet chili and their sangria slush. Also their specialty dessert was a nougat "ice cream" cake with an almond sauce reduction (similar to a caramel). Their main dishes (The Burger, Lobster Ravioli and Seafood Paella) were all spectacular.
featured_reviews.review_text: Excellent food all around. The waiter had incredible recommendations. Some special drinks were their rum with sweet chili and their sangria slush. Also their specialty dessert was a nougat "ice cream" cake with an almond sauce reduction (similar to a caramel). Their main dishes (The Burger, Lobster Ravioli and Seafood Paella) were all spectacular.

featured_reviews.review_id:
"This is one of the best pizzas I've ever had" was a sentence we said probably 3 times as we were eating there. We ordered the Tartufina pizza and it was DELICIOUS! It is such an interesting flavor between the honey roasted walnuts and the Gorgonzola cheese. The sweetness of the honey wasn't overpowering it just gave it a unique flavor at the end of the bite. I would 100% go back just for this pizza.

The ambiance is so cozy and elegant yet funky inside. If it wasn't too hot, the patio would be a great option too, full of plants and it seemed like a spacious comfortable space.

Paella is good portion! We were sitting outside on the patio. I would definitely go back for sure! 2 people including cocktails, after tips is around $200.

places.name: Giardino Restaurant
places.description: Italian cuisine in a classy, Tuscan-style dining room with vaulted ceilings, a courtyard & a bar.
places.address: Giardino Restaurant, 1328 Hornby St, Vancouver, BC V6Z 1W5

featured_reviews.review_id: We got an Airbnb down the street and found this to be the nearest restaurant,looked at the menu and even though we didn't have a reservation it was absolutely my lucky day that they were sweet to accommodate us on a 2-top table. Jose's service was great, even though it was a super busy night, but like in a good Italian restaurant I loved how we were not rushed and enjoyed our time. We hit yo try the crab tower, which I wouldn't have expected but flavor was incredible! One of the best Carpaccio's I've ever had, being one of my favorite Italian dishes and have had in many places and countries! flavor was absolutely on point, antipasto was excellent in every bite, followed by a fantastic and light Gnocchi with white sauce. I wish we had space to try the creme brulee, but we did take a Tiramisu to go and didn't disappoint! Atmosphere was lovely, restaurant was beautiful! It truly made our night in Vancouver, wish we could come back tomorrow but it was fully booked as well. Thank you so much!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Great food and atmosphere, the service was slow and at best completely indifferent. The waiter took a very long time to come to our table to take orders for drinks/appetizers/food and it seemed that he didn't really even pay any attention to the entire section but spent most of the night to be doing what looked like sucking up to one table on the other side of restaurant. The support staff were great but it felt like since we weren't 70 years old or buying the $500+ wine the waiter gave us basically no service. There are other places nearby to spend $100 per person for much better service.

The food was great, the lasagna especially

featured_reviews.review_id:
Wonderful restaurant.  Follows historic restaurant mantra and experience.  Great setting, ambiance, the food presentation, waiters/waitress knowledge of the menu, and the owner walking around chatting with patrons.  Very cool.
Light Italian music playing in the background, easy to have conversations and not feel like you are yelling.  Yet with a full restaurant, did not feel loud.
Food was very tasteful and savory.  Each overseen by chefs and owner.  Fresh catches of the day were great.  You can tell the food was done by those knowledgeable of what they are making.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Incredible evening. One of my besties is so smart she books amazing restaurants months in advance during prime weekend nites and times ...I was lucky to be invited to one. I just love this restaurant.  It's kind of like a whose who in Vancouver ...older crowd but you know it's a sophisticated but fun crowd. Our server Nicole was excellent . I told her how her knowledge of the menu was so appreciated and she helped us create the best dinner experience for our table . We started with fresh crisp breads and homemade breads made in house ( rye, sourdough and foccacia) all were delicious but the foccacia was pillows soft.

We had the crab avocado tower which was on special , delish. Beet and burrata salad....very generous with the mouth watering burrata. The Caesar salad was super good too ...I would get then to chop up the romaine for u . Clam vongole incredible (so many clamssss) and then this other fancy pasta with like huge rigatoni style pasta with spicy sausage....I'm drooling as I write this . Finally new year steak ...perfection . Desserts kill me now ....sorbet raspberry and pear were light and refreshing.  The warm chocolate cake was very good as well....overall was an amazing evening.  The atmosphere was just perfect, server was amazing, company was the best and the food was .  Thank you again !!

featured_reviews.review_id: Amazing experience AGAIN!  We've been coming here for 18 years. Best bison carpaccio I've ever had. Service was friendly and professional. Pasta was hot & delicious. Wine choices are wide. Umberto himself works the room, visiting tables and shaking hands. He's a legend. (Oh and there's valet parking!)

featured_reviews.review_id: One of my fave restaurants inside. The outdoor part is just amazing. My party didn't want to sit outside, which is only kind of outside but we sat right by it and by the kitchen. It's such an amazing spot. Entertaining spot for kids too who like to watch all the action. The food was great too lol. Sablefish just melted in my mouth.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Absolutely love  this place. We've been going here for years since pre Covid and after and it's still one of the best restaurants in Vancouver. Do yourself a favour and visit here at least once in your life. My gf and I shared the 38oz Porterhouse Fiorentina steak  and it was hands down the best steak we've ever had!! I also ordered their Calamari and then Cheesecake for dessert  yum 
From the wonderful service to the amazing chefs, dishes and environment this place is legendary. And oh, once it's nicer out book yourself a table in the outdoor villa area and it's just gorgeous outside. Cheers  to 2023 all!!

places.name: Grace of India Restaurant
places.description: Warm, low-key eatery offering Indian plates such as malai kofta, chicken tikka masala & curries.
places.address: Grace of India Restaurant, 1284 Kingsway, Vancouver, BC V5V 3E1

featured_reviews.review_id: Recently dined at Grace of India in Vancouver. The samosas were definitely a highlight, flavorful and well-prepared. The naan, while good, was a bit on the oily side for my preference. As for the curry fish, it left a bit to be desired; the flavor was rather bland and the base was too watery. Overall, the experience was decent, but there's room for improvement in some dishes.

featured_reviews.review_id:
This place is a neighborhood gem with specials Monday to thursday and take out specials available  all the time. The food is fresh and made from scratch and the service is friendly. I am here often because their specials are sometimes cheaper and quicker than making food at home and they have air conditioning for when its just too hot to cook.

Our favorites are the channa masala, chicken masala and vindaloo.

Dosa factory and other restaurants provide a much better quantity than these guys. Absolutely disappointed and a waste of money.

This is the new place for Indian food that we REALLY !! enjoyed last week. They have specials everyday of the weekdays as well. Plus they deliver.
The service was very polite and pleasant. Answered all our questions .
Rice is a side dish which is the way I like it when it comes entrees. This allows for people like diabetes to order off the menu including vegetarian dishes with our having to worry about starch and sugar... Yay.
We have the tandoori chicken  and wonderful dip for the chicken. I think it was cilantro.

featured_reviews.review_id: Their menu is interesting and they have a few items that are out there. But I ordered the Toranj special fries, the Bandari sausage and Royal burger. featured_reviews.review_id:
I went to Toranjfood restaurant today, resturant was small but charming. Since I had experienced Toranj Tehran before, I ordered their special Toranj burger. The burger was very delicious and served with a side of Lettuce salad. The taste of the food was delightful to the point that it didn't need any sauce or extra additions. The Volume of cheese used in the burger was appropriate and the price of burger was a bit expensive. There were also some large french fries on the side, which were good.

It was served in a stainless steel dish, which I didn't like very much, but it's definitely better than a plastic container in my opinion. Overall, the food was good, and the restaurant's location on Rabson Street was convenient and accessible. The staff and the restaurant's master chef were excellent.

If you're looking for a unique twist on traditional sandwiches and burgers, I highly recommend giving this restaurant a try.

places.name: Como Taperia
places.description: Spanish tapas restaurant serving small plates washed down with regional wine, gin & sherry.
places.address: Como Taperia, 201 E 7th Ave, Vancouver, BC V5T 0B4

featured_reviews.review_id:
I've been here twice, nothing special about this place.
Cost: between 2 people $200w/tip + tax.
Food: not flavourful. Had different Octopus dishes, both times was disappointing. It didn't have a tender crunch, and was soft rubbery.
The one with aioli, not impressed. It was drenched, I would ask for it on the side.
I was told the canned items tasted delicious. In my opinion, I disagree. Had the razor clam and octopus......everything had the over cooked texture.
The menu was not lacking. Overall, I couldn't pinpoint which region of Spain it belonged to, left no reminisce of any of my Spain trips.
Service: they take the order and leave kind of service. You ask them about the dishes, and they read me what was exactly written on the menu. I can read, thank you. Had to push for what it tasted like, and the texture.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Pretty clever how this  owner runs this business. Pre-paid for the paella - $40/per person. Showed up and ended up waiting for 1 hour and 30 min for the paella to arrive. In that hour and 30min of wait time, unless you're just gonna sit there, you're gonna end up ordering something light to drink and eat. That's how they get ya to spend more. The portion is like a kids' meal. What a scam!! All that waiting, we get a size of a cereal bowl portion? Restaurant should be called Como get scammed

Response: so you don't take taxes and tips into consideration? That's why I said 40. Yea we did see the process but yes it still took more than an hour for the plate to arrive on my table. Check your camera (I'll even bet you money for it). Funny how you don't respond about the portion size, just like everyone else who left the reviews. Maybe I'll come to the competition and help you remove some dirt out of your eyes, scammer.

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Someone didn't read the website...we collaborate with another small business. Thanks for the support. The other 180 people that came had a great time, and the small business we collab with does an amazing job. To be clear, it's $28, and the actual people who cook the Paella do it traditionally, so it takes an hour. If you are still hungry after this...don't know what to tell you... They also take pictures with everyone and show how it's done. We offer food and drinks while guests are waiting, how dare we. Good things come to those who wait, not for those who prob just want to take a picture and leave. PS, the crew from Paella Guys are competing in the world championships this year

places.name: To Dine for Eatery
places.address: To Dine for Eatery, 333 Terminal Ave #101, Vancouver, BC V6A 4C1

featured_reviews.review_id:
Been arriving in Vancouver by train and was looking to get something to eat nearby, trying to push my luggage on the way. Now the reviews of this small eatery point are being favorable, favorable of the PB and Bacon Burger too, so I tried. Like they all say, it's an absolute mess, with no ending. Too much juicy meat, too much of the crispiest bacons I ever had, too much of the peanut butter, not even thinking to try to stay between the patties. Overall it wasn't the best burger I ever had, but a very good one. The poutine on the other hand really kicked in. I've never tried it that way, the chaos of flavor was a special treatment for my tounge, in a great way.

The girls working here are very kind and also handling situations with a "I believe it's real" smile. Nothing to complain here.

If I ever come back to Vancouver again, this will be on my bucket list for sure. And next time I'm gonna ask for some wet tissues first, before I have to see my fingers being soaked up in PB again.

Honestly, my new favorite diner and burger joint. My family and our friends absolutely love it. The diner is open for dine-in now. Their specialty burgers are the highlight. However, their soups, fries and drinks are also really nice.

The staff were very friendly and attentive. Plexiglass is installed and covid procedures well-followed. I felt welcomed and safe and enjoyed an awesome lunch. It's local and family-owned. The area was very clean.

Also tried their spaghetti and curry on another occassion -- both are also quite nice when you are craving for something different. I can't wait to go back to try the entire menu.

featured_reviews.review_id: A good spot featuring healthy and tasty bowls. At first the portion sizing seemed small but I enjoyed a regular sized porketta bowl with a coffee and it was filling for the entire day. Prices were also reasonable and the food was prepared fresh by the friendly owners.
featured_reviews.review_text: A good spot featuring healthy and tasty bowls. At first the portion sizing seemed small but I enjoyed a regular sized porketta bowl with a coffee and it was filling for the entire day. Prices were also reasonable and the food was prepared fresh by the friendly owners.

featured_reviews.review_id: Good food, but the portion size leaves something to be desired. In comparison to other health conscious 'build your own' bowls, Oja's Blend and Basil Box are better options for the price (especially with the protein). However, Gobble does have some unique options in their porchetta and smoked vegan chili. Their roasted root vegetables needed more seasoning as I found it on the bland side, but the pilaf was nice. My friend did enjoy their Chicken Bowl (with the honey glazed chicken and a mild spicy aioli). Would return if I'm in the area, but wouldn't make a special trip out like I did for my first visit.

featured_reviews.review_id: Their lamb souvlaki was great!!! So delicious! Good service and sever is so friendly. They have a lot of types of beer on the tap and cans. You can find your favorite flavor. And they have a nice patio, I love it! I'd like to go there again for sure.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I had the opportunity to attend the Taylor Swift event at Zawa on August 27, during the 12-2pm timeframe. Having paid $60 in tickets per person, I was genuinely looking forward to an enjoyable experience. Unfortunately, my expectations were not met. The event suffered from evident understaffing, leading to a noticeable decline in service quality and notable delays in food service. Despite the event being scheduled to conclude at 2pm, my group and I were still waiting for our food at 1:50pm. Both the event and restaurant staff exhibited an unhelpful and dismissive demeanor when we voiced our concerns.

Additionally, I observed a lack of attention to cleanliness at the venue, which further compounded the disappointment. A regrettable incident involved the restaurant staff placing all utensils in the middle of the table for communal use, raising significant sanitation issues.

Of particular concern was the inconsistency in food service, where some attendees had already finished their meals while others were left without food even as the event neared its scheduled end at 2pm. This uneven distribution greatly overshadowed the overall experience.

featured_reviews.review_id: Went for the Broadway on Tour show. Performance was enjoyable. Food experience was atrocious. Took over 30 minutes to be served and my burger came out ice cold. I sent it back and they put my burger with 2 bites out of it back on the grill and brought it out again on the same plate with the same cold fries. Unhygienic and disgusting. No one ever offered us additional water or anything in addition to what came with the ticket. A complete waste of money, a bad experience and an embarrassment for the people who were there to put on a good performance. I'll never go back.
featured_reviews.review_text: Went for the Broadway on Tour show. Performance was enjoyable. Food experience was atrocious. Took over 30 minutes to be served and my burger came out ice cold. I sent it back and they put my burger with 2 bites out of it back on the grill and brought it out again on the same plate with the same cold fries. Unhygienic and disgusting. No one ever offered us additional water or anything in addition to what came with the ticket. A complete waste of money, a bad experience and an embarrassment for the people who were there to put on a good performance. I'll never go back.

featured_reviews.review_id:
This is now the second experience I have at this location

I did the abba experience it also took me 30 minutes to get my food but when the show is completely sold out and it look like 100 plus people I can see why and I liked the food, Entertainment and staff
The singers did do a great job at making sure everyone was included in the experience

Today I did the broadway experience and once again it was a packed house. Again it took some time to get my meal but I have been to many restaurants and when busy this is the case so I was prepared. My burger was yummy and crispy fries

The 3 singers did such amazing job big energy and once again the experience was amazing
Told the show manager Kim how impressed I was and looking forward to more of these shows

featured_reviews.review_id:
I forgot I told myself not to come back. I'm writing it down now so I can remember for next time.

I came for brunch with my sister at 11am today (Aug 20, 2023). There were no other customers on arrival. We were told we could sit anywhere, but all the seats had decorations from a previous party (picnic tablecloths and an open pack of crayons). The waitress came over with the menus and helped pick off leftover crumbs off the table. She left the tablecloth and crayons (like they were supposed to be there).

The soup of the day was strangely already sold out. My sister ordered steak and eggs, and I ordered the lumberjack breakfast. It took about 30 minutes to be done. There was new-pan residue on my sister's over-easy eggs and her steak was cooked poorly (refrigerated steak put on a max heat grill for 1 minute each side; causes grill marks, but the inside is completely raw). We asked to get it fixed. Food was mediocre after fixing.

No compensation, but we didn't bother asking. We weren't planning coming back again anyways.

Also note, there's a story of all the staff leaving in 2022.

places.name: Downlow Chicken Shack
places.description: Simple counter-serve hub for fried chicken at escalating spice levels, creative sandwiches & sides.
places.address: Downlow Chicken Shack, 905 Commercial Dr, Vancouver, BC V5L 2H2

featured_reviews.review_id:
I didn't use to be a huge fan of chicken and especially fried, but I've heard very good things about Downlow Chicken Shack so I decided to give it a shot. It's one of the BEST (if not the best) spot in town for chicken. Generous portions, great combination of flavors and very very friendly stuff. I freaking loved it!

In terms of the actual restaurant, it's not anything extraordinary but more of like a grab and go place, with a few stands if you wanna dine in. Nothing wrong with it tho, will definitely visit again soon!

featured_reviews.review_id: Big delicious chicken sandwich! Wow, what a surprise after hearing about this place for years, finally went to try their fried chicken sandwich, fries and wings. Didn't disappoint as there was a lot of tasty food. The huge chunk of fried chicken in my sandwich could barely fit in my mouth. A good portion of truffle fries could be easily shared between a few people. Overall, this was one of the biggest and tastiest chicken sandos around!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Always see line ups! This place is the kind of place when it's late and you want some comfort food with your buddies! Chicken burgers, Mac and cheese, mmm you name it!

There's combos you can get a side and a burger for around $21! There's different levels of spiciness too . The service is just so fun here, it was my first time and they always bring smiles and cheers!

Limited dine in spots inside (like around 8 people) they have picnic tables with a tent so make sure to bring a jacket if you want to sit outside!

There are street parking available.

I do have to say the fries are a bit dry when we went.

IG: Mishinnoms for more details

Serves Nashville burgers and fries for your fried food cravings. Went there with my friends and had a great time and food. Located in Commercial Drive, this is a happening place in town. They have different levels of spice and the waitresses are cooperative and courteous.
Recommended: OG Chicken Sandwich and Fries.
featured_reviews.review_text:
Serves Nashville burgers and fries for your fried food cravings. Went there with my friends and had a great time and food. Located in Commercial Drive, this is a happening place in town. They have different levels of spice and the waitresses are cooperative and courteous.

featured_reviews.review_id: This fried chicken shack ruined other fried chicken for me forever!!!!! Yes it's hard to find parking, minimal seating, sometimes lengthy waits, expensive (compared to what though? It's Vancouver) but it's so worth it. The fried chicken is always juicy and perfecy seasoned, the skin is so crispy. The pickles are seasoned too and it's so good. If you just get chicken to go, they'll put it on bread to absorb the oil which is genius. The crinkle cut fries are delicious and I like to alternate between ketchup and DL sauce. Because of the price, this is more of a big scheduled treat than a convenient stop for me but I look forward to it!

featured_reviews.review_id:
This is a 'best-seller Chicken place'. It's located along Commercial Drive corner of Venables Street.

We got the OG Sando Combo (with in-house coleslaw & sauce), crispy chicken skin, french fries (with special sauce) side dishes, and handmade Lemonade. The chicken is juicy, tender, and very flavourful - the best chicken sandwich I have ever tasted. The fries have a special spice craveable to the palate.  Their in-house DL sauce is super yummy. Both the sandwich and fries are huge portions.

Staffs are friendly, service is excellent. Limited indoor/outdoor seating space. Be ready for a long queue.   Street parking can be a challenge. Will definitely be back. Try Downlow Chicken Shack, you can't go wrong.

Get ready to get your hands wet and messy cos these chicken sando will surely do. Love that they give you choices of white or dark meat as well as the spicy level. If you'd like a little kick to your sandwiches I'd recommend getting either mid or hot. The chicken is definitely juicy and nicely cooked.

I found their fries just okay; not that great nor the worst.

With their updated menu, it's sad to see their Lemon Pepper gone.

The best sushi we have found in Vancouver! Big rolls, a lot of fish!
Ebi roll is amazing! Tons of prawns. Delicious!
featured_reviews.review_text:
The best sushi we have found in Vancouver! Big rolls, a lot of fish!
Ebi roll is amazing! Tons of prawns. Delicious!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Disappointing experience. We went in right when they opened at 10.30 am because it was the sushi place in area that opened earliest. We ordered 4 sushi rolls. And we were really disappointed.

The sushi rolls we got served were made from stale rice. It felt like it was leftover rice from previous day.

The prawn in Ebi sushi roll was very cold. Clearly it was not freshly cooked.

Another disappointing fact was that they do not have any tempura sushi options.

Overall, this place should be avoided if you are in search of good tasty food.

Only reason for not giving 1 star is the service. The lady working there seemed nice. Hence 2 stars.

places.name: Arike Restaurant
places.address: Arike Restaurant, 1725 Davie St, Vancouver, BC V6G 1W5

featured_reviews.review_id:
The five course tasting menu explores a global array of spices and influences paired with beautifully sourced ingredients. Located in the West End, down a set of stairs off Davie St, Arike is an approachable and global dining experience.

Every course had a remarkable variance in spice and heat, even the bread which contained bebere spice. My favourite courses were the Moroccan Ratatouille and the Sea Bream Ceviche. The ceviche was notably spicy, in a delightful way, and presented with a peanut hummus. I also had the wine pairing which was a stellar accompaniment.

My sister found the melon course with the serrano sofrito and yogurt foam as her favourite.

The meal was a wonderful progression from start to finish and we were delighted by it all.

featured_reviews.review_id: Spectacular. If I could give Arike more stars I would. For both my wife and I, this was one of the best meals we've ever had. We have both visited and lived in various East African countries and were curious to taste the mix of these flavours with local ingredients. Arike delivered, and then some. We also really enjoyed the unique cocktail menu. Some of these cocktails were unlike any we'd ever had. We'll be back, and with friends next time.

featured_reviews.review_id: Arike's tasting menu was a burst of flavor We had the wine pairing and our tastebuds were pleased even though our bellies would argue this due to the portions. Definitely recommend this experience.
featured_reviews.review_text: Arike's tasting menu was a burst of flavor We had the wine pairing and our tastebuds were pleased even though our bellies would argue this due to the portions. Definitely recommend this experience.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Came here during the grand reopening for the tasting menu. It was an incredible & unique experience with perfectly selected natural wine pairings.

The bartender had us sample a few different complimentary cocktails as they sorted out their menu. Each cocktail was well-balanced, spirit forward, and layered with complex and intriguing flavours/fragrances.

You could tell how passionate both the server, Joel, and the bartender, Awesome, are about food and drink which only accentuated an already delightful evening.
featured_reviews.review_text:
Came here during the grand reopening for the tasting menu. It was an incredible & unique experience with perfectly selected natural wine pairings.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Would give 6 stars. The food here is so unique, stunning combinations of flavors.

We had a chicken sausage + red pepper ( I think) gnocchi + mint chutney + baked manchego crisp. Sound good enough yet? Each item on its own was good, like fine, but together it was a sensational eating experience.

As if that wasn't enough, the wine pairings were phenomenal (the two of us split one), and the ambience and decor topped it off. Hats off to Sam the chef, Jesse (who I'm told did the wine pairings), and Jen the wonderful, fun hostess.

Check out Arike when you're in town! And be sure to ask what the logo means :)

featured_reviews.review_id:
Walked by and decided to do a quick turn at a random hole in the wall place.

We turned right walking down Davie street down the stairs when we discovered the absolute best bar experience we have ever had in the city. The bartender shared his experience of how his experience through Africa inspired his drinks... we were beyond impressed, he took us on a journey we never thought we would experience in the city. Sweet, sour, elegant, sophisticated, smooth... the city used to be boring and cloudy, but I found my place to enjoy the sun while all of you suckers hide under your umbrellas. Grab at the seat near the bar and say hi to me, I will be there.

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks alot clevy , being our valuable customer & giving this review to improve our business..

featured_reviews.review_id: One of my new fav spots! Customer service was amazing - friendly and fast. The food was some of the best south indian I have had here. The sambhar for sure is definitely the best you'll get, and I have tried dosa at quite a few different places. There's isn't watered down like many other places. The onion rava masala dosa was super crispy, generous portious and flavourful. The filling lacked salt, however once you eat it with the chutneys and sambhar, it works out. Chicken 65 and medhu vada was crispy, flavourful and delicious. Overall can't complain!

Delicious traditional & vegan Mexican food! A great little gem near Granville Island. Love their tamales, pozoles and tostadas! Everything is fresh and so tasty, highly recommend giving this place a try.

Check out their rotating menu online and call ahead to order. They are also available on Uber but you can save a bit more if you call or line up to order for take out.

I have to say, I've enjoyed every single bite of the meals from Antojos y Sabores. They have a different Traditional Mexican Meal of the Day running from Tue to Fri and on weekends they sell Pozole and Tamales! Added bonus, they sell Vegan/vegetarian options for all dishes.

They are located in a commissary kitchen so the food is available for Pick-up, take out, and delivery. No dining in option.

Their staff great you with a warm welcome and smile

featured_reviews.review_id: I've tried this place so many times since 2008 but last week was our first in 4 or 5 years. No matter the time of day or which day of year, my order is roast lamb. My kids have tried pizza and pasta before and approved the quality. I was a bit disappointed, one for tiger prawns appetizer because they were small shrimps and another for Roast lamb. Rice under the lamb way completely cold (I didn't sent it back since already had started eating the lamb before trying the rice but main reason is just don't like to send my food back). The portion seemed a bit smaller than before but it was enough for me. The price is low compare to most other restaurants but that might be the reason of a bit drop on quality. Regardless we enjoyed our experience. The lady who served us was friendly.

featured_reviews.review_id:
First time trying out Olympia Restaurant on Denman, an old school Greek spot. There's a second location out in Kitsilano.

There's a lunch menu (12:00pm-2:30pm) with $14.00-20.00 entrees.

- Pita
- Roast lamb ($20.00) - good amount of lamb, didn't see much fat. Not much taste to the salad. Potato had a nice bite.
- Moussaka ($18.00) - basically, a Greek shepherd's pie.
- Beef souvlaki ($18.00) - one skewer of beef. Not bad but fairly standard.
- Greek pizza ($22.00 medium) - slightly thicker crust, not greasy. Wished onions were cooked down more.

No frills, classic Greek eats. 3.5 stars.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Ordered the roast lamb and calamari dinner, and both were excellent. The lamb was super tender and well seasoned, and the calamari was lightly battered and fried nicely for a grrat crisp. The Greek potato was delicious, I wish they served two on the plate. The rice pilaf wasn't the best I've had - could've used more flavour and unfortunately it was cold. However, the lamb and potato were warm so it was fine to eat with the rice. They also served free pita bread which came out hot and fresh and great with the Tzatziki.

Great patio setting, I like that they have the plastic barriers up to separate the tables - it makes it more intimate and quiet. The place was packed on a Saturday night and they only had three servers. Waited about 15 min for a table at 8pm and many people were stopping in for pizza take out. Table service was a bit slow but our service did a great job and was friendly.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I ordered the Taiwanese Beef Noodle soup to go on a miserable rainy day and it really hit the spot.  It was so flavourful and the meat was really tender.  I like that they separated the noodles and soup so it wouldn't get mushy.

It was easy to order online and the tracker is handy to know when it will be ready.

The wait was quick even during the lunch rush and service was friendly.

I will definitely be back to try more items on the menu!

featured_reviews.review_id:
The Honey Lemon Tea is made from Nestea Lemon Tea Powder as opposed to using lemon juice. It was surprisingly refreshing trying a drink that's more catered towards the western palate every once and awhile.

I ordered the Chicken Nuggets with Rice and was surprised at how authentic the seasoning for the chicken was. It's heavily seasoned (which I prefer) and was fresh from the fryer--very juicy. However, for the amount I paid, I expected a somewhat larger portion but given the location, it makes sense. If you're looking for more bang for your buck, I would recommend giving 'Wow Full Noodle House' a try! However, this restaurant's service was swift and is perfect for an officer worker's lunch break.

featured_reviews.review_id: We came in on a late Friday afternoon, just a short block from Holt Renfrew.  Started off with a refreshing and flavorful Green Apple green tea.  Followed by Chicken Nuggets and Wonton with Chilli.  Finally completing our experience with QQ Mochi.  The nuggets were crispy but not oily and yet so tender and juicy inside.  Chilli oil were a perfect balance of spice with their homemade wonton, and fillings were soft yet bouncy.  What to say about the Mochi other than "QQ", just perfect!  Great atmosphere, wonderful staff. Thank you, Chef Eric and your amazing team!

featured_reviews.review_id:
We came at lunch time on a Monday and it wasnt too busy at 12. Once it got to around 12:30, all the tables were full.
We ordered the chicken nuggets with noodles and braised pork rice. The braised pork rice was heavy on the rice. The pork itself was very fatty which I liked but the flavour was somewhat one dimensional. They are very generous with the portions here.
The chicken nuggets with noodles in soup was also generous in price. Lots of noodles. The soup was plain but enjoyable as it off balanced the fried chicken. The fried chicken was okay. Not crispy enough and also not juicy enough.
The food was mediocre overall. Not too pricey but not cheap either.
Service wise - food came out a bit slow as it was busy but servers are nice and don't rush you even though it's busy.
I saw the tables around me and they were all eating rice and noodles dishes. Their portion sizes are definitely on the bigger size so keep that in mind when ordering. It's a nice addition to the downtown lunch scene when you are craving Asian food.

And he said that it is only $15.00. My wife  insisted she gave him the correct amount. But the cashier guy denied it. She backed out and said to return my money. He still insisted and returned only $15.00.  So my wife lost some of her money. Very, very terrible customer service.  Not recommeded to eat in this outlet.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Redy,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience you and your wife faced during your recent visit. We take customer feedback seriously and would like to address this matter.

First and foremost, we're deeply sorry for any misunderstanding regarding the counting of the payment.  This certainly does not reflect our usual standard of service. To ensure it doesn't happen again in the future, I have investigated and found out some details. As you noted, there was quite a bit of coin so there might have been a miscount somewhere. In hindsight, the staff agreed that he could have done differently to avoid upsetting you.  He admitted that he was also under pressure that the store was busy with other guests waiting to be served.

We highly value our customers, and it's disappointing to hear that you had a negative experience. We would like to make amends for this. Kindly reach out to our management team with your phone number at feedback@thaiaway.com so we can resolve this matter to your satisfaction.

Once again, we apologize for the inconvenience, and we hope you'll give us another chance to provide you with the excellent dining experience we strive to offer.

Sincerely,
Siripon
Thai away home restaurant

Came to this cafe while waiting for my motorcycle tires to be installed at Modern.

Ordered the bacon tomato benny and it was pretty good. I asked for water and the cup it came in had some weird dirty thing inside the cup so I had to exchange for another one. That was a bit off putting considering the water came before the meal.

Everything in the store was quite outdated. Chairs were ripped with holes. You can't expect too much.

Overall, the food was decent and if there's nothing open at 9:30am, I may come back.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Friendly service, good variety of food. Ordered a black pepper beef noodle and the cod and tofu in pot.
The noodle was well done, flavorful and lots of meat and veggies. There were both crispy and soft noodles. The cod was in a thick batter that was spongy and didn't have much fish taste. I didn't like this one very much.
A good place to have decent Chinese food in this area. We asked for less salt and oil in both dishes and they paid attention to our requests.
Cash only.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Wanted cheap eggs benedict and found this place.
$10.95 for two bennys with bacon and tomato, plus hasbrowns is not bad.

Definitely tastes better than the really cheaper places like Nice Cafe (which has closed down now). They dont cheap out on the bacon and give you full pieces and layers.

Also had the sunriser breakfast. Pancakes probably worse than making my own. The portions were really good.

There is one friendly waitress and one lazy waitress. They speak cantonese so I know everything they said. I was trying to wave to the lazy one to ask to pay and instead, the chef saw me and told her a customer needs attention. She responded "what customer? I don't see anyone who needs me." When she finally saw me, she told the other waitress "go collect the money." She started speaking loudly about anything she wanted thinking that none of the customers understood - including all the different types of ethnic food she hates, and her bladder functions. A star is taken off for this waitress.

I haven't tried the chinese food but this is the old western style non-authentic chinese food that I don't really like so I wouldn't be trying it anyways. Come for the breakfast!

places.name: Yook Korean Grilled BBQ & Bistro (yug korian babekyu)
places.description: Bistro serving traditional Korean BBQ & comfort food in an intimate, contemporary space.

owner.name: Yook Korean Grilled BBQ & Bistro (yug korian babekyu) (Owner)

places.address: Yook Korean Grilled BBQ & Bistro (yug korian babekyu), 2408 Nanaimo St, Vancouver, BC V5N 5E4

featured_reviews.review_id:
So good. We went there for the first time tonight for dinner. My husband and I were already talking about what to order on our next visit as soon as we got into our car after the meal.

There were 5 of us tonight and we had:

1. Deep fried meat dumplings - meaty fillings in crispy wrappings.

2. Seafood and green onion pancakes - it was the best Korean seafood pancake we've had in Vancouver. The dough was light but it was filled with seafood goodness. The outside was perfectly fried with crunchy and crispy edges.

3. Beef short ribs in sweet soy sauce - The flavour of the dish rendered it as my mom's favourite. The meat was tender and charred to perfection.

4. Plain pork belly - This was my favourite. All the pieces were also charred nicely and they were heavenly with the accompanying dipping condiment (salt and spices in oil).

Service was excellent. The staff were friendly and attentive.

I love this place.

featured_reviews.review_id: Yummy spot for Korean food! Plenty of street parking and good service. Got a few dishes to try for dinner. Kalbi was cooked well and very flavorful. Seafood pancake came with a nice crunch. Seafood tofu soup came out hot and spicy. Overall great meal with the side dishes.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Dinner with the family at Yook Korean Grilled BBQ & Bistro. Featured here:

Bibimbap
Haemul Soondubu
Haemul Pajeon (Seafood and Green Onion Pancake)
Sweet Rice Drink

Bibimbap is usually served sizzling hot in a stone bowl. The rice at the bottom gets crunchy, and the whole dish in general tends to be a very warm, hearty and comforting meal. This Bibimbap however, was served to me in a metal bowl. Not only did it come in a metal bowl, but the rice was served separately from the veggies and fried egg, in a smaller separate bowl. This was really quite a disappointment as I'd been looking forward to have the sizzling hot bowl of rice that I'd come to expect from Korean restaurants.

The Haemul Soondubu on the other hand arrived at the table with bubbling hot soup in it. This was my second choice and I really wish that I had ordered this instead.

The Haemul Pajeon was nicely done, and the sweet rice drink which I hadn't had for a number of years, was as tasty as I remembered it being.

There were other meat dishes on the table but people started eating before I could take any photos! The meat dishes were already prepared though. This wasn't the kind of Korean BBQ where you get to cook the food yourself on a grill. That was a bit of a disappointment as we'd brought an out of town visitor here, and had hoped to give him the experience of Korean BBQ cooking at this dinner. From the name of the restaurant, we thought there would be grills on our table, but...that wasn't the case.

Service: Good
Parking: Free parking on the side street
Location: 2408 Nanaimo St., Vancouver, BC

featured_reviews.review_id: I visited Yook a few weeks ago and WOW, so so so so delicious. Each dish had so much flavor, the spicy pork belly was very tender and a great portion for the price. I have had seafood pancake at other restaurants and it has been uncooked or too much dough. This was the perfect green onion seafood pancake, the dough was soooo crunchy and the fillings so fresh, HUGE portion and the hot plate it comes on keeps it hot for the entire meal. I ate the leftovers cold the next day and it was great that way as well .Our server was kind and helpful , I will for sure be back 5/5!

Highly recommend the Sweet Soy Deung Galbi Jjim. Excellent flavour and the meat just fell off the bone. The Ddukbokki was a bit disappointing this time. It was too soft and mushy, not the chewy texture I was hoping for. Overall, this is a great restaurant in an area with not many Korean food options. I would recommend it!

featured_reviews.review_id:
A great gathering place . We ordered their Zenbu (everything) katsu for $39.50 and added $8 for additional rice, cabbage and soup. It was more than enough for the two of us!
If you have big appetite, their rice, cabbage and soup are refillable and all you can eat, so you have no excuse not to get stuffed.

featured_reviews.review_id: Came here for brunch and the wait to get a table for 4 was honestly not too bad (~15 mins). If everyone at the table gets a dish worth $9 or more then you get unlimited rice, miso soup, and salad. Which is great because their salad is so good as is their dressing and really gives your palate a break/reset from the deep fried foods that is your main meal. We got a side of curry because katsu and curry is just a perfect combination and if you've never poured curry over your katsu before, definitely recommend it!

featured_reviews.review_id:
One of the best restaurants I've ever been to in my entire life. The food was phenomenal, presented beautifully, and the service was efficient and attentive. Each person gets 1 free miso and 1 free rice refill (meaning each person gets 2 misos and 2 rice bowls in total, at least when we were there). The food was so fresh, tasted delicious, and I don't think we had to wait too like despite it being quite busy. We ordered 1 rosu katsu ($25), 1 rosu curry ($28), and 2 cheese katsus ($26.50 for one order). Although this place is quite pricey, it's worth it for the experience and the quality and amount of food. The cheese katsu is quite rich, the rosu curry is quite flavourful, and the breading of all of the katsus were amazing!

We highly recommend coming here, but DON'T FORGET TO MAKE A RESERVATION/BE PUT ON THE WAITING LIST ONLINE, because it's super busy once it opens, and you'll have to wait 30+ minutes if you don't have one.

featured_reviews.review_id: Great Chinese restaurant with very good BBQ items. We went here and got one of their set dinners that came with soup, lobster fried rice and 3 side dishes. We also got a set that came with Peking duck. The portions here were enormous and you will likely have leftovers if you don't go with many people. Overall I would come here again for their set dinners. Service was pretty good too considering how busy the storefront was.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Cantonese BBQ Seafood opened up in the former Peaceful location on Kingsway. The little mini mall has a busy parking lot but you can usually find street parking (both free and paid).

We've been here a few times to grab a quick bbq lunch combo. But we finally visited for dine-in recently. In addition to their bbq service, they have a full Chinese seafood menu offering.

We ordered the 3 item bbq combo (you pick and choose which bbq items you want but we opted for the roast pork, bbq, and soya sauce chicken). While the bbq price is higher than the lunch combos, you get more meat. Not a bad price when you consider how much the price of bbq duck has gone up lately. The duck was good... meaty and juicy. Roast pork has nice crispy skin. A welcome addition to the area for bbq.

Pea tips were good too. And I like that we received complimentary soup to start and green bean soup for dessert.

Really want to come back here and try some of their seafood combos.

Update: We did return in October to try a dinner combo with a 2lb lobster sticky rice with 2 bbq items plus 1 other dish for $118 (we picked the sole fillets with veggies). We also added the Taiwanese cauliflower with lap cheung and bacon. Again, you get complimentary soup and dessert. Bbq items were as good as before.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Absolutely disgusting. The Shao Rou  (roasted pork) was not flavourful but the Cha Shao  (bbq pork) was just fat and sugar, their Xian Guo Gu Lu Rou  (fresh fruit sweet and sour pork) tasted off with a subtle funny flavour and mass-produced feeling texture, and anything but "Xian " (fresh), Hei Jiao Niu Liu  (black pepper beef) was thick-cut cheap beef doused with baking soda and I could barely chew through it. Even the white rice was gummy.
However, their Jiao Yan Dou Fu  (salt and pepper tofu) was quite nice, texture was dense with a crispy and salty shell to contrast with the flavourless internals. I also enjoyed the soup at the beginning, though a little salty, and abhorred the mung bean Tang Shui  (dessert water) brought out at the end.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Newer restaurant that replaced Peaceful restaurant that was there prior. The GOOD: place was busy for a Sat night at 8pm so that's a good sign. Didn't wait long for a table for 2. Pleasantly surprised at the preset 2x combo meats + main + soup + 2 bowls of white rice for $56. So we ordered BBQ duck + pork, main was green beans w minced pork & soup of the day.

The MEH: menu should have spelled out that the combo soup is the soup of the day; no choosing. We asked for hot n sour, but the server brought the daily soup instead. When asked why, she then said the combo soup has to be daily soup.

I found the BBQ pork and duck very tasty and not too oily. The green beans w minced pork were perfectly crispy but not too deep-fried. Again, very tasty. Didn't care for the daily soup, as it's just a thin broth w few veggies + few pieces of meat. Would have preferred the hot n sour 

Final bill w tax was just under $60.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Very great food. Tried out the double fried chicken and bulgogi beef fries. Not too sweet either on the sauces which is good. The bulgogi beef portion was a little lacking, but does taste good.

The service was also great. One of the lady cashiers was very polite and served with a smile which is nice.

Good recommend

Note: the waffle fries with the chicken burger was a side order.

featured_reviews.review_id: Wow, Chicken World has been put on notice. If you're trying to decide between the 2, this is definitely the one you want. I just had a chicken sandwich with a whole gigantic chicken breast in it. It was tender and spicy and came with delicious waffle cut fries, and I had a beer with it, all in a lovely diner with air conditioning and great ambiance.  I would love a bigger selection of local beer but on the rest I have no notes. Well done!

featured_reviews.review_id: Visited today for late lunch. I had the best chicken sandwich I have had recently (based on my personal experience). The chicken inside the sandwich was juicy, crunch and well seasoned. The sauce and the slaw worked really well together. We ordered the OG hot chicken, hot and sweet honey garlic, and kids tenders. I personally liked the honey garlic sandwich more but the OG was also really tasty. Waffles fries were great too with a good portion size. Their house mayo was also delicious. Most of all, the lady who received our order was  so kind, attentive and friendly. The service was beyond 10/10. She even came to check how our food was and also to kindly interact with our son. Such a sweet gesture. The only criticism I have was that it was a bit cold in the restaurant. Got a tall can of beer with the chicken sammy, and this meal was so satisfying. Definitely going on my favourite restaurant list.

Great food for takeout! I used to eat at the food truck when I worked downtown and the restaurant continues to provide the same excellent quality!

The chicken is juicy and customized to your spice level, and there is a good selection of items. One of my favorite places to order from if I feel like eating chicken.

Highly recommend the Dirty Hot Chicken Fries if you fancy a comfort meal.

places.name: Folke
places.address: Folke, 2585 W Broadway, Vancouver, BC V6K 2E9

featured_reviews.review_id: We shared a chef's tasting menu and sat at the Chef's bar. The entire experience was perfect. As we were being seated we were asked where we are from and they confirmed that it was a special occasion. The exceptional service continued throughout the evening. The food was exquisite. Vegan fare rarely rises to such heights. Attention was paid to presentation, flavor combinations, and textures. The Beet tartar and the chickpea tofu stood out to my mind, but nothing was wanting. The desserts were luscious. The chocolate layer cake with crunchy bottom, orange gelee, and a sprinkle of salt to heighten the senses was, like the rest of the meal a delight for the eyes and senses on multiple levels. The pear tart was perfectly cooked with the fruit holding it's shape and texture, not too sweet, with a touch of cinnamon. I enjoyed a non-alcoholic beer and an NA gin and tonic that were recommended and I would gladly order again. My partner really enjoyed her whiskey cocktail (with alcohol) and her recommended glass of white wine. We will happily be back.

featured_reviews.review_id: Everything is AMAZING, cannot recommend Folke enough! My friends and I visited thinking we're just going to have another regular dinner but we were thoroughly blown away. Every dish was full of flavour, texture, and tastiness! The only dish we thought was okay was their dessert, but to top that off they had the best rhubarb caramel (which we would love to purchase, except they said that wasn't possible ughhh). Would definitely revisit Folke again. Their service was also exceptional and the food came out really fast as well!

featured_reviews.review_id:
This is my first time here and I was thoroughly impressed. They prioritize fair and equal wages for their staff, eliminating the need for gratuity, which undoubtedly contributes to the excellent service.

The culinary experience was exceptional, with each dish showcasing the creativity of the chefs, proving that plant-based cuisine can be delicious and satisfying. The restaurant's serene atmosphere, with its calming decor and lighting, made for a perfect setting for a tranquil meal. In summary, this all-vegan restaurant offers both a delightful dining experience and a commendable commitment to fair wages, making it a highly recommended choice for those seeking exceptional vegan cuisine.

featured_reviews.review_id: My husband and I heard about Folke through a friend. We requested the sharing / wine pairing menu. It was absolutely fabulous! There were so many complex and nuanced flavours with each dish. We will be back!
featured_reviews.review_text: My husband and I heard about Folke through a friend. We requested the sharing / wine pairing menu. It was absolutely fabulous! There were so many complex and nuanced flavours with each dish. We will be back!

featured_reviews.review_id: Super unique and amazing vegan food with complex, unique flavors that really feature the vegetables and their flavors in unique and unexpected ways. So many vegan dishes and restaurants focus on the seasonings and sauces only but Folke chefs (magicians) really pull forward the natural flavors putting veggies herbs and legumes on center stage. If I wasn't already vegan, this dining experience would have surely turned me. Also, next level gourmet tater tots; tapioca mushroom dumpling were insane; fried chickpea tofu... so fantastic. We got the tasting menu which was incredible at only $85 CAD and little morsels of a bunch of different dishes so you get to try a lot of variety but plenty of food left us satisfied and full by the time dessert came. The best Michelin restaurant I've been to yet!

featured_reviews.review_id: 10/10 experience - true vegan fine dining! All of the food was absolutely mind-blowing, and every staff member we interacted with was kind, attentive, helpful, genuine, and knowledgeable!!! A MUST go for anyone curious!!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Went early and got a table inside. They have approximately 6-7 tables set up outside to allow you to enjoy the great summer weather.

I've been on a health binge so was excited to try a vegan restaurant.

Overall impression was positive. The portions were right for two people. We ordered 3 appies (beets, tomatoes, and chickpea tofu) and one main (yellow curry zucchini). The bill came out to about $90/ person. We were pleasantly surprised to find that there is no tipping required. Either that or we missed it, in which case, soooo sorry.

The taste of the appetizers were light and delicate. Fits my impression of what vegan dishes ought to be like. The curry zucchini had a stronger flavor but even that felt rather light.

My favorite dish was the chickpea tofu. I just like chickpeas and I like tofu. What can I say. My least favorite was the heirloom tomatoes but it wasn't because it didn't taste good, it just wasn't very memorable.

If you're a vegan or want to try to clean the bilges so to speak this is definitely worth a try. We paired it with a bottle of the Kutatas Viz (recommended by the server because they were out of the rose we wanted). It paired well with all the dishes but I'd try the reisling next time, and there will be a next time.

places.name: City 1 Cafe
places.address: City 1 Cafe, 954 W King Edward Ave, Vancouver, BC V5Z 2E2

featured_reviews.review_id:
I think their strength is the hainanese chicken rice because I saw a lot of people ordered that. Their hainanese chicken rice earned them 2 star from me. The rice was flavorful and not too oily.

The satay was well marinated. Sweet but not much spices. The satay sauce was pretty plain - almost like peanut butter. Satay perhaps, but not Malaysian style. It's missing some spices.

The worst was char kuey teow. Not sure where they got their char kuey teow recipe from. But it didn't look like one and didn't taste like one.

Boneless laksa chicken noodle is 18+tax.  The broth was amazing and seems to be made with many ingredients.

Their milk tea is good as well, brew on demand and takes 30 mins, just request to add extra milk as it is stronger than other milk tea places.

featured_reviews.review_id: Something good, quick and satisfying on a rather wet Wednesday evening - and remembered one of our old favourites - city 1; funny how I always forget to review old favourites. This rezzie is perfect as their portions are not generous and suits a weekday dinner. And the Hainanese chicken is as good as in the past, but what's outstanding are their chicken oil rice - Yummy - and the accompanying soup, which is such a good chicken broth that I guess they make from the bones of their boneless chicken. As good as home made chicken soup (oops, my better half is NOT gonna like this remark!). Opted for the half chicken with the 3 bowls of rice and 2 soups. My my my, they still serve  small portions - must be pigmy chickens!! LOL, but the smoothness and flavour makes up for the lack of quantity. And the price - boy it's higher than I remembered it - but what's as cheap now as in the past??!! Oh well!!

featured_reviews.review_id:
I came here for dinner before but I didn't have a chance to write a review until now. And I just came here for brunch, so I should write about my eating experience here.

All the food and presentation looked great! If you see photos of the bento boxes here, I would be drooling and looking forward to eating the food again. Each item was cooked and presented well. No doubt about it. One thing that I would like the restaurant to be improved on was the temperature of the food. I believe most of the food was cooked ahead of time, so when we placed an order, the chef or staff at the kitchen would put them nicely in a bento box, so everything looked great but the food was not hot at all. The rice, miso soup, and everything else were at room temperature. It will be greatly appreciated if the food is cooked and hot right out of the stove or oven.

The restaurant is on the rooftop of a low rise building. My family and I walked stairs and it's quite a lot of stairs to get to the restaurant. If someone who can't walk on stairs or who is on a wheelchair, you might have to look around and see if they have an elevator to go up to the top floor.

It is a great place to meet with friends or family and enjoy a special meal here. There is a parkade next to the building or people take public transit and walk to the restaurant.
featured_reviews.review_text:

All the food and presentation looked great! If you see photos of the bento boxes here, I would be drooling and looking forward to eating the food again. Each item was cooked and presented well. No doubt about it. One thing that I would like the restaurant to be improved on was the temperature of the food. featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Thank you very much for your visit and honest opinions. We usually don't make food ahead unless you pre-ordered and hot items are supposed to be hot even if you preordered. There must be something wrong happening and we apologize that we served lukewarm food to you. We will find and fix the error to serve you better on your next visit. 

We have elevators next to the building, the same as the parkade. You might need to ask the concierge to get up to the restaurant since it is a little hard to find the way to reach the restaurant.

Thank you very much for the heads-up for our food quality and we look forward to serving you soon.

Best Regards,

Yasuaki

featured_reviews.review_id:
This restaurant is a hidden gem!

It took us a while to find the entry. They have a sign on ground floor says it's opened, however, there's no sign on second floor, so we kind of feel lost and don't know where it is.

Once we went up to third floor, we found the restaurant and everything is so amazing! They have a really Japanese style interior decoration which is cute and aesthetic.

We ordered 3 combos and every food is tasty! Really recommend the royal bento, it's $30 but you got to try so many dishes!

Will definitely recommend to others and come back!

places.name: Dilli Heights Bistro | Delhi Themed Cafe & Bistro in Vancouver

owner.name: Dilli Heights Bistro | Delhi Themed Cafe & Bistro in Vancouver (Owner)

places.address: Dilli Heights Bistro | Delhi Themed Cafe & Bistro in Vancouver, 436 Richards St, Vancouver, BC V6B 2Z3

featured_reviews.review_id:
My husband and I found this place when we wanted some late night food. We absolutely loved the live music, it was such an inviting place. The food was fantastic and so authentic! We loved getting to have some Indian street food that we've never had before.

Everything was so good we went back the next day for brunch!

A few things were quite spicy and I needed to get some yogurt to go with it, but I wouldn't change a thing. It was SO DELICIOUS!!!! We'll definitely want to come back here whenever we are in Vancouver.

featured_reviews.review_id: Dilli Heights Bistro in Vancouver is a culinary delight! The golgappe sent my taste buds on a journey to Delhi, evoking the authentic flavors of the bustling streets. The chicken and veg momos were a true gastronomic pleasure, leaving me craving for more. And the vada pav? It was nothing short of a fantabulous explosion of flavors. This restaurant is a must-visit for every foodie seeking an exquisite taste of Delhi in the heart of Vancouver.

featured_reviews.review_id:
*Serious Review Alert*
I would highly recommend to all the people reading this review. Please read the whole review. So it all started with when i went there to have my dinner at this place and we didn't had any food since morning. We ordered in clear words a paneer masala roll and veg steamed momos. The order taker heard us wrong and she punched a chicken masala roll. My friend is a non-vegetarian person but it all comes to me i am a vegetarian person by birth and it's like i don't even eat eggs. We were so hungry that we started eating the wrap and also as i said above we didn't ate since morning so we didn't realised initially that we were served chicken but later my friend realised since he is a non-vegetarian person. As I complained to the order taker, she was like i always double confirm the order. But we clearly remember that we ordered a paneer masala roll and she didn't double confirmed with us as well. It was all her mistake and she knows that very well. And also in their apologies, when i asked sincerely can i know the name of order taker by any chance. She replied "IT WILL AFFECT MY JOB". Seriously, are you kidding me? It has affected my life. Just one mistake of order taker who was varsha has affected me mentally, can anybody imagine that she made a vegetarian person eat chicken. It comes under my religion and i am a pure vegetarian. It's high time to consider this review. That being said, at the time of ordering, we clearly also told her to cut the wrap in two halves. She was like yes, i'll do it for you. Later when i went to pick my food, i asked her, that is it in two halves already? She told me yes. When I opened the wrap it was in one full piece. I need to ask her again to cut in two. That clearly shows she didn't heard us right while taking the order. Such discrepancies while taking order shouldn't be considered that too to a pure vegetarian person, who never ate since born.

places.address: Delara Restaurant, 2272 W 4th Ave, Vancouver, BC V6K 1N8

featured_reviews.review_id:
My family and I had such a wonderful experience at Delara. The servers were so hospitable, friendly and kind - I love it when servers have a smile on their face despite being crazy busy (which they were), and the food was absolutely incredible.

The lamb shank and beef main dishes were so flavourful and the meat incredibly soft and delicious. We got some cocktails too and I was recommended an off the menu champagne that I drank like fruit juice.

I really couldn't recommend this place more. Thanks for such a wonderful night!

featured_reviews.review_id: Absolutely loved this place. Came here with a friend and it was my first experience here. The layout and decor of the restaurant is absolutely gorgeous and bright. The service was wonderful - the staff were quite friendly and hard working. I don't have a lot of experience with Persian food but I do enjoy it hence I do get to try it out - I do have to say that I was very surprised at how much I loved the food at Delara. The portion size for spot on and the taste was even better.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I must say, this Persian restaurant stands out as one of the finest I've ever experienced. The flavors are truly distinctive, preserving that unmistakable Persian essence. While the ambiance is relatively cozy, it's a pleasant deviation from the online photos, which adds to its charm.

Their drink menu impressed me with its variety and creative names. I especially enjoyed the Persian Godfather cocktail. For appetizers, we indulged in the succulent Kofteh and the delightful Grilled Sourdough Flatbread with Seasonal Dips, both of which were exquisite.

Moving on to the main course, we tried the Smoked Rice and Lentil Bowl, which, unfortunately, came out a bit too dry for my taste. However, the Roasted Chicken Leg with Barberries and Tahdig more than made up for it. The crispy chicken paired perfectly with the sides of Yoghourt and Torshi (pickles). The adorable and delicious bread was a nice touch too.

For dessert, we ordered Persian Chai, Baklava, and Safran ice cream. While the overall dessert experience was pleasant, there was a slight hiccup with the ice cream order. Our server initially brought the wrong order and seemed a bit displeased when we pointed it out. Despite being her second day on the job, I believe a courteous response to a mistake is important. Nevertheless, the correction was made, but the Safran ice cream was not what we expected. Kind of disappointing.

Overall, this restaurant offers a delightful blend of fusion and authentic Persian cuisine, with a few service  improvements needed. I would certainly recommend it for the unique culinary journey it provides

featured_reviews.review_id:
The restaurant has a warm quiet ambiance. The quality of food is top notch. The restaurant space is medium size open floor with benches and tables on one side and a bar on the other. The kitchen is at the far end of the floor and visible from where you sit, so you can smell the food as it's being cooked.
We tried Grilled Beef Ghalieh, Koofteh 18, and Chicken and Barberries and loved all three dishes. Grilled beef Ghalieh was like a stew with a savory sauce and a piece of tender beef short rib. The chicken was so tender. The koofteh tasted like classic nostalgic Iranian koofteh you'd get at your grandma's.
We were told if you'd like to sit at the benches, you can leave a note when you're reserving your table if you have a preferred spot. We noted in our reservation our birthday occasion and they were nice to bring us a small cute baklava and a candle in the end. The place obviously has its own theme and is not like any other typical Persian restaurant. So if you're looking to get quantity food or kabob, this is not the right choice. But of you like to taste true Persian cuisine and experience Persian food with a contemporary style, this is absolutely the place. You can tell the owner cares about the cuisine the most.
I read in the reviews that if you have a birthday cake, you can't eat it in the restaurant and it's mentioned in the website. So if you're planning a birthday and have a cake, you better review their policy or check in with them in advance.
Overall we had a wonderful experience and we'd like to come back when the menu changes so we can try their different dishes.
