featured_reviews.review_id: Fabulous food! Every single dish was delicious. Portion sizes were generous and the service was amazing. I am celiac and there were so many gluten free choices on the menu without any substitutions needed.
featured_reviews.review_text: Fabulous food! Every single dish was delicious. Portion sizes were generous and the service was amazing. I am celiac and there were so many gluten free choices on the menu without any substitutions needed.

featured_reviews.review_id:
***I would rate Delara a negative out of 5, but that's not an option here.***
We came here for lunch to celebrate our friend's birthday. We bought a cake with us. As we sat down the waiter abruptly and rudely stated, "You guys know you're not allowed to eat the cake here, right?". No, we didn't that's why we brought the cake. Had you informed us in a nicer tone and attitude we really wouldn't have minded. We have also brought cakes to many many other restaurants and never had any issues in the last 30 years - but Delara proved us wrong. We don't mind paying the extra service fee or tipping extra, but the waiter sounded like our presence was a disturbance. Also throughout lunch we found their service lacking - actually, almost non-existent. It was very hard to catch any staff's attention for stuff from getting water to getting the bill.

Maybe the food was just not our taste, but we found everything to be very salty. The portion sizes were also unsatisfying for what we were paying. The food in general was just very underwhelming. As we scratch our heads to think about a single positive experience, we absolutely can't think of any and that's truly a shame.

places.name: Raisu
places.description: Fashionable eatery with contemporary styling turning out refined Japanese dishes & sushi rolls.
places.address: Raisu, 2340 W 4th Ave, Vancouver, BC V6K 1P1

featured_reviews.review_id: I'm not too sure what the overall hype with this restaurant is. The restaurant is fairly nice, although some things, like newer cushions are needed. The atmosphere is suited as being down to Earth and fairly laid back with a hint of formality, which is always nice. The food is good, but not great, considering the cost. The fish seemed relatively fresh, which was great. Presentation was good. However, for hot dishes, we received warm food that seemed like it was left out a while before getting to our table. I think this aspect could be improved upon. I would go back, but I wouldn't go out of my way to wait in line to eat here.
featured_reviews.review_text: I'm not too sure what the overall hype with this restaurant is. The restaurant is fairly nice, although some things, like newer cushions are needed. The atmosphere is suited as being down to Earth and fairly laid back with a hint of formality, which is always nice. The food is good, but not great, considering the cost. The fish seemed relatively fresh, which was great. Presentation was good. However, for hot dishes, we received warm food that seemed like it was left out a while before getting to our table. I think this aspect could be improved upon. I would go back, but I wouldn't go out of my way to wait in line to eat here.

featured_reviews.review_id: Amazing experience! I visited this restaurant for the first time and it was excellent. The Japanese energy is fantastic, the server was super friendly, kind and helpful. The food was delicious huge portions, I even took some home. If you are celebrating your birthday, they give you a dessert and a Polaroid picture as a suvenir. The coctails are wonderful and everything is served in a super creative way! I will come back soon!!!

featured_reviews.review_id: The best Japanese restaurant I ever tried in Vancouver. Service is professional and patience. Food is amazing. Fresh ingredients and yummy miso soup. I found they will serve the fresh washibi instead of the manufactured one!!! That's a great surprise!!! All the environment let you feel like you're in Japan. If you celebrate your anniversary or birthday, they will offer a complimentary pudding and sing a special song for you. It will be my number one if I want to enjoy the Japanese food. Definitely will let all my friends know and highly recommend if you want to try. Just in case, please remember to make your reservation.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Raisu is an excellent Japanese restaurant with delicious food. Their drinks are very reasonably priced with my favorite being the Naminooto Kabosukkiri Fruit Sake. The Chicken Karaage and Garlic Edamame were some of my favorites.

It was a bit hot in the section where you take your shoes off when we went but they're great for special events (very entertaining birthday singing with a tamberine and free polaroid of everyone).

featured_reviews.review_id:
We came here for birthday celebration. Everything is on point except quality of food. I would recommend the daily special lunch box set, and the vegan box set, as well as kids menu. Fried chicken and wagyu fried was pretty good as well. Flavour of food is definitely on the saltier side...
Sashimi and fatty tuna bowl was mediocre and fatty tuna was chewy which was disappointing
Staff is super friendly. I would recommend to come if you are close by. If you are far away like me, there are better places to try

featured_reviews.review_id:
Uni omakase was great and sooo worth the money. Amazing value for money.

The appetizer was the best. Acidic, good uni flavour, truffle jelly. Amazing combination.

Sashimi and maki was great. Lots of fresh fat uni.

Uni egg custard was soft and thick flavoured.

Uni stone rice was better with the soup but salty.

featured_reviews.review_id:
We were here for a friend birthday. Reservation was done online.The staff kindly asked for food allergy and which person with allergy in email after registration. When we arrived, we were sat at the patio table where it is bright and breeze, very comfy. I was impressed with how attentive staff were. Water jug gets fill whenever close to empty, they remembered which member has food allergy and let the person know as we order.

For the great taste, good portion and amazing service, the price point is justified in my opinion.

The birthday star got a birthday song, dessert and polaroid photo from the staff. Totally made the day. Thank you for making this visit so so special.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Me and 4 other girls ordered Uber eats for lunch and what a great lunch spot to try!

We ordered:
* x3 Funky Chicken $16.95 (recommend)
* Cauli Sutra (Chickpea) $21.60 Buy 1 get 1 free (recommend)
* Pacific Prawn Star $16.90  (recommend)

All 3 dishes were super tasty, fresh and well balanced! You get rice under the pickled veggies and salad, the chicken and prawns were juicy and warm still and give a nice middle eastern taste. In the whole bowl you pretty much get a little bit of everything, sweet from the pomegranates, savoury from the chicken, spicy from the jalapenos, tangy from the pickled veggies and a good balance of rice and that great wet sauce on top! Overall highly recommend trying this place out, you won't regret!

featured_reviews.review_id:
My wife and I recently had the pleasure of dining at a remarkable restaurant during our 10-day stay in Canada, and it's safe to say that this dining experience was the highlight of our trip. This culinary gem, which we wholeheartedly recommend to all fellow food enthusiasts, is none other than the restaurant where we indulged in the freshest, healthiest, and most delectable dishes we've ever had the pleasure of savoring.
The restaurant's ambiance was cozy and welcoming, creating the perfect atmosphere for a memorable dining experience. However, what truly sets this place apart is its commitment to serving healthy yet incredibly delicious food. We were pleasantly surprised to discover an extensive menu filled with a variety of options to cater to various dietary preferences. As health-conscious individuals, we couldn't have been more delighted.
One of the standout dishes we had the pleasure of trying was the "Grizzly's Catch." This seafood masterpiece was a true culinary delight. The perfectly seared fish was tender, flaky, and bursting with flavor. The accompanying fresh vegetables and light drizzle of sauce complemented the dish perfectly, making it a must-try for any seafood lover.
Another absolute winner was the "Yogi's Paradise." This vegetarian dish was a symphony of flavors and textures. The combination of perfectly grilled tofu, sauteed vegetables, and a mouthwatering sauce made this dish an explosion of taste in every bite. It was a pleasant surprise even for us, non-vegetarians, and it showcased the restaurant's mastery in creating dishes that cater to all palates.
One of the most remarkable aspects of our dining experience was the exceptional service provided by Chef Ankit. His passion for food was palpable, and he went above and beyond to ensure that we were not only well-fed but also educated about each dish's preparation. His detailed explanations and friendly demeanor added a personal touch to our meal, making it all the more special.
In addition to the incredible food and service, we were also impressed by the restaurant's commitment to using fresh, locally sourced ingredients. It was evident that quality and health were top priorities in every dish they prepared.
Our journey in Canada would not have been complete without this culinary adventure, and for that, we are deeply grateful to Chef Ankit and the entire restaurant team. We wholeheartedly recommend this establishment to anyone visiting the area. Whether you're a health-conscious diner or simply in search of a fantastic meal, this restaurant is a must-visit. Thank you for making our trip truly memorable!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Had an amazing meal at Krsma Indian Cuisine today !

We got the Tandoori Chicken (15.95) it was four pieces of amazingly juicy, piping hot chicken. It was well marinated and very fragrant !

We also got the Krsma Chicken Tikka (15.95) which was super juicy , tender and had a slight sourness from the yogurt.

Lastly we got an order of fish pakoras (9.95). These were lightly battered and very juicy. The batter was crispy and lightly salted. Amazing with the mint chutney!

The staff were generous and gave us complimentary papadum! It was very crispy and lightly salted. It came with tamarind and mint chutney. The mint chutney was stellar ! It was the perfect blend of sour, spicy any lemon!

Edit (10/21/23): went back for lunch and tried their Onion Bajia 8.95 and fish korma 15.95 with a side of rice (4.95). The onion Bajia was very crispy and lightly battered, with the perfect amount of saltiness and crispiness. The fish korma was outstanding! The cashew curry was very rich and had a yummy sweetness to it. The fish was also very tender.

The owner was kind and provided a Gulab Jamun on the house, it was nice and warm...mmmm.

We got the Tandoori Chicken (15.95) it was four pieces of amazingly juicy, piping hot chicken. It was well marinated and very fragrant !

We also got the Krsma Chicken Tikka (15.95) which was super juicy , tender and had a slight sourness from the yogurt.

Lastly we got an order of fish pakoras (9.95). These were lightly battered and very juicy. The batter was crispy and lightly salted. Amazing with the mint chutney!

The staff were generous and gave us complimentary papadum! It was very crispy and lightly salted. It came with tamarind and mint chutney. The mint chutney was stellar ! It was the perfect blend of sour, spicy any lemon!

Edit (10/21/23): went back for lunch and tried their Onion Bajia 8.95 and fish korma 15.95 with a side of rice (4.95). The onion Bajia was very crispy and lightly battered, with the perfect amount of saltiness and crispiness. The fish korma was outstanding! The cashew curry was very rich and had a yummy sweetness to it. The fish was also very tender.

The owner was kind and provided a Gulab Jamun on the house, it was nice and warm...mmmm.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! We truly appreciate your feedback and are delighted to hear about your positive experience with us. Your support means a lot to our team. We would love to see you again.

featured_reviews.review_id: Looking for a place that is cozy, inviting and relax atmosphere? Well I just found one, this is the place where you can enjoy your pho meals. Very classy, clean and best of all the food is amazing! deliciously  prepared, service is uniquely delivered and graciously given..very budget friendly.. the staff are very helpful ,friendly and kind . Very highly recommended  service with care..

featured_reviews.review_id:
There are a lot of options for Vietnamese food on Victoria Drive, but La Maison Da Nang is my go to. I am a big fan of their vermicelli bowls, and the fried spring rolls are amazing. I love that they do the crispy thick wrapper, whereas many restaurants do thinner wrap.

I ordered a grilled chicken with spring roll vermicelli bowl for take out, however there was some miscommunication as when I got home I realized they gave me pork. Regardless, it was so good that I ended up dining in the next day. This time I successfuly got the grilled chicken and it was also delicious. I've tried their pho in the past and it is a good standard bowl of pho.

The restaurant is clean, feels new, and our server was attentive and nice. Will be ordering from here whenever I crave Vietnamese!

featured_reviews.review_id:
The Vietnamese Rice Noodle soup with beef slices and beef balls is good. The noodle portion size are adequate. The building/ restaurant itself is very clean and tidy. The restaurant's menu states that this restaurant uses very little MSG in their food and that the soup for the noodles are only made using bone. I can taste that the noodle soup base taste is not too strong. Parking is along the street.

Friends eating with me tried out the Charbroiled Lemongrass Chicken with Rice and the other tried the rice noodles with spring rolls. Both of them did not complain about anything wrong with their food. Food is ok.

Disclaimer: The Executive Chef is a friend.

Food here was amazing. Our menu was curated by the executive chef.

Plating: 3.5/5
Flavour: 3.5/5
Environment: 3/5
Service: 3.5/5

To us, it was an above average hotel cafe/coffeehouse but maybe only because we were served a "special" menu.

I thoroughly enjoyed the Sablefish which was paired with truly yummy Brussels Sprout.

Worth visiting if you are round the corner. No fanfare; just really simple good food.

Late night dinner on the Saturday night, we had Linguine Puttanesca that's been lightly tossed with the hotels' owners owned Olive oils.. that's just pure virgin oil, and the quantity and quality of the plating were simply outstanding.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Had the pleasure to take advantage of the three course 2022 dine out lunch menu. For $25 per person (pp), we received a three course meal which started with a goat cheese salad appetizer (also had a choice of a chef selection soup -- which was coconut chicken that day), a main -- three options available --
salmon, short rib pasta and a vegetarian option which was a portobello mushroom burger -- we selected the latter two. Both tasted great; albeit, the pasta was heavy as it was made with a cream sauce. We ended the meal with a slice of decadent chocolate cake. For a $25 pp price tag, it was good value, and worth the trip. Erin was our server, and she was both helpful and friendly. Location is conveniently located in Coal Harbour, and we also lucked out with a mountainous view that day! The restaurant wasn't too busy, so noise was moderate and seating comfortable.

featured_reviews.review_id:
As the front of a speakeasy, it's certainly made to look quite unassuming. It looks like a small dumpling shop with limited seating.

The dumplings are good and I would recommend trying them, but the prices are on the more expensive side. You can get better dumplings for cheaper elsewhere.

There are also limited vegetarian options so this place is not recommended for anyone who doesn't eat meat.

I think this place is rated more negatively than it should be based on my experience. For my thoughts on the drinks, check out my review of Laowai.

featured_reviews.review_id: There were four of us getting the lunch special which pretty much used up all the capacity for 10 mins so if it gets busy expect a little wait but the server was super friendly and advised on the menu well. The bison were nice, especially if you like a little kick in your dipping sauce (I do) the pork were the most traditional, the prawn and oyster were super soft and delicate - quite petit tho if you have a big appetite (also yes). The lamb cumin were a bit odd - not bad but not a flavour I don't associate with dumplings (which is why I ordered to be fair) they are quite dense too. The lunch deal is good with two servings and a soft drink for $12. I will say, even with two portions I could have eaten one or two more. All in all, good visit, good flavours, good service.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Really cool that we finally have a speakeasy here in Vancouver! I arrived first out of my party and thought it was hilarious how the front server at blnd tgr didn't want to let me into the back that easily. Apparently you have to order something special off the menu ;)

Once you do make it inside you'll be shocked at how long and large the interior is. The decor and lighting is dark with a nice ambience. Server super nice. Loved the drink menu concept and how each cocktail was part of a different story.

The food is best to be shared (there were four of us) and we ordered several things.

I would definitely stay away from the the xiao long bao: the dumplings were extremely tiny and had no soup so I do not recommend!

The pork belly was our favorite thing on the menu because it was soft and fatty in all the right places. Covered and cooked in yummy sauce.

The drunken chicken was another favorite as well. The meat was soft and poached perfectly.

I enjoyed the noodles but my coworkers found it too spicy.

The fried fish was delicious but again, on the smaller side.

While I was waiting for my friends, I had the bison momo dumplings. They were good but nothing special. I thought that they were covered in way too much spicy topping.

Overall, the place is a cool concept and great for drinks and the experience. The food menu could use some tweaking so I wouldn't come here expecting to be full and satisfied.
featured_reviews.review_text:
Really cool that we finally have a speakeasy here in Vancouver! I arrived first out of my party and thought it was hilarious how the front server at blnd tgr didn't want to let me into the back that easily. Apparently you have to order something special off the menu ;)

Once you do make it inside you'll be shocked at how long and large the interior is. The decor and lighting is dark with a nice ambience. Server super nice. Loved the drink menu concept and how each cocktail was part of a different story.

The food is best to be shared (there were four of us) and we ordered several things.

I would definitely stay away from the the xiao long bao: the dumplings were extremely tiny and had no soup so I do not recommend!

The pork belly was our favorite thing on the menu because it was soft and fatty in all the right places. Covered and cooked in yummy sauce.

The drunken chicken was another favorite as well. The meat was soft and poached perfectly.

I enjoyed the noodles but my coworkers found it too spicy.

The fried fish was delicious but again, on the smaller side.

While I was waiting for my friends, I had the bison momo dumplings. They were good but nothing special. I thought that they were covered in way too much spicy topping.

Overall, the place is a cool concept and great for drinks and the experience. The food menu could use some tweaking so I wouldn't come here expecting to be full and satisfied.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I've been eyeing this place for a while now and decided to give it a go. My god, was it good.  So good. I ordered the Drunken Noodles with prawns. The prawns were enormous and perfectly cooked. Every flavour was balanced and expertly executed. I will be coming here more often for sure to try the rest of the menu. I had no clue International Village had so many good options in the food court.

The only advice I give is go easy on the spice. I ordered Medium spice with my noodles and, though I could handle it, I'm at the age where the rest of my body is not too keen of a certain threshold of chillies onwards. I will be paying for this level of spice later. But for now, HOT DANG was it delicious.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Sometimes you find the best food in the most unexpected places. Walking into International Village Mall for the first time, you might be taken aback by how empty and dead it feels, especially in contrast to the surrounding lively Gastown district. But you'd be surprised by how alive the food scene is. Especially this little hidden gem.

We had:

Pad Thai Combo ($14.99 + $2 for choosing prawns) - one of the best I've had, the flavour was a perfect balance of slightly sweet, savoury and a little kick of spice (you can adjust). The combo comes with the following: (1) a salad, (2) a spring roll, (3) a soup, and (4) your choice of a drink. The soup was clean and clear but packed with flavour. It was a clear sign that the chef is talented

Tom Kah Goong (Prawn) ($14.95) - this is very reminiscent of the more popular Tom Yum soup but with the addition of creamy coconut milk. It was piping hot (seriously, be careful!) but I fought through the pain to gulp it down because it was so delicious! Those hot, sour, creamy flavours all melded together into an amazing concoction. Bites of mushroom, lemongrass, tomatoes, onions, and prawns throughout were delightful

The fact that you're getting this level of restaurant-quality (and honestly much better than some restaurants) food in a little place like this is unbelievable. They're the sweetest and they obviously pour so much love into what they do. If you're ever in the area, I hope you'll consider stopping by this hidden food court! While its exterior may not seem particularly extraordinary, it holds some amazing flavours and wonderful people.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Amazing authentic Thai food at accessible prices. Best pad Thai and mango sticky rice I have ever had outside of Thailand. The green curry is rich, satisfying, and has big, strong flavours. Best Thai food in Vancouver is in the food court of International Village Mall. Believe it or not!

This is not fast food because it's only two people (husband and wife) making authentic and amazing Thai food which should not be rushed. Just sit down and get excited about the amazing food you're about to eat.

featured_reviews.review_id:
This was the first time we ordered from El Mercat and we were not disappointed. We treated ourselves to the Valentine's Day box and everything arrived fresh and with clear instructions. We've been to Spain so this meal brought back so many memories of the excellent food there. The Basque style cheesecake was worth it alone but honestly everything was delicious.
The delivery arrived on time and with a smile. We even received a text in advance so we could be sure to be home. The rose in the box was a nice and unexpected touch. Would absolutely recommend El Mercat.

featured_reviews.review_id: Gary's is a great spot - a nice combination of cozy neighborhood spot and special event destination dining.  The food is really well executed and luxurious without being fussy.  Owners Bailey and Mat (of whom we've been fans since their days with Collective Hospitality) have nailed it with comfortable, friendly service and excellent food.  We went for a special event and will keep coming back, just because it's worth the trip.
featured_reviews.review_text: Gary's is a great spot - a nice combination of cozy neighborhood spot and special event destination dining. featured_reviews.review_id:
Very chill room, with excellent, attentive service and delicious, inventive twists on French/Euro classics.

Unbelievable value at $64/pp for the tasting menu. What was unexpected was that the dishes we weren't considering a la carte turned out to be total hits. The raddiccio, cheddar, apple and ham salad was incredible - light, with a sweet and savory balance. The lingcod had the most ethereal vadouvan spiced sauce and flavourful fingerling potatoes. And the sauce gribiche for the cured steelhead was a standout.

The final savoury course - the pork cheeks with spaetzle, plentiful chanterelles and sourdough breadcrumb - was perfection.

Loved everything about the place, and unbeatable value with today's prices. Highly recommend.

featured_reviews.review_id: Best new restaurant 2023 in Vancouver!  All those in the know... already know this talented team comes with a great pedigree.  It's all in the details and they are on point on all details.  The brioche with liver pate/foie gras with the concord grape compote was beyond... it may beat every Parisian version I've ever had.  The ingredients ... such as the tomatoes...were noteworthy.  The hen of the woods was so finely dusted prior to the deep fry... it was astonishing.  Congrats and I have already booked myself in for 2 more dates as I know this city will make it difficult to get in once word spreads.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Wow! that is the first word that me and my girlfriend said after finishing our dinner date at Gary's. Where to start? they have done everything remarkably on their FIRST opening day.

Ambience : We love, love the decorations and the ambience, combining simple white and black color. The space is small but feels very warm and comforting

Foods : We got the 64$ menu per person for two people which allow us to get 2 snacks, two appetizers, two main course and a dessert. The foods are actually above our expectations. We know we will get good foods, but we expect to eat at duffins or panago after because we thought we will be still hungry due to the portion in reality, the foods portion is PERFECT for two people.

Flavour wise, combining fresh ingredients from local farms and fisheries, we feel that every food has been given much thought, care and love. Everything is fresh, from the lettuce to the lingcod. Our favourite of the night was the pork cheek. WE DON'T HAVE TO CHEW IT!! it was so tender and so much flavours.

Service : top notch service. Jes served us yesterday and she was so informative, polite and very thoughtful, explaining the menu and cater to my girlfriend's spice intolerance very very seriously. She feels like a friend, not a server! Also, I drink lots and lots of water, so i appreciate tht they put a bottle of water on our table!

Overall 5/5. We will come back and TELL our friends to come here because we believe Gary's is a great place to be and a place for people to feel comfortable, full and feel welcomed everytime.

GOOD JOB!

places.name: Northern Cafe
places.description: Down-to-earth spot for hearty breakfasts, burgers & sandwiches, plus Chinese-style dishes.
places.address: Northern Cafe, 1640 East Kent Ave S, Vancouver, BC V5P 2S7

featured_reviews.review_id:
I've been wanting to visit this place for a while now, and today I was in the neighborhood and saw that it was opening at 7, so I got there just before they opened, and it was still dark. I saw them going into the cafe and many of the employees of the supply store they are located at. Had no idea it was at a lumber and hardware supply warehouse, surrounded by many other commercial warehouses, such a great surprise, which just makes it that much better. Absolutely loved the atmosphere and the owners. Very friendly older couple and their son run this awesome famiky owned cafe.

Awesome home cooked breakfast, amazing friendly and relaxed service, and unbelievable atmosphere. When I got there, I was the only one, but I still loved it so much. The old school diner style furniture and music were awesome. I got the pancake with blueberries, sunny side up eggs, and sausage, which were all very good. Loved their old small glass coffee maker and the mugs. The son who was serving was very nice and friendly....he me told me that this place has been around since the 1940s and his parents got this place 15 years ago have been in the business for so long after they retired, wanted to have a slow and small place and now this place is exploded and is crazy busy ...which I find very funny and awesome.

Will definitely come back to try their burgers and Chinese food.

This place is a jewel in Vancouver. From the very unexpected entrance, to the warmth of the staff to the amazing food. Everything you need to have a beautiful experience. No fancy coffee drinks that are replaced for an absolutely amazing food experience.

Everything is cooked to perfection, from fresh ingredients never frozen. The flavors are an experience. That are accompanied by the smiles of every staff member. The place is cozy and comfortable. The house wonton soup is really great, a mix of flavors and expertly served. The hash browns the best!

Don't forget your cash or debit, your credit cards are not welcome here  :)

featured_reviews.review_id:
After hearing so much about Northern Cafe, my anticipation was high as I finally made a reservation to dine at this much-acclaimed establishment. The decision to reserve a table proved to be wise; we were seated almost immediately upon arrival, avoiding the long wait times that had deterred us during a previous attempt to dine here.

Don't be fooled by it's surprising location or the state of the building (which might seem to some as if it were about to collapse at any moment).  Inside is something you won't find anywhere else in Vancouver!

The atmosphere at Northern Cafe is inviting, reflecting its family-run ethos. The menu offers a variety of comfort food options, and we opted for burgers and a side of poutine. The food was exceptional--each bite of the burger was a blend of flavors and textures, and the poutine was a delightful mix of crispy fries, cheese, and well-balanced gravy.

What stood out, even more, was the service. The staff were attentive and courteous, enhancing the overall dining experience. It's evident why this establishment has garnered such high praise and even topped lists of the best places to eat in Canada.

A particularly charming touch was the inclusion of watermelon slices with our meal. It added a refreshing contrast to the hearty fare and demonstrated the restaurant's attention to detail. Another delightful aspect was the handwritten reviews by children displayed on the wall, which actually helped us make our menu choices.

Northern Cafe lives up to its reputation. The combination of delicious food, excellent service, and a welcoming atmosphere makes it a must-visit. Making a reservation is highly recommended!

featured_reviews.review_id: The location is quite cool with a decent amount of parking outside. I can't imagine how this place is during rush hour because it's small and tight and the low ceiling doesn't help at all but cool. I ordered the northern deluxe burger and my wife got the wonton noodle soup. I thought the burger was good, but IMO a little expensive especially for a cash only business, which I'm not a fan of. Unfortunately my wife did not like the wonton noodle soup. I blame social media for over hyping it. The Service was amazing!! it's expected from a family owned business! The service alone is enough to support this restaurant. I still highly recommend this place! You can't go wrong with the burger and BRING CASH!

places.name: Noodle Arts
places.address: Robson St, CA BC Vancouver 1739Robson Street Noodle Arts

detailed_address.street: Robson St, CA BC Vancouver 1739Robson Street

featured_reviews.review_id:
Noodle Arts is a small shop on Robson St. that serves Lanzhou Noodles which can be pulled to different sizes from 1mm to 20mm; so you may have thin, slender noodles or wider, thicker noodles for your dish. There's a window in the restaurant where you can actually see them pulling the noodles!

Shredded Potato Salad
Fried Pork Dumpling
Beef Roll
Lanzhou Gravy Noodle (Vegan)
Szechuan Dan Dan Noodles

Shredded Potato Salad was very refreshing. It had a crispy and crunchy texture, similar to the sensation you'd get when chewing an apple. Fried Pork Dumpling was crispy and flavourful. The rest of the dishes were just OK. Nothing bad, but nothing to write home about either. It's a decent place to go to if you're just looking for a simple bowl of noodles to fill your tummy. They certainly have made the stretching of the noodles into an art, and it's fun to watch them at it!

Service: Could have been better
Parking: Paid parking on the street
Location:1739 Robson St., Vancouver, BC

featured_reviews.review_id: Noodles are hand made fresh and I ordered the signature beef noodles. Low sodium option available. Soup base is clean and clear. Noodles are al dente. Beef is very thin - might be too thin so not much texture. For the gongbao chicken, chicken is tender however some of the peanuts are not crunchy and some are great. We were the only customers so very attentive service. Overall a decent experience. Will likely give it another try.

featured_reviews.review_id:
The food here is absolutely delicious, we come back over and over and everytime it is so tasty.

The owners shared with us that the recipe for the Lanzhou Beef noodle soup is over 100 years old and has been passed down through their family. It is my favorite soup, very light but such depth of flavour.

You can even watch the chef hand pull the delicious noodles. A must visit if you are a foodie!
featured_reviews.review_text:
The food here is absolutely delicious, we come back over and over and everytime it is so tasty.

The owners shared with us that the recipe for the Lanzhou Beef noodle soup is over 100 years old and has been passed down through their family. It is my favorite soup, very light but such depth of flavour.

You can even watch the chef hand pull the delicious noodles. A must visit if you are a foodie!
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We're thrilled to hear that you love our food and keep coming back for more. Our family takes great pride in our over 100-year-old recipe for Lanzhou Beef noodle soup, and we're delighted to hear that it's your favorite. We believe in using only the freshest ingredients to create a soup that is both light and bursting with flavor.

We're glad you had the opportunity to watch our skilled chef hand pull the noodles. It's a technique that has been passed down through generations of our family, and we're proud to keep this tradition alive.

As a restaurant that values our culture and heritage, we're always delighted to share our love for Chinese cuisine with foodies like you. We look forward to welcoming you back to Noodle Arts soon for another delicious meal!

featured_reviews.review_id: They make an amazing vegan Dan Dan noodles that I think about night and day. Ask for added tofu (yes, you will get the vegan tax- they remove the meat and charge an additional $3 for tofu) but it's worth it. Also, it's a lot of tofu so if you go with a vegan friend split the added tofu.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Decided to try Noodle Arts for lunch. They specialize in Lanzhou hand pulled noodles.

Food came out in under 10 minutes. Most dishes are $16.95 to $22.99. Pick your noodle size; extra thin (1mm) to wide flat (20mm).

- Lanzhou pickled cabbage with beef noodle soup ($17.99) - we went with thick (5mm) and spicy. Noodles had a chewy elasticity. Broth was decent but get spicy.
- Fried cumin noodle with lamb ($18.95) - went with regular (3mm). Cumin seasoning was light, noodle portion meagre.

Decent but wouldn't go out of my way to hit up Noodle Arts. A step below Sip Bowl La Mian's offerings.

featured_reviews.review_id:
The most perfect bowl of noodle soup.

Ordered the Lanzhou Beef Noodle soup and it was amazing. Brought a lot of nostalgia to the ones I had back in China.

The star of the show was 100% the noodles, hand pulled noodles are super unique in texture and these certainly delivered.

The soup were really nice and light, accompanied by good amount of green onions and cilantro. Would strongly recommend the spicy option as it as another level of depth to the soup.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I had a very uncommon service. I went there a couple months ago. The place has both indoor and outdoor seating. We liked the food we ordered and the staff was very friendly. The most weird thing was that they charge a dollar amount on every dish you dine in. That is how they present on their menu as well.
They already charged a 15% tip to our bill without our consideration which I was most gutted about.  The items just say dinner and no description as well either. I don't mind give a 15% tip but with my consent.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Non veg options on a Sunday night were very limited, especially the starters(only chicken tandoori and chicken Manchurian, nothing else!). Butter chicken tasted very bad, other curries were also not good. The veg options were good, quite a few options actually. Desserts were not great either, wouldn't recommend to anyone. Will definitely not return.

Carrot halwa was stale, I had to spit it out. I complained and they did replace it but it was too late anyway. Would suggest to offer more non veg starter options and also improve the taste of items and ensure fresh dishes only.

Just exploring restaurants around granville broadway area. I wouldn't say my experience was so good here. We thought we arrived there at wrong time. It was around 10pm and they rushed us to order food and drinks.
Only good thing was our server. Guy worked really hard and he was the only one on the floor. We ordered rose lassi and margrita. Drinks were great but obviously it took some time to arrive on our table since there was only one guy to do all the tasks. Five stars only for him and i dont want to affect your restaurant ratings. I didnt get a chance to catch his name but if you are reading this.. you are doing a great job. U saved 4 stars for your restaurant otherwise i would have given only one star for food.

places.name: Allegro Cafe
places.address: Allegro Cafe, 510 W 8th Ave, Vancouver, BC V5Z 1C6

featured_reviews.review_id: Allegro is a very cool coffee shop because it's perched above Whole Foods Market.  You can have a coffee and get a bird's-eye view of the store, or watch out the window at the traffic on Cambie Street.  There's a nice selection of food in the coffee shop and you can get a much wider selection of ready to eat food in Whole Foods Market.  The coffee is good, the staff are great, service is fast.  They do a lot of recycling in the coffee shop and the Market.  WiFi is good.  Bathroom is good.  The only problem is that (at the moment) the coffee shop closes at 2PM.  But there is cafe seating in the Market below.  Which is nice.  I only like to review places I like and this definitely one of them.  It's got a good vibe.  And I like to shop at Whole Foods Market, so it's win win.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Allegro Cafe offers the best coffee and muffin deal in Vancouver.
The price is fair and the quality is really good. They have a wide variety of muffins to choose from, and they even heat them up for you. The cafe offers different types of, and the best part is that they provide milk alternatives without any extra charges.
The cozy atmosphere adds to the overall experience, and the staff is always incredibly friendly. Highly recommended!

Fancy food and according high prices.

Service: Very friendly and professional service as one would expect from such a restaurant.

Ambiance: Stunning location fancy but laid back. We enjoyed it.

Price: It is quite expensive

Dish recommendation: Anything meat. And the mushroom risotto.

Conclusion: Very nice place with great food. Just mind the prices.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Our first time in Vancouver BC and after a heavy days shopping we visited this restaurant, having passed it earlier in the day, for a quick drink. We initially sat outside at street level only to be directed to the roof terrace accessed by a lift - this was a fortunate move for us that was well received.

Briefly; a stunning roof terrace with the kitchen open to the seating area. Not much of a view but the cool vibe, smooth fixtures and furniture and chilled sound track more than made up for this. Our drink quickly turned into a meal and several drinks. The food was excellent and not as pricey as the surroundings would lead you to believe. The waiting staff were as alert and attentive than any that I have encountered. A lush experience. I fully recommend a visit.

featured_reviews.review_id:
We came for happy hour to the roof on a Thursday. Most of the tables were full but we were able to get a spot. I always love the view up at the Roof because you can see the Fairmont from there.

We ordered the Wagyu beef carpaccio, the ahi tuna tartare and the oysters. For cocktails we got the sangria and Prosecco.

The Wagyu beef carpaccio was lacking in beef flavour. It was cut a little too thin for me to pick up (just a snag). The tuna tartare was not bad. Very fresh tasting and I liked the addition of the pineapple. The chip went perfectly with the tuna tartare. The oysters were pretty standard. The sangria was delicious as usual.

Overall for happy hour they have a pretty big menu compared to other restaurants. They have a wide variety and the portions are pretty big. The service was super friendly and helpful when it comes to making decisions on the menu. This is the place to be if you are looking for a snack and drinks with friends and a nice location but not for food

featured_reviews.review_id:
The people here are fantastic. Very nice. You don't often have to wait long for your food when picking up. Any time that I have, the cook has greeted us with a sample and has been very kind.

As for the food itself, it's delicious. The best carnitas I have had yet. Generous portions and at a good price too.
featured_reviews.review_text:
The people here are fantastic. Very nice. You don't often have to wait long for your food when picking up. Any time that I have, the cook has greeted us with a sample and has been very kind.

As for the food itself, it's delicious. The best carnitas I have had yet. Generous portions and at a good price too.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I placed my order for a takeout lunch box, opting for tacos over the torta. What followed was nothing short of a culinary masterpiece.

The lunch box was a trove of tantalizing flavors. The tacos were generously filled with their signature carnitas - a loving testament to the art of slow-cooked, melt-in-your-mouth pork. The carnitas were impeccably seasoned, their inherent richness perfectly balanced by the tangy green salsa and a lively pico de gallo.

What surprised me was the thoughtful inclusion of jalapenos and limes in the package. The jalapenos added a delightful kick of heat when desired, while the limes were perfect for squeezing over the tacos, lending a refreshing acidity that cut through the richness of the carnitas. Wrapped in soft, pliable corn tortillas, every bite was an exciting play of textures and flavors that kept my taste buds eagerly awaiting the next mouthful.

Equally impressive were the sides. The Habanero Salsa delivered a more robust heat for those who crave a bit more spice, while the Guacamole provided a creamy, cooling contrast, a perfect companion to the star of the box - the carnitas.

But what truly sets Carnitas Don Jose apart from the rest isn't just the quality of their food - it's the evident passion and care that goes into crafting each meal. This isn't fast food; this is a love letter to traditional Mexican cooking, delivered conveniently in a takeout box.

Carnitas Don Jose is not just a pit-stop for food - it's a destination for anyone who appreciates good, hearty meals that stay with you long after the last bite. My advice? Don't just pass by this gem. Stop, order, and prepare to be pleasantly surprised. After all, great food isn't just about satisfying hunger, it's about the experience. And Carnitas Don Jose offers an experience you won't forget.

Once again, thank you for choosing Carnitas Don Jose. We look forward to serving you again soon and creating more unforgettable moments for you and all our valued customers.
Best regards,
The Carnitas Don Jose Team

featured_reviews.review_id:
Been many times to Famous Foods. They have a lot of natural, bulk foods.

Good
- Large selection herbs and spices. I like their hibiscus ($7.49 for 100g or $2.99 for 25g) but the 100g bag used to be $5.99.
- They have no MSG soup base mixes (beef, chicken and vegetable)
- Deli section usually has some meats and cheeses on special
- Steaks

Bad
- Pricey. Organic meats options are crazy. $30.00 for a small, organic chicken

featured_reviews.review_id: You know there is an issue when Whole Foods is cheaper...Famous Foods has been our go to grocery store for our bi-weekly shopping. Over the last three months, the prices have getting higher so we started to track them. In fact, things like cottage cheese have gone up $1 in less than a month. We just went to Whole Foods to compare prices and the same brand butter, milk and other staples were at least $2 cheaper per item. As a neighborhood grocery store in a community which is not know for its wealth, $12 for butter and $9 for milk is outrageous. Increasing prices that quickly is uncalled for and a real scam. We won't be going back again.

featured_reviews.review_id:

featured_reviews.review_text:
We waited for an hour to get a table on Saturday night. It seems like authentic Japanese sushi restaurant. The seafood was fresh.

featured_reviews.review_id: This place is everything about how sushi should be like! They make their own Wasabi in traditional style, use fresh, and choose not to over do the flavor. They cook their Tamago, the egg omelet sushi themselves, unlike some sushi places buy from market. Their Tamayo is very uniquely flavored with strong fragrance. Their Toro tastes buttery, and their octopus is actually soft. Unlike some octopus from other sushi restaurants that taste like chewy rubber. They proudly showcase the fresh, raw taste and texture of each ingredient with delicate seasonings. Service is great, and you get your food served fast. If there's a reason why they only open for 3 hours a day, it would probably be that they want to offer a high quality of restaurant experience. Definitely recommend.

featured_reviews.review_id: This long time Asian Cantonese style restaurant on Victoria st and 51 ave just received a full renovation. it's brighter and mostly in booth sitting now. The menu is updated with a few more specialty dishes added. It opens for dimsum and full dinner and is very popular with the locals so be prepared to wait during the weekend. Reservation is accepted. Parking is pretty much off the surrounding streets. Food is decent and services are energetic and efficient. Prices are reasonable and plate volume is decent so good value for family meals. Recommended if you are in the area with the  bakeries, groceries and medical centers around. Great for lunch and dinner.

featured_reviews.review_id:
My review with comes good intentions because I understand the struggles that small businesses face and I come with feedback and how to move forward with my experience.

Clientele and food: Geriatric consumers. Which is why as a younger person, I need to advocate for the elderly. Our table was the youngest one, the rest are elderly people. Understand that geriatric patients often lose their sense of smell and taste and come with other health problems, HBP, diabetes, etc. As a community, we should be supporting everyone: local business and our community members. Two items are bad items: sui mai (meat stinks and is old, when you bring it near  to consumer it already had foul smell, the chiu chow dumpling was terribly made on a physical level but this is also the 2nd item that is foul (it was at a distance from me and I can already smell it from the table).

Menu: needs to be updated to reflect their items. One error to note is squid tentacles in English but when served, its not tentacles and turns out the Chinese name is just squid. Fried quid tentacles is a rarity so if I see tentacles in English, I will order it. But it is not. You need to update the menu because that is flat out deceiving.

Staff: The good, they have full staff. The bad, inefficient. I assume there is 1-2 front staff that is either the owner or affiliated with the small business because they CARE. They either huddle around and follow each other walking up and down (with the second person behind not doing anything and not looking around). There are quite a few staff that have dyed red hair. The long red hair literally yelled at me to give me the receipt so she can cross it off (this is when she served me "squid tentacles" and it was not tentacles, at that point, I asked my family if I red it wrong because clearly I remember seeing the word tentacles and thought perhaps they are giving us the wrong order. The other 2 red hair ladies have short hair, one with a similar haircut from TVB Moonlight Resonance main villain (ah Hung) tends to do cleanup and will ignore any hand waiving at all times. Regardless, poor service from the short red hair staff.

For the two ladies that have long hair and straight black hair, they were efficient but may also be affiliated with the small business.

Tea: after one round, tea flavor is gone. It took the 3rd person to finally give us new tea leaves.

Payment: tea was waived, I assume its new opening so they are waiving. When asked to pay, they said if I can pay cash because tea is waived. I said no, the staff did not look happy. In a business perspective, some businesses understand that cashless payment versus cash is inevitable and understands the charges for the fees. This comes with the territory of opening a business. Either that, go cash only and understand you will be working with specific niche if that's the way you want to go.

Uses Clover POS system but doesn't take Apple watch payment (tried several times but it says try again). Physical card tap works, had to take out my debit card for transaction to go through.

Rice roll never came, I asked them to take it off the menu. But she said she'll followup; however, I had to tell her firmly to take it off (this was right after the the 2nd item came and was foul). She respectfully said to take it off the menu and also came back with the rice rolls but I was firm and said I don't want it anymore. After I paid, I then told her about the foul food items to which they said, why didn't you tell us? Typical Chinese way will always be "I'll give you a new one" which is what I'm not interested. I was then given a to-go box of pastries free of charge (again turned it down). I have dignity and pride giving honest food reviews and I come from moral values. And I'm also not those terrible customers that take advantage of businesses either for getting free food (to that I say they are scammers).
featured_reviews.review_text:
My review with comes good intentions because I understand the struggles that small businesses face and I come with feedback and how to move forward with my experience.

Clientele and food: Geriatric consumers. Which is why as a younger person, I need to advocate for the elderly. Our table was the youngest one, the rest are elderly people. Understand that geriatric patients often lose their sense of smell and taste and come with other health problems, HBP, diabetes, etc. As a community, we should be supporting everyone: local business and our community members. Two items are bad items: sui mai (meat stinks and is old, when you bring it near  to consumer it already had foul smell, the chiu chow dumpling was terribly made on a physical level but this is also the 2nd item that is foul (it was at a distance from me and I can already smell it from the table).

Menu: needs to be updated to reflect their items. One error to note is squid tentacles in English but when served, its not tentacles and turns out the Chinese name is just squid. Fried quid tentacles is a rarity so if I see tentacles in English, I will order it. But it is not. You need to update the menu because that is flat out deceiving.

Staff: The good, they have full staff. The bad, inefficient. I assume there is 1-2 front staff that is either the owner or affiliated with the small business because they CARE. They either huddle around and follow each other walking up and down (with the second person behind not doing anything and not looking around). There are quite a few staff that have dyed red hair. The long red hair literally yelled at me to give me the receipt so she can cross it off (this is when she served me "squid tentacles" and it was not tentacles, at that point, I asked my family if I red it wrong because clearly I remember seeing the word tentacles and thought perhaps they are giving us the wrong order. The other 2 red hair ladies have short hair, one with a similar haircut from TVB Moonlight Resonance main villain (ah Hung) tends to do cleanup and will ignore any hand waiving at all times. Regardless, poor service from the short red hair staff.

For the two ladies that have long hair and straight black hair, they were efficient but may also be affiliated with the small business.

Tea: after one round, tea flavor is gone. It took the 3rd person to finally give us new tea leaves.

Payment: tea was waived, I assume its new opening so they are waiving. When asked to pay, they said if I can pay cash because tea is waived. I said no, the staff did not look happy. In a business perspective, some businesses understand that cashless payment versus cash is inevitable and understands the charges for the fees. This comes with the territory of opening a business. Either that, go cash only and understand you will be working with specific niche if that's the way you want to go.

Uses Clover POS system but doesn't take Apple watch payment (tried several times but it says try again). Physical card tap works, had to take out my debit card for transaction to go through.

Rice roll never came, I asked them to take it off the menu. But she said she'll followup; however, I had to tell her firmly to take it off (this was right after the the 2nd item came and was foul). She respectfully said to take it off the menu and also came back with the rice rolls but I was firm and said I don't want it anymore. After I paid, I then told her about the foul food items to which they said, why didn't you tell us? Typical Chinese way will always be "I'll give you a new one" which is what I'm not interested. I was then given a to-go box of pastries free of charge (again turned it down). I have dignity and pride giving honest food reviews and I come from moral values. And I'm also not those terrible customers that take advantage of businesses either for getting free food (to that I say they are scammers).

featured_reviews.review_id: From all the social media influencers and reading all the reviews, I had high expectations for this new restaurant. I ordered only their recommended dishes - pork toast, stir-fry basil, and boat noodles. The pork toast was very disappointing. There was barely any pork on the toast, like 95% bread and 5% pork. It just tasted like oily bread. Boat noodles were awful. Noodles were congealed. I couldn't even separate it in the hot soup. I am questioning the freshness of their noodles. Was it cooked a head of time hours ago? Soup was bland. Salt and lots of oil. Meat pieces were tough and chewy. The stir fry basil dish was solid and was the best out of the 3 dishes I ordered. Overall, there are better Thai restaurants that are way more affordable.

featured_reviews.review_id:
One of the latest Thai restaurants to open in Vancouver serving north eastern Thai dishes.

Visited in October and enjoyed some lunch special including the Royal Pad Thai with veggie spring rolls and the Khao Pad Kra Pao Tray which is their holy basil stir fry dish served with crispy toast topped with minced pork.

Their pad Thai comes with a sweet and sour type of sauce (not sure if it was tamarind but it didn't really taste like other tamarind sauces I've had before).

I liked that they asked how spicy we wanted the khao pad kra pao (and specified the difference between Thai spice level vs western spice level). We picked the medium Thai spice level which wasn't excessively spicy but the heat does grow as you continue to eat.

Overall, tasty food. Also liked the Thai lemon tea and cha yen (Thai yes with condensed milk). Would really like to come back to try their curry dish.

Update: Returned in mid-November and tried their appetizer platter, tom yum, green curry chicken, and drunken noodles. They were much busier on this visit (guess the word had gotten out). Loved the translucent noodles in the drunken noodle dish and the green curry rice was amazing. The tom yum soup was spicy and chock full of ingredients. And we enjoyed the items in the platter (crispy pork toast, veggie spring rolls, shrimp wrap, and pork jerky).

featured_reviews.review_id:
My friends and I had the pleasure of dining at Zab Bite restaurant, a gem of a Thai restaurant in town. From the moment we stepped in, the ambiance set the stage for what was an unforgettable evening. The decor, an elegant blend of traditional Thai elements and modern touches, created a welcoming and lively atmosphere.

The service was exceptional. Our server was knowledgeable, attentive, and had great suggestions for our diverse group. We started with Assorted Appetizers, Veggie spring rolls, crispy pork toast, shrimp wrap, and pork jerky. Each dish was a hit, perfectly balanced in flavors and textures.

The main courses were a delightful journey through Thai cuisine. The green curry with chicken was rich and aromatic, with just the right level of spice. The Pad Thai was simply the best I've ever had, with a perfect blend of sweet, sour, and great flavors. We also tried a lesser-known dish, Khao Soi, which was a revelation with its creamy coconut curry and tender noodles.

What truly made the night special was the shared joy of exploring these flavors with friends. The portions were generous, ideal for sharing, and it sparked lively conversations and shared laughter. To end the meal, we indulged in mango sticky rice and Thai iced tea, which were the perfect sweet notes to conclude a fantastic meal.

In summary, Zab Bite restaurant is not just about extraordinary Thai food; it's about the experience of sharing delicious, well-crafted dishes with good company in a beautiful setting. It's a must-visit for anyone looking to enjoy Thai cuisine at its best. A solid 5 stars for the amazing food, ambiance, and service. Can't wait to return!

featured_reviews.review_id: Ordered the "party tray" jollof for a party...supposed to be 6L...not even 2L of rice they gave us. couldn't even feed 3 people if we wanted to, terrible portion size and a straight up scam. nearly 180 dollars for rice that can't even feed 3 people? chai. Taking advantage of the fact that they are the only nigerian restaurant and have become very stingy i do NOT recommend. the chicken they gave us was still clucking...undercooked and bloody. i never see nonsense like this one in my life o. my fellow nigerians, AVOID!! this isn't the first time o, fame don get into they head abeg too overpriced!! featured_reviews.review_id: I had the chance to try an amazing Nigerian dish that left a lasting impression. The rice and beans were cooked to perfection, with a delightful smoky and spicy flavor. The oxtail stew, slow-cooked with a variety of vegetables, added a wonderful texture and taste. The oxtail itself was incredibly tender, practically melting in my mouth. The meal was rounded out with a refreshing cabbage salad and a warm, sweet cornbread. It was a truly satisfying and hearty meal that I would highly recommend to anyone curious about Nigerian cuisine.

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Thanks for your feedback, we are all aware of the inflation and how cost of food supplies have gone up more than 100%, to survive as a business we have to increase prices too. We also get charged 30% for every order that comes through ubereats, we are sure you are not aware of that and we have to factor that into our prices.

As regards to the promo on the app but we don't control the Ubereats app, we are just a platform there- you might want to pass that feedback to them.

We can see from the image you posted that you ordered BBQ Chicken and we can see thats what you got, we do not understand what the problem is? Giving a business 1 star review when we clearly didnt do anything wrong is not fair!

Feel free to share your feedback with uber, but as a company we are very transparent and pride ourselves in delivering great services to our customers.

featured_reviews.review_id:
This is my first time trying this place and also at a shared takeout location. This building is shared by 9 different take out only restaurants and you have to call them to bring out your order. There is free parking all along the street.

I ordered the chicken shawarma through UberEats. The restaurant tried to reach me to tell me they ran out of chicken so some of it will be beef. I did receive a call but the caller ID automatically said "suspected spam" so I didn't answer. They were nice to write me a note with my order to let me know some things were changed. I did get to try both chicken and beef tough. The chicken was soft but the beef to me was a lot tougher. I prefer the chicken so I will try the chicken only again next time. I am a very big fan of sauce and if you like it too, this is a great place for you. The wrap is smothered in sauce and filled with meet and cabbage. If you cannot tolerate spice, the mild would still have a little spice as well. The large version was bigger than a shawarma wrap at other places. However, I found the original price very expensive as it was around $18 for a large wrap. The UberEats BOGO was a very good deal though.

featured_reviews.review_id: New Taiwanese restaurant that just opened up in Marpole. The food tasted pretty good, I especially liked the calamari batter and seasoning as well as the noodle broth flavour. The appetizers are a bit on the pricey side but the rest of the menu seems to be priced like other similar restaurants. The service was good as well.

The food tasted pretty good, I especially liked the calamari batter and seasoning as well as the noodle broth flavour. The appetizers are a bit on the pricey side but the rest of the menu seems to be priced like other similar restaurants. The service was good as well.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Pretty good Taiwanese food overall. Highly recommend the Taiwanese meatball which is a delicacy most restaurants don't offer. It is a tasty meatball made with pork and bamboo shoots and other good flavoured stuff wrapped in a chewy, bouncy, starchy coating similar to a mochi texture. It's almost like a giant dumpling and it is delicious.

The beef noodle soups with thick noodle were just average because there was a thick layer of oil on the soup that was too greasy (if they could just skim off the oil it would be much better in my opinion so you can get to the tasty broth without so much oil). The noodles were also overdone to the point they would snap when you picked it up and they were mushy to eat. The noodles were so soft you couldn't even chew them.

The deep fried pork intestines were very tasty but the portion was quite small for what you pay. The milk teas were average. The Taiwanese deep fried chicken nuggets tasted authentic.

When this restaurant was still in Burnaby 20 years ago, my friends and I used to drive a long way to eat there because it was probably the only place where we could truly taste authentic Taiwanese food. A few days ago, I heard from a friend that this restaurant was opening in Vancouver, and we were filled with excitement. On the day of their official opening, to avoid the crowded crowd, we arrived at five o'clock. The restaurant's decor is simple, but the advertising slogans and pictures on the walls are quite interesting. We ordered some Taiwanese snacks that we had been longing for, including TW Meatball W Pork Bamboo Shoot, Deep Fried Boneless Chicken Thigh Rice, Spicy Pork Ear Slice, and MARINATED BAMBOO SHOOTS. All the dishes still retained the authentic Taiwanese style and flavor. We all enjoyed our meal. When it was time to pay, because they were newly opened, they were selling a Super Value Coupon Book, buy 50 get 50. Each five-dollar voucher came with a note: "$5 Vouchers can only be used per person per transaction." I even asked the staff at that time how to use them. However, to our surprise, when we went to eat there again yesterday, the staff insisted from start to finish that the three of us could only use two five-dollar vouchers. This statement completely contradicted the clear and straightforward rule: "$5 Vouchers can only be used per person per transaction." When we asked the staff for an explanation, she said, "We have always done it this way." "Always"? You just opened recently. We feel this is a deceptive practice and are very disappointed. We hope this company can provide a reasonable explanation.

Note: Thank you, owner , for such a quick response and for resolving our concerns so clearly. I believe excellent quality and honest treatment of customers are important driving forces for a prosperous business.

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Hi Candy,

Sorry for your unpleasant experience.
We have corrected the usage of the redemption of $5 vouchers. If you are still unhappy about the redemptions, we are happy to refund your coupon book. 
Thank you for letting us know your experience. Below are the new guidelines for redemption.

Dear customers, thank you all for your enthusiastic support and love.  All Pearl House vouchers have been sold out.  Due to possible unclear markings on the voucher cover, causing confusion in usage, we deeply apologize.  Here we provide instructions for use. We appreciate your understanding for any inconvenience.  The entire Pearl House team extends their gratitude to you!

Li Juan Yong Fa :
1: $10Li Juan Yu $5Li Juan Bu Neng Bing Yong 
2: $10Li Juan Mei You Xian Zhi Dui Huan Shu Liang 
3: $5Li Juan Mei Ren Mei Dan Xian Yong Yi Zhang  (4Ge Ren Lai Chi Fan Ke Dui Huan 4Zhang $5)
4: Ru Wai Dai , Zhi Neng Dui Huan Yi Zhang $5, 
5: Li Juan Bu Zhao Ling , Bu Neng Dui Huan Xian Jin 
6: Dian Jia Bao Liu Geng Gai Quan Li 

Gift Voucher Usage:
1: $10 gift vouchers cannot be used in conjunction with $5 gift vouchers.
2: There is no limit to the number of $10 gift vouchers that can be redeemed.
3: Each person can only use one $5 gift voucher per order (4 people dining can redeem 4 $5 vouchers).
4: For takeout orders, only one $5 voucher can be redeemed.
5: Gift vouchers have no cash value and no change will be given.
6: The store reserves the right to make changes.

featured_reviews.review_id: Marpole was in dire need of an authentic Taiwanese restaurant and Pearl House fills that gaping hole with delicious Taiwanese dishes. Their beef shank is simmered for 8 hours for a tender bite, their cabbage is infused with garlic, and their fried chicken nuggets are crispy and juicy. The prices are reasonable as well.

featured_reviews.review_id: The food was awesome and that was the reason we bought a few of their gift certificates. While buying them, they did mention there were exceptions on using the $5 certificate that it's limited to 2 per table, but no limitations on the $10 ones. However today after eating in, I was just told that you cannot use the $10 certificate along with the $5 ones? So either you use two $5 or unlimited $10. This was never mentioned when we bought the certificates otherwise we wouldn't have bought so much.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Very solid new place, would be 5 stars if the combo value was just a bit better...

The food quality is quite good, tasted fresh and not overly flavored. The fried rice was excellent, as was the popcorn chicken and calamari.

The 2-item combo would have been great if they just threw in a bowl of plain rice, instead of just giving basically $1 off two items. The daily meal combo needed $3 extra for a drink, which IMHO isn't much of a deal but maybe I'm just too cheap... :of

Overall, very glad they are here and will go back again.

places.name: Mr. Pelmen
places.address: Mr. Pelmen, 302 Industrial Ave, Vancouver, BC V6A 2P3

featured_reviews.review_id:
Mr. Pelmen has the best pelmeni I have ever tried. I have ordered from them many times, tried all the flavours and enjoyed it every single time!
Their lean turkey pelmeni with sour cream sauce is my favourite :)

And their prices are very good, 15 pieces portion is my go-to size

Thank you so much for what you do! I will definitely recommend you to all my friends :)

featured_reviews.review_id:
I am so excited that we finally have something different from Russian cuisine in Vancouver! :)

I love the variety of Pelmeni and sauces that you can choose from. Also, if you order pick up you can actually eat right on the spot as they have a couple of tables outside their industrial kitchen, which is a pretty cool experience, as there is definitely a different vibe!

I have tried all the flavours from Mr. Pelmen and every one of each has its unique taste and presentation! Proud of my fellow citizens and wish your startup prosperity and more and more fresh ideas! <3

PS on the photo: 2 portions of Original pelmeni, lean turkey (spinach dough), fried pelmeni.
